ChIJwdkk5G1ZzB0R_SUVWJpSb6Y.adr_address: De Grendel Wine Estate and Restaurant, Plattekloof Rd, Panorama, Cape Town, 7500, South Africa
ChIJwdkk5G1ZzB0R_SUVWJpSb6Y.formatted_address: De Grendel Wine Estate and Restaurant, Plattekloof Rd, Panorama, Cape Town, 7500, South Africa
ChIJwdkk5G1ZzB0R_SUVWJpSb6Y.name: De Grendel Wine Estate and Restaurant

reviews.text: An amazing lunch with a large group. Professional service of incredible food. The waiters were fantastic and the food was excellent - a perfect combination - if you don't go - you have missed out. Good set menu at a very reasonable price and the menu overall is great. Cannot recommend highly enough!

Perfectly situated at the foot of Tygerberg Mountain this restaurant does not only have the best views over Table Bay and the Mountain but certainly also has the food and wine to match them! Off the beaten track and spectacularly underrated!
Food and service are amazing. Great wines. Nice ambiance and great decor.
Beautiful setting with excellent service and great food. A bit pricey. Great wines. Cheaper to buy a bottle than wine by the glass.

The food was truely amazing. A real journey of culinary sensation without being overwhelming or overtly ostentatious. We visited with a large group and were treated like honoured guests. The view of the ocean and mountain at sunset is breathtaking the the pairing of the wine to the setting and the food was perfect. I never did get the coffee I ordered though, so I'll have to come back soon...

ChIJwdkk5G1ZzB0R_SUVWJpSb6Y.vicinity: De Grendel Wine Estate and Restaurant, Plattekloof Road, Panorama, Cape Town

ChIJj_APpIxXzB0RZCmg0j5_X1M.adr_address: Vissershok Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJj_APpIxXzB0RZCmg0j5_X1M.formatted_address: Vissershok Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJj_APpIxXzB0RZCmg0j5_X1M.name: Meerendal Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Very nice place. Food at the restaurant was good, but the service quite slow.
Very few tables outside and inside was too warm. Bring your bicycle. The place is really nice!
Really amazing spot Stephanie who helped us was really awesome she knew so much about the wine and the farm, top tasting and would definitely recommend a visit to yhis farm 10 outta 10
Watched The Vow with my wife at the Galileo open air cinema. What an experience. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Meerendal have SO much to offer. From wine tastings, an Art at Meerendal art gallery, distillery, bike shop, Carluccis Deli, Crown restaurant, accommodation, hiking and biking trails, park runs on Saturday mornings, live events, HUGE kids play area, and so much more.
Lovely experience especially for the bikers and runners. Restaurants have lovely food in a beautiful setting.

ChIJOdGXRjqozR0RI8Qd4Ez0dTs.adr_address: Baden Powell Dr, Faure, Stellenbosch, 7131, South Africa
ChIJOdGXRjqozR0RI8Qd4Ez0dTs.formatted_address: Baden Powell Dr, Faure, Stellenbosch, 7131, South Africa
ChIJOdGXRjqozR0RI8Qd4Ez0dTs.name: Vergenoegd Wine Estate

reviews.text: Nice 3km /5km marked walking /running route on the farm amongst the vineyards. Saturday market with lovely atmosphere. Watch the duck walk. Wine tasting available. Good Saturday morning out for families.

Awesome place, the blending experiences are a must. Staff are friendly and eager to assist. Greg was well spoken and made the blending experiences fun and educational. 
The duck parade was so cute and a must see.
Thank you vergenoegd wine estate for making our honeymoon trip to the Cape awesome.!!!
Well managed events venue with a beautiful view of Table mountain. I hoped for more food options, but at least there were a small food market and drinks bar. The performance itself was amazing
Very pleasant setting.  Very historic.  Good food and wine.  Ducks a gem.

Duck parade is great, setting is relaxing and beautiful, food options were great, but the kids entertainment options left me furious with the bank robbery of it - R50 for your kid to play on a jumping castle and some other toys, then she wants to paint? R60 please. She wants to go on the train? R10 each, per time. Oh there's a giant fun ball rolling around right next to the stuff part of her R50 wristband? That's an extra R40. And on and on.... and this isn't because these are separate stalls with separate offerings - all one party equipment company with stuff all next to each other in one play area. Enough to turn me off coming here again. Your kid just running around playing for an hour while you relax can cost you over R150 - nevermind if you have more than one child?!

ChIJ9VGvBPtYzB0RJWs1bGxekJQ.adr_address: Tygerberg Valley Rd, Cape Farms, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJ9VGvBPtYzB0RJWs1bGxekJQ.formatted_address: Tygerberg Valley Rd, Cape Farms, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJ9VGvBPtYzB0RJWs1bGxekJQ.name: Durbanville Hills Winery

reviews.text: A wonderful afternoon, excellent, customer service, a very special thanks to the Security Officer on the parking. Food was outstanding and wine tasting done in a very classy way.  Well done to the Management and staff.  Will definately promote.
Great wines. The chef's platter was divine. Service was also good. Overall a lovely afternoon. No complaints.

Beautiful venue, good for conferences, and the food is exceptional. The food portions are perfectly sized to make sure you don't go back to the conference in a food coma, and the flavors are just beautiful.
WOW WOW WOW, what amazing service. Your food is heavenly. Dirk and Marlon, welldone, this is definitely not our last visit.
A great experience. Intimate feeling restaurant with beautiful views and 5 star service.

ChIJO1mizFeozR0RXT7d_wA5J7M.adr_address: Taillefer & Main Road, Southern Paarl, Paarl, 7646, South Africa
ChIJO1mizFeozR0RXT7d_wA5J7M.formatted_address: Taillefer & Main Road, Southern Paarl, Paarl, 7646, South Africa
ChIJO1mizFeozR0RXT7d_wA5J7M.name: Laborie Estate

reviews.text: Pleasant early Sunday lunch with magnificent views of ring of mountains around Paarl. Thank you to friendly Laborie staff...We enjoy our early morning vineyard walks and needed to come say thank you by supporting the restaurant. We were not disappointed. The food is delicious; service is attentive.
A great place to have a meal, any meal. A lovely lovely vibe with a great atmosphere and a beautiful view. Stunning food. Great wine.
Very very good service big portions I would refer to eat the prawns and calamari pasta as a main and the fryed ice cream as dessert I would refer this place to anyone
Ok. No wine tasting or sales. No kids menu. Small climbing frame. Nice terrace. Great fillet and carpaccio. My son thought the pizza was â€˜spectacularâ€™.

The four settings from which you can choose:
1) Wine tasting shaded beneath magnificent overhanging ðŸŒ²'s
2) Wine tasting inside the elegant Cape Dutch wine tasting room
3 +4) Lunch at two different restaurants on-site, each overlooking their own expanse of vinyards

ChIJqZ4XAcKvzR0Rhr9E7o4fXDc.adr_address: Boschendal Estate, Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJqZ4XAcKvzR0Rhr9E7o4fXDc.formatted_address: Boschendal Estate, Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJqZ4XAcKvzR0Rhr9E7o4fXDc.name: Boschendal

reviews.text: Stunning venue. Excellent food at De Werf and beautiful green surroundings. Perfect for a day outing and picnics.
Le picnique. Delightful was to relax. Stunning hamper for two with everything one would need. Blankets, beanbags and back rests provided. Staff are amazing too.
Lovely picnic on the lawn, under the trees. Good picnic hamper, nice variaty.
Good food, great atmosphere in a beautifull setting.The perfect picnic!
Beautiful place for an out of town picnic. Loved it.

ChIJqZ4XAcKvzR0Rhr9E7o4fXDc.vicinity: Boschendal Estate, Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek

ChIJuxNWYrxXzB0RHyPFwu6bd7Y.adr_address: Koeberg Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJuxNWYrxXzB0RHyPFwu6bd7Y.formatted_address: Koeberg Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJuxNWYrxXzB0RHyPFwu6bd7Y.name: Diemersdal Wine Estate

reviews.text: Wine tasting was extremely cheap (R25 for 6 wines) and had a good range of wines to choice from. Beautiful view and good seating inside or outside. Service was a bit lacking but I guess with the price you pay its okay. Ordered a cheese board platter and it was simply out of this world and was really decently price for what you got. After ordering the platter the service picked up and was much better. Overall experience was good.
Great bistro with creative and interesting dishes using seasonal ingredients. Very reasonably priced. Great wines.
Great wines, amazing food, excellent service this is such a lovely place. One of the best winery we have been visited...

Decent wine. We tried to buy a meet platter at the restaurant thatâ€™s 20M away but they where not very cooperative. Didnâ€™t seem to be interested in selling anything. When we did the wine tasting they were very slow with giving us the next one so we ended up going back and forth to the bar every time. Very pretty place but they could put a little more effort in to it.
Hands down Diemersdal makes the best Bordeaux blend I've ever had.

ChIJI9rFCsNNzB0RIip-GCDem_8.adr_address: Polkadraai Rd, Stellenbosch Farms, Cape Town, South Africa
ChIJI9rFCsNNzB0RIip-GCDem_8.formatted_address: Polkadraai Rd, Stellenbosch Farms, Cape Town, South Africa
ChIJI9rFCsNNzB0RIip-GCDem_8.name: Saxenburg Wine Estate

reviews.text: Awesome place. Not to busy. Good food and great wines.

Excellent service, brilliant host friendly and very pleasant. Great wines, Shiraz 2003 is smooth and easy to drink. The spicey 2013 Shiraz is worth a comparison with its older sibling. Generally a great range of wines. Worth a visit at least twice in a visit to Cape Town.
ì¢‹ì•„ìš” ì¢‹ì•„ìš”

ChIJI9rFCsNNzB0RIip-GCDem_8.vicinity: Polkadraai Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Cape Town

ChIJfUGKa_1RzB0R3ZjjCfHwM7o.adr_address: Langverwacht Road, Kuils River, Cape Town, 7579, South Africa
ChIJfUGKa_1RzB0R3ZjjCfHwM7o.formatted_address: Langverwacht Road, Kuils River, Cape Town, 7579, South Africa
ChIJfUGKa_1RzB0R3ZjjCfHwM7o.name: Zevenwacht Wine Estate

reviews.text:
We did some cheese and wine paring. Patrick was very informative and the wines were very nice.
You have variety to choose from with lovely cheese platters.
Also visited the restaurant only had starters as we wanted something light to eat. 
 The farms has a picnic area tasting room and restaurant on site. Nice and cool under the trees. The tasting room has aircon which helped today. 
We will be back to taste the rest of the wine.

Fantastic property with an unbeatable view of Cape Town. The staff are beyond incredible and the food is cooked to perfection. We had all 3 meals of the day there. The rooms are also neat and well spread out over the estate.
6/5 stars. Perfect location. Great local wines, family friendly, dog trail running friendly and great vibe to the wine estate.

Beautiful venue.
If you want to watch the show, avoid security with any inquiries because they are very disrespectful. The sound also cut out during the show. All round (disregarding the security, technical difficulties and expensive drink prices) the vibe is great and they cater for all ie disabled, children, teens and adults. All are welcome and will be entertained.

We came here for wine tasting and it is really nice. On our tour, it was a short trip, so sommelier did not change glasses and we had to use one glass for 4 different type wine. But in general, place is nice and they have really good wines with a very good prices.

ChIJfUGKa_1RzB0R3ZjjCfHwM7o.vicinity: Langverwacht Road, Kuils River, Cape Town

ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.adr_address: Intersection R45 and Simondium-Klapmuts Roads, Franschhoek Wine Route, Simondium, 7670, South Africa
ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.formatted_address: Intersection R45 and Simondium-Klapmuts Roads, Franschhoek Wine Route, Simondium, 7670, South Africa
ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.name: Vrede en Lust Wine Estate

reviews.text: This place just seems to get better and better! Recently renovated to maximize on the surrounding beauty and for customer comfort, this place is a must stop! Not to mention it's completely off grid with 1000-odd solar panels, all wines are in fact Vinified by the sun. Impressive! The added bonus is you can pick up top wines for everyday drinking as well as some for long term investment.

The location is very nice. Everything very modern and settled within the vineyards. Friendly staff and clean rooms. However breakfast is a la carte at the bistro. You get a voucher of R160 per person. We had a warm breakfast and an orange juice/coffee and did overshoot the R160. So we had to pay the difference. For a room with such a price I would expect the breakfast to be included. 
Place is not worth the money - too expensive.
Fantastic vineyard with beautiful buildings and views. Amazing terrace looking out over the vines and mountains. We did the wine and chocolate tasting - amazing! A must place to visit.

Vrede en Lust is an old historic wine farm with a dash of modern. The Lust Bistro serves Sunday buffet at R195 on the first Sunday of the month. The home baked bread they sell, looks devine. Tasty wine. The tasting room is set within a picturesque environment. The farm makes use of solar power. A big plus. There is a electric car charging station. Wow. The first one I've seen so far.

Nice setting and atmosphere, good menu and delicious food, staff are very friendly although waiters at the bistro could be slightly more attentive. Good eco approach with all the photovoltaic panels. Nice selection of wines with knowledgeable hosts and finally a wine farm which can spell Syrah correctly! ðŸ¤—

ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.vicinity: Intersection R45 and Simondium-Klapmuts Roads, Franschhoek Wine Route, Simondium

ChIJTXmFxcGyzR0RTjFwCPkxUiw.adr_address: Middelvlei Wine Estate, Flamingo St, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJTXmFxcGyzR0RTjFwCPkxUiw.formatted_address: Middelvlei Wine Estate, Flamingo St, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJTXmFxcGyzR0RTjFwCPkxUiw.name: Middelvlei Wine Estate

reviews.text: Wonderful wine farm with a working farm full of animals , making it great for families with little kids. The place is full of dogs, donkeys, goats , cows, pigs , tortoiseâ€™s , ducks and chickens . The wine is wonderful and the lunch and tasting deal of home cooked food gives u a real taste of local food. A great break from the posh wineries around town . Loved it!
We had an amazing time at our end year staff party...  We as the AEB Africa team enjoyed every second we spent at middelvlei wine farm. highly recommend....
Delicious boerebraai and excellent wine! Lover the free run pinotage!

What a wonderful day out with the kids! This is the first braai (barbeque) spot that we've found in the Winelands and what a treasure it is! The snoek patÃ© starter and the braai main was fantastic and plentiful! We decided to indulge a bit and added the malva pudding desert to our order which was also good but I think we'll give it a skip next time - the braai is more than enough.

This is a really awesome spot to take the kids. They loved seeing all of the farm animals and the sand pit was an absolute hit as well - thankfully shaded by an outdoor umbrella. They ended the day braaing marshmallows over hot coals and a final quick round on the restaurants scooters and push bikes.

It can get extremely hot out there - there is enough shade for the tables but bring hats and sunblock for walking around the farm.
Beautiful venue, great wine and stunning host!! Will definitely be back!

ChIJTXmFxcGyzR0RTjFwCPkxUiw.vicinity: Middelvlei Wine Estate, Flamingo Street, Stellenbosch

ChIJ1Xz4g1hTzB0RR541YHuhofg.adr_address: Cnr R304 & R101 Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, 7530, South Africa
ChIJ1Xz4g1hTzB0RR541YHuhofg.formatted_address: Cnr R304 & R101 Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, 7530, South Africa
ChIJ1Xz4g1hTzB0RR541YHuhofg.name: Villiera Wines

reviews.text: Very friendly staff and game drive was good with very knowledgeable guide. Self guided tour of wine cellar interesting also.
Wonderful game drive to see wild animals so close. Excellent service as well in the tasting room

Upon arrival we were welcomed very warmly by the staff of Villiera Wines. They were very helpful with their explanation.
We took the game drive tour (a 2 hour safari tour through the lands surrounding the winefarm).
The guide was very professional and had alot of knowledge. We stopped from time to time while coming across zebras, giraffes, antilopes, turtles, eagles, etc...
Everytime we got interesting information concerning the animals.
After the tour we did the winetasting. Again very professionaly done and even turned out to be free (we did buy 3 bottles of wine eventually).
Would definitely recommend.
The environment is perfect and we enjoyed our wine so much
Lovely experience! Lovely wines!

Amazing picnic experience, so relaxing and calming.  Make sure that if you get irritated quickly with children that is running around etc, that you book as far away from the splash fountain/ pool as possible.  Also the food in the basket is delicious and more than enough for two people. Couldn't get enough of the bread and the spreads that came along with it, DELICIOUS!!

Warwick is so beautiful and a lovely place to spend an afternoon. It is set up for families,with kids play areas, a fountain and water feature for them to play in. The food and the wine is very good and the people are friendly. And everybody just love that the kids can play freely, while you sit back,relax and enjoy good wine, food and company. Really a great experience to have!

Overall a great experience. We had s picnic basket under the trees. Although it was a very hot day, it really cool and pleasant under the trees. We also had a wine tasting which added to the experience. The basket of goodies supplied had some great meats and pate selections whilst some of the other preserves and deserts were not so great.

Wonderful place to have a picnic with your family and friends. Very child friendly with a water splash pool and other water features. Several climbing apparatus and slides available. Real appetising and more than enough food per picnic basket for two people. Also have food available for children. Large area for children to run around. Also special picnic pods available, if you do not want to mix with the crowds.

Beautiful venue and great picnic pod. Scrumptious picnic hamper. Possibly enough for three. Could do with a bit more bread though considering conditments and savouries.  Suitable wine offer at reasonable prices. Service level acceptable to good. Suitable for families with kiddies or not.

ChIJezjaVvNNzB0RfNLvlumxjjI.adr_address: Stellenbosch Kloof Road, Vlottenberg, Stellenbosch, 7604, South Africa
ChIJezjaVvNNzB0RfNLvlumxjjI.formatted_address: Stellenbosch Kloof Road, Vlottenberg, Stellenbosch, 7604, South Africa
ChIJezjaVvNNzB0RfNLvlumxjjI.name: Jordan Wine Estate

reviews.text: Love this wine estate. Recently did the picnic on the lawn. Great experience though the staff could have been more clear about letting us know how the picnic worked and what we were supposed to do. Other than that it was a great time.
Excellent wine tasting service. The person that helped us was very friendly, very knowledgeable about the wine and the estate. Very pleasant atmosphere, was busy but one did not feel rushed.
Wonderful views, friendly staff, excellent food and wine... A great venue to relax and feel spoilt.
Absolutely awesome wineyard and restaurant. We had breakfast here and loved it. Winetasting afterwards and sunshine. What else do you need?
Nice, but why they did not put up the umbrellas when first asked, I don't know.

ChIJ129hMOeszR0RUhcgNrQGlZM.adr_address: Fischers Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7579, South Africa
ChIJ129hMOeszR0RUhcgNrQGlZM.formatted_address: Fischers Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7579, South Africa
ChIJ129hMOeszR0RUhcgNrQGlZM.name: Goede Hoop Wine Estate

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time with Johan, the son of the owner, that spend the whole afternoon explaining us the history of the farm and the region. It was a true wine tasting experience and not some commercial fake touristy experience. Thanks for that Johan!
Excellent wines

Hierdie wynmaker is dalk nie so algemeen bekend nie, maar lewer van die beste wyne waarmee ons al te doen gehad het. Ons het ook al in opvolgende oesjare Goede Hoop probeer en bly die wyne uitstekend so asof elke jaar 'n goeie oesjaar was. Die wymaker het duidelik in-diepte kennis van die fyner kuns van wynmaak en sorg deurgaans vir aangename wyne wat weer en weer gekoop kan word. Die Merlot is veral uitstekend.

ChIJkRI7hCWyzR0R-hs6Dd6d5os.adr_address: 1 Lanzerac Rd, Jonkershoek, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJkRI7hCWyzR0R-hs6Dd6d5os.formatted_address: 1 Lanzerac Rd, Jonkershoek, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJkRI7hCWyzR0R-hs6Dd6d5os.name: Lanzerac Wine Estate

reviews.text: I always enjoy my time with friends at Lanzerac Deli. I love the atmosphere  lovely verandah and of course the best sons in town. My friends are always impressed with my choice.
Wooooow mind blowing experience. Will sure be going back... had most memorable time.  Excellent staff and customer care
Beautiful place very quiet friendly staff excellent service come nd see urself u feel weLume at the lanzerac hotel
5-Star. Had a fire in 2017 so busy  with exciting renovations
Great wine estate! Must try Mrs. English chardonnay!

ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.adr_address: Kromme Rhee Rd, Stellenbosch, Cape Town, 7605, South Africa
ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.formatted_address: Kromme Rhee Rd, Stellenbosch, Cape Town, 7605, South Africa
ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.name: Simonsig Wine Estate

reviews.text: What a great place. Very generous with the amounts of wine during the tasting. Great staff with a lot of knowledge. Lovely wines. Very rich in flavor, more like the traditional french wines, so it must be your thing.

Arrived at the Wine Estate and was greeted with a smile. Had the most awesome day there. The guy who helped us were professional and friendly. He also explained each wine every time. I would really go there again and again.

Simonsig is on your way to Stellenbosch, right before you get to the Knorhoek region. They are known for the Champaign, I mean "Sparkling" that dates back to the late 1960s.  With a wide range of red and whites to choose from, makes sure to start with the sparkling as this is what they are known for and worth the price.
Great place. Friendly service. Disappointing tasting. Presenter to busy with other tables. No conversation about wine.

Nice wine. Not my favorites but they have a very large selection that you can choose from. Beautiful view but the steak for lunch was absolutely fantastic. My knife just fell through the meat it was so tender.

ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.vicinity: Kromme Rhee Road, Stellenbosch, Cape Town

ChIJDcvt0Z-pzR0RB8C1fxZNr8s.adr_address: Suid-Agter-Paarl Rd, Suider-Paarl, 7646, South Africa
ChIJDcvt0Z-pzR0RB8C1fxZNr8s.name: Fairview Wine and Cheese

reviews.text: I visited the winery and did a wine and cheese tasting which was fab!! It was the sit- down tasting with 8 wines paired with 8 cheeses for R80 and we only tasted the best... a real treat. Will definitely take friends and family!!

Just love the natural beauty of this place. Eye candy everywhere. The wine tasting with cheese pairing was divine, and very informative. Found a new favorite wine as well. Very friendly staff as well. A must, before heading over to CBC for beer tasting.

It has absolutely beautiful gardens and views. The wine tasting however, was overcrowded and the cheese looked like it had been in the open for too long. I recommend going for a wine and cheese tasting just before tourist season so it isn't too hot or too full. The wine is great. I recommend this place.

Enjoy the beautiful rural environment and feel, the inspiring and peaceful scenery, good selection of cheese and wine, well positioned restaurant and altogether healthy change of pace in your heart and mind. The variety of fresh bread, cheese and jams on sale are highly recommended and can easily become a scrumptious family meal.

What an awesome experience.  Friendly staff. An immense array of cheeses and olive oil to die for. We ate very well in a beautiful cool setting under trees. I did find the chairs to be very uncomfortable. I highly recommend this place.

ChIJz7smy7WtzR0RNVd0R7el4Ms.adr_address: Knorhoek Road, Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJz7smy7WtzR0RNVd0R7el4Ms.formatted_address: Knorhoek Road, Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJz7smy7WtzR0RNVd0R7el4Ms.name: Muratie Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Wonderful informal wine tasting! We chose to have the standard tasting as well as the fortified wine and chocolate ðŸ« pairing. Both were amazing and this resulted in us buying their Cape Ruby NV.

The tasting room is old and has cobwebs ðŸ•¸ everywhere! The building also looks dilapidated, but that's part of the charm. Make sure you ask why everything is the way it is (it's not because they're workshy)

Lovely outdoor seating in the shade of mature trees. The Restaurant serve a range of dishes from traditional tripe to vegetarian. The road to the Estate is surfaced. The patio area can be reached by a ramp.
Very nice very old well kept cape dutch buildings. Definately in the top wine producers in SA

Murati is in the neck of Stellenbosh, located in one of the most beautiful geographical landscapes of the Western Cape. This could very possibly be the oldest and one of the first wine farms in South Africa. The tasting room and most part of the wine estate has been left untouched and intacted with the famous cobwebs from the early 1700s.
Stunning venue steeped in rich history, amazing wines, delicious foods at the restaurant and great attentive service.

ChIJ8dg2GQZqzB0RdaskDQc6xoQ.adr_address: Steenberg Rd, Tokai, Cape Town, 7945, South Africa
ChIJ8dg2GQZqzB0RdaskDQc6xoQ.formatted_address: Steenberg Rd, Tokai, Cape Town, 7945, South Africa
ChIJ8dg2GQZqzB0RdaskDQc6xoQ.name: Steenberg Vineyards

reviews.text: A beautiful place to visit and the food is outstanding. There are wine tastings available. Menu is a but pricey but the food is worth it. Don't miss the resident black piggy who is very fat and friendly.
Very nice wine tasting area with a very modern design. Good for a big group or small. Good selection of wines available for tasting to enjoy with the lovely views.
Loved it. Beautiful and elegant place. Well looked after

Steenberg Vineyards will remain a special place in my heart not only because of absolutely wonderful scenery, architecture, modern and sleek design, amazing wines and food, but especially because of the warm and kind people that welcome you like a member of their family.
They very nice wine tasting area and 1682 bistro light meal menu is very gd.

ChIJc8RkIvBMzB0R28RCs0VvhMM.adr_address: R310 Baden Powell Drive, Stellenbosch, 7603, South Africa
ChIJc8RkIvBMzB0R28RCs0VvhMM.formatted_address: R310 Baden Powell Drive, Stellenbosch, 7603, South Africa
ChIJc8RkIvBMzB0R28RCs0VvhMM.name: Spier Wine Farm

reviews.text: Located on the outskirts of the beautiful Stellenbosch, Spier Wine Farm is a magnificent day out for the entire family. Boasting a sprawling wine farm one can expect delicious meals and desserts from the restaurant to go with the ample options of wine tasting. A bird sanctuary provides an amazing an educational activity for children and adults alike to interact with birds of pray as well as to watch a live bird show with a trained falcon handler.

Very spacious room, staff were helpful. Spacing of the rooms make you feel like you are not on top of each other. 

The hotel restaurant could be staffed with more waiters. Often had to wait to be helped for breakfast. 

Wonderful experience overall.

Beautiful property and modern ambience. Great wine tasting experience. The room is roomy and nice with fireplace.  The facility is well maintained but it is relatively more expensive comparing to other wineries.  The wine farm is not open for tourists or hotel guests.  The breakfast is good, so as the dinner with garden sitting.  The wine tasting area is also nice with garden view.

I was here for a 3 days conference, it does not look like the usual conference venue, but it is indeed a great venue with all the facilities and amenities. Much laid back. I also ate in the Eight restaurant, very romantic, especially at night. There is a complimentary breakfast, really good breakfast and free wifi. You also get the farm experience. It is just off the road R310 from Cape Town so it is hard to miss it. Recommended.

Gorgeous estate, friendly staff. Rooms were nice but a bit dated. Breakfast was lovely but R120 per child is pricey given they each only ate a side plate full. Wine tasting was amazing...love Spier wines! The highlight was the Segway around the vineyards; the crew are amazing and the tour was breathtakingly beautiful.

ChIJPwwprfW8zR0RrtBhy6raMVU.adr_address: 40 Uitkyk St, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJPwwprfW8zR0RrtBhy6raMVU.name: Chamonix Wine Farm

reviews.text: Only ok compared to other vineyards in the region. Staff were nice but setting and wine was average
Their tasting room isnâ€™t half as fancy as others in the area - but if itâ€™s award winning world class wine youâ€™re after, then this is the place.
New Year's Eve 2017 was well catered for with  good food, DJ and Kaapse Klopse.
A brilliant wine farm, host and vibe! The Chardonnay and Point Noir are an absolute must!

Quite esquisite and comfortable place. Everyone was very friendly and The food was divine.
We didn't stayed at the place or did The Wine tour (since we already did several of these tours), we chose to only stay at the restaurant and Enjoy the place.
Everything was excelent. 

The menu offered just 4 options of main courses, but what it seems to lack in variety, it really compensates on the quality. There's also a vegetarian options which in no way falls behind the meats.

Desserts are well harmonized and The coffe has its grains grinded almost in front of you.

We ordered two wines, The first one we tried to chose and The second one we ask for a recommendation (The first was good, but be should have listened The staff from de begining - hahahaha).

In the end, a lunch with 2 good wines, 2 entres, 3 main courses, 2 desserts and 1 espresso was around 500 rand (tip included).
Totally worth it.

ChIJv1FWi40GzR0RSQYN42WLAVo.adr_address: R44, Windmeul, Western Cape, Paarl, 7630, South Africa

ChIJv1FWi40GzR0RSQYN42WLAVo.name: Nelson Wine Estate

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. Calm relaxed and wonderfull people.Advocate Nelson owner of the farm..driiped with humbleness and humanity..God bless you
What a 5 star place: rolling lawns, catering services, pool - an oasis in the middle of nowhere. Calm, relaxing environment

It was really great attending the South African Medical-Legal Mediation Training there in July 2016 with my friend and colleague from the Department of Philosophy at the University of Stellenbosch. The ambiance, the decor, the courtesy, the food, and the wine were all splendid. I highly and unreservedly recommend the Nelson Wine Estate for any guests as groups, couples, or individuals.
A lovely place to host an event...ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ
Excellent for family

ChIJfa-84cZSzB0RXxKSgCmmIFg.adr_address: Bottelary Road, Cape Town, South Africa
ChIJfa-84cZSzB0RXxKSgCmmIFg.formatted_address: Bottelary Road, Cape Town, South Africa
ChIJfa-84cZSzB0RXxKSgCmmIFg.name: Hartenberg Wine Estate

reviews.text: We were Superbly looked after. The picnic was an exciting treasure trove of delectable delights. The white wine was refreshing and crisp , ideal for a hot day. The kids were kept entertained and satisfied. All in all a truly memorable experience, we'll be back! Soon!

Been here a few times, twice for my wife's birthday. Beautiful wine farm, amazing place to have a relaxing picnic under the trees. Picnic baskets available are delicious and very filling! The wine is absolutely amazing as well!
Amazing wine tasting venue with really great wine and simple snack platters. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.
Excellent wines and beautiful landscapes
Perfect wine ,food and even picnic

ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.adr_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franchhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.formatted_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franchhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.name: Boschendal Wine Estate

reviews.text: Beautiful scenery. Like the huge mountain and beautiful trees. It's an isolated area where its just nature and the venue. Beautiful place for weddings. Can also come wine and dine.

Hawaii and California has a baby and it is called Boschendal!! We love sitting under a MASSIVE tree and sipping some pretty good wine. We experimented a little on what they had to offered and we found some new flavors that we didnâ€™t know we liked!! The Riesling is dry - too dry for my taste but my husband liked it. The S&M was my favorite. The staff was attentive without being pushy or overbearing. 

We ended up buying the brandy.

Our Cape Town host brought us here especially and we are glad she did. A very beautiful and picturesque winery/garden. After visiting a few other wineries, it was very pleasant to spend some time walking around the grounds and enjoying the atmosphere.

After exploring, we settled in for some decadent chocolates and another fine set of wine tasting. I particularly enjoyed the Brandy and sparkling wine options.
great place to visit. You can take the winery tour, test test and buy many different wines. You can also have a nice lunch there.
Excellent. Professional and friendly staff. Wonderful outdoor activities & wine tasting.

ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.vicinity: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franchhoek

ChIJEVLz_2yyzR0RVZ5iKIiMmGA.adr_address: Ida's Valley, Lelie St, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJEVLz_2yyzR0RVZ5iKIiMmGA.formatted_address: Ida's Valley, Lelie St, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJEVLz_2yyzR0RVZ5iKIiMmGA.name: Glenelly Estate

reviews.text: Try the Lady May, a true experience sitting on the balcony overlooking the vineyards. The friendliest service makes this a must visit. When there pop into the gallery as well. Exceptional glass pieces.
The best meal in the greatest ambiance in 2017 for me.  A great little secret

Great wine sales knowledge and tact, no mention of paying for the tasting prior to being introduced to the wines and being offered mineral water gratis. The vine restaurant looks perfect for a medium sized gathering. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Paved drive to the tasting rooms. Clean and well maintained facilties. Beautiful vistas of the surrounds. Can recommend the Lady May wine!
Loved this winery - amazing wines, beautiful tasting room & friendly staff!
Great wines and views. One of my absolute favorite wine farms

ChIJfYoifVqszR0RzuyPJbSksKw.adr_address: R44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJfYoifVqszR0RzuyPJbSksKw.name: Uitkyk Wine Estate

reviews.text: This was our favourite wine we had in South Africa. First we had a bottle at V and A waterfront. Ask for a good local wine and this was what we were served. We loved it that much about a week later we came here to where it was made. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.
Nice place. Good wine. Indoor and outdoor seatings. Very good staff.

The wines are fantastic and so is the setting but the staff do the wine tasting centre a disservice. If you visit on a Sunday, make sure you order your wine tasting by 15:29 because apparently the tastings stop at 15:30 and there are "wine sales" until 16:00. 

Begrudgingly we were allowed to taste at 15:40 but I'm not sure Speed Wine Tasting is a   passtime that will go mainstream. Such a shame because the first two times I came here we thoroughly enjoyed it.
Lovely romantic venue with the most beautiful view. The wine isn't too bad either.
Awesome little gem. Both brandy and wine tasting. Brilliant service on a beautiful estate.

ChIJhfdWtrRZzB0RvrBvF0enYwA.adr_address: Cape Farms, Cape Town, South Africa
ChIJhfdWtrRZzB0RvrBvF0enYwA.formatted_address: Cape Farms, Cape Town, South Africa
ChIJhfdWtrRZzB0RvrBvF0enYwA.name: Hillcrest Estate

reviews.text: Restaurant is really nice with beautiful views down the valley to the sea. Both breakfast and lunch was very good. I particularly enjoyed the burger. Parents - there is no specific play area. But for older kids there is a grass outdoor section they can run around on.
Me outdoor beer and wine garden is great, beer and pizzas were very good. Nice to mix in to your MTB ride

Worst pizza ever. So dry it could double for frisby. Got served by barman, as there are no waiters, which told us there are actually two restaurants after we sat down? Should there not be someone to greet us at entrance to explain that?
We both went to the toilet about 4 times after!!!

Took my wife for breakfast on her birthday - very disappointed. Small breakfast menu & overpriced. Ordered the pancake breakfast and got served last weeks pancakes. Very stale and brittle, could not cut it, complained to manager who offered to tell the chef, and did not charge us for the 1 breakfast. Will not be going back, disappointing, as it was one of our favorite places for breakfast.
Overpriced food and drinks. Service abysmal. Setting is nice..woo friggin hoo

ChIJteN-m46vzR0Rs2Tx2gNjzXc.adr_address: Delta Road & R45, Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJteN-m46vzR0Rs2Tx2gNjzXc.formatted_address: Delta Road & R45, Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJteN-m46vzR0Rs2Tx2gNjzXc.name: Solms Delta Wine Estate

reviews.text: Solms Delta shares profits and ownership equally with their workers, which is cool. They have a small music museum on the property with a touchscreen  AV presentation of local instruments - some of these actual instruments are on display in the room. The staff are friendly and the wine farm itself is lovely. The wine's not terrible.

Nice winery. We arrived late in the day, just before closing time. The staff was very friendly and shared with us their story. The owner of the vineyard takes a personal interest in the lives of his staff. He invests heavily into their future and livelihood.
Try the Jazz Shiraz; I found it fun and refreshing after a day full of wines.

I don't know much about the wine here, but I know that we ordered food, waited for it for 50 minutes with no explanantion or apologies, had to tell our waitress that we didn't have time to eat, payed the full price for getting it as take away and got food that was at best "okey" and that we had to eat on the bus. We talked to a manager that seemed nice and was very concerned about the situation.
Amazing place. Very historical and a nice place to have a picnic. Also has amazing wine. Highly recommend
Had a refreshing glass of wine and a cheese platter for Â£3 per head served by a very knowlegable lady who explained what we were drinking.   Very tidy estate with two museums

Beautiful scenery. You can walk through many different types of gardens and see what is being grown there. The mountains in the back make it almost look surreal. They have great food as well and a nice wine tasting room. It is pretty hot though depending on the time of the year.

An excellent choice for people who loves the outdoors. Walk through rows of plants and enjoy the tranquility of water. There is farm animals, from a donkey to turkeys. Do be careful of the guinea fowls because they tend to be aggressive. A guinea fowl attacked my two year old niece leaving her with a cut on her forehead. It is probably not the best place for small children as there is a bridge over a river. There are also deep squared pools of water and one area has poisonous plants. There is a bord that clearly states that no children are allowed in the area where the poisonous plants are. It is a beautiful estate with trails for the hiking enthusiasts with a maze to get lost in.

There is a restaurant with freshly prepared food. Everything is made from scratch in their kitchen with ingredients from the farm. I have to commend them for having gluten free options for the person whom cannot tolerate gluten. The only criticism from my side is that the menu can have a bigger variety to choose from. Other than that, the food was excellent and cleverly garnished.

A good mix of nature, adventure and excellent food to end your positive experience.

Probably one of our most favourite places on our trip. The gardens are gorgeous, lush and fragrant and the free-roaming animals look very happy. We had a late lunch in the greenhouse and it was a wonderful experience. The food was delicious and the service great.
The shop with homemade products is really nice and has a great, if somewhat pricey, selection of jams, biltong, cheese and more. Highly recommended!

A truly amazing wine estate with lovely gardens that you can wander through at your leisure. We had a really good lunch at the Glasshouse restaurant. Highly recommend. You can easily spend a good part of your day at this estate.

Very touristy!
R10.00 per person entrance fee to get into the farm.
Not a pleasant experience, I think booking over the tourist season is essential, since there is no place to eat or drink without a long waiting time if you do not have a booking.
Gardens is spectacular, but we nearly died of thirst!

ChIJDyjhGNWszR0RHUcJ7CDy8A0.adr_address: Bottelary Rd, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJDyjhGNWszR0RHUcJ7CDy8A0.formatted_address: Bottelary Rd, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJDyjhGNWszR0RHUcJ7CDy8A0.name: Hazendal Wine Estate

reviews.text: I went for a picnic at Hazendal wine estate, it was wonderful, good value for money. Wide selection of foods, great wine. An intimate setting, well informed staff regarding wine and very helpful. I would really recommend it to anyone.
Rustic and tranquil.  Delicious Ploughmans Platter.  Lovely affordable wine selection.

Very nice setting. Hosted a Kiddies birthday Party there during the summer. Enough space for a jumping castle and kiddies tables. They have outdoor seating and setup for adults, and do platters. Very accommodating. Did have some guests remark on comments made by the staff which werent nice, but staff apologised.
Best value for money..  Baskets are awesome and the wine is great..
The food is limited, the service is non existent. The fish my wife order was not deboned. And they payed more attention to the big function in the inside venue than to the Customers outside.

ChIJMw3E3VeozR0RIZTeETtgutU.adr_address: PO Box 602, Paarl South, 7624, Klein Drakenstein, Paarl, South Africa, Paarl, 7624, South Africa

ChIJMw3E3VeozR0RIZTeETtgutU.name: Avondale Wine

reviews.text: Unique wines, as Nature intended them - no chemicals in the vineyards or the cellar. Beautiful fruit, clean and delicious!
Hotel was good staff very helpful and food was mcwaaaaa
Very nice restaurant, very attentive service, amazing food and lovely garden
Very professional and very nice wi es
Excellent food, best ingredients. Beautiful location at Avondale wine farm.

ChIJMw3E3VeozR0RIZTeETtgutU.vicinity: PO Box 602, Paarl South, 7624, Klein Drakenstein, Paarl, South Africa, Paarl

reviews.text:
Pros:
-The most succulent sticky pork ribs that I (and therefore nowy wife) has ever had
-Great setting with great views
-Deli with great products before you head on home
-Lastly: The entrance to this wine estate may perhaps be the most beautiful we have encountered so far

Cons:
-Not much
-No space to hang your hammock for a nap after your hefty lunch (a man can dream, can't he?)

Always great atmosphere. Super food and very friendly staff. Pitty about the patrons....at two seperate tables people sitting with feet o. The tables. One woman and one man. This is a restaurant!!!
Go do this at home!!! Not in public!!!
Enjoy crafted beer and a sumptuous sliced meat and cheese platter under the trees in a lovely garden. Wonderful lazy experience.
Good food and beer with a venue that plays its part.
Lovely place, offers a large variety of wines. The tasting was great fun.

ChIJo-mk98RpzB0RbIsX_oD4mW4.adr_address: 37 Klein Constantia Rd, Nova Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa

reviews.text: Wonderful views. Great service. Limited menu though. Well priced.
Top quality, small but excellent menu,Lovely ambience, knowlegable waitrons
The best place on earth. The best wine. The owner is an absolute gentleman.
Very spacious win farm nd amazing views
Small and beautiful. Friendly staff, great history behind the wine, superb vin de Constance, the whole family felt being home. Donâ€™t hesitate.

ChIJo-mk98RpzB0RbIsX_oD4mW4.vicinity: 37 Klein Constantia Road, Nova Constantia, Cape Town

reviews.text: This is the place where all started where CBD the name and the dream that I always wanted for people and for children and unique and special way of training skills sufficiency and also your best labour supporter recruiting and also investing into the future.
Beautiful outdoor area for wine tasting or dining. Lovely views. Restaurant offers good value for money.
Had our wedding here in late March was such a great day weather was perfect the food was outstanding and the staff were friendly and helpful 5/5!
Fantastic food... unbelievable relaxed vibe. Would definitely recommend a trip out of town to come chill out here.
Good food. Clean air. Relaxing atmosphere.

ChIJTVDQcMe0zR0RKCKAWOgRJgE.adr_address: R44 Road , Strand Road , Somerset West, 7129, Western Cape, South Africa, Somerset West, Raithby, 7129, South Africa
ChIJTVDQcMe0zR0RKCKAWOgRJgE.formatted_address: R44 Road , Strand Road , Somerset West, 7129, Western Cape, South Africa, Somerset West, Raithby, 7129, South Africa
ChIJTVDQcMe0zR0RKCKAWOgRJgE.name: Avontuur Winery

reviews.text: We found ourselves in Somerset West at 4pm and all about us was closed. Google maps told us that this restaurant was open until 5 pm. So off we went. From the moment we went in we were met with wonderful, friendly and informative service. The food was outstanding, the ambience was magnificent. The wine was delicious. We would definitely like to return.

Nice surroundings and good service. Food very pretty but very average otherwise. Wine extremely expensive considering it is produced on site.
Bit of a rip off and obviously not aimed at the locals.
Amazing selection of wines to taste. You get to choose any 5 wines of your choice. Their food is just as amazing accompanied by a breathtaking view over Stellenbosch.
Loved the wine and nougat/fudge pairing from avontuur winery, but unfortunately there's no option to swop the alcohol for a non alcoholic tasting with the fudge
A lovely experience with gorgeous views and food. Well worth a visit.

ChIJTVDQcMe0zR0RKCKAWOgRJgE.vicinity: R44 Road , Strand Road , Somerset West, 7129, Western Cape, South Africa, Raithby

reviews.text: Lovely, absolutely wonderful service! Highly recommended! #ChefLesli-Ann
Lovely restaurant at bon amis with an excellent play area for kids.  Great breakfasts.  And some awesome mtb trails.  Ranging from super kid friendly to more challenging
Great place for kids
Brilliant mtb playground
Great Place.

ChIJfWGVArtRzB0RFGQDAI3bw-0.name: Kaapzicht Wine Estate

reviews.text: Beautiful family run wine estate. Friendly service and amazing wines

The setting of this vineyard is spectacular and the wines were among the best I tasted while in South Africa (and I tasted quite a few!) Danie and his family were so friendly and welcoming. I'd highly recommend a trip to anyone wanting to see a real working vineyard and learn more about wine making while tasting some incredible wines...also make sure you try the port and ice wine while you're there- unique and delicious!

One of the most beautiful spots on the Cape, with top notch, honest wines to boot. This is a functioning wine farm, not a billionaires show home, which means you can see production from grape to glass, (if your lucky taste each stage too!) and meet the people that love their craft.
Ideal for wine tasting and venues. The best Hanepoot Muskadel ever tasted.

Just opened a bottle of the 2012 Steyler Pinotage which we purchased untasted, along with some other wines, what a gem. This was the first winery we visited on a month trip around Western Provence last Sep, apart from the six national parks visited the wineries of the area are a great draw card and some of the most picturesque in the world. Well after 30 plus wineries this was in the top three "my personal favourite", might not have the wow factor of some but makes up by being family owned and this comes through their wines. Back to the 2012 Pinotage "superb" must return for more "little problem we live in Australia!" Oh well better savour the next glass before the wife gets more, cheers.

ChIJfWGVArtRzB0RqgUd7P5UI4E.adr_address: Bottelary road, M23, Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, 7605, South Africa
ChIJfWGVArtRzB0RqgUd7P5UI4E.formatted_address: Bottelary road, M23, Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, 7605, South Africa

reviews.text: Mooiplaas is the best farm ever to have a picnic, wine tastings, hiking trails, horse riding, and so much more on this farm. my experience i had is the friendly staff and the excellent wine!
Very nice hiking trail and very friendly and homily family
Really poor service (they were watching tv and we had to hunt for them to finish our wine tasting), overpriced, boring picnic baskets and for a wine farm, they were very reluctant to sell us wine

Beautiful scenery 
Peaceful and outstanding wine
Tranquil setting. Very beautiful.

ChIJ24n5HiKlzR0R8sScy5Pak5w.adr_address: R301, Franschhoek Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa

reviews.text: Nice spot. Awesome wine. They can improve on their way  of tasting and buying. Example. ...wavering your tasting fees if you spend like over R10000 on their wines. nevertheless great wines.

A small vineyard compared to others in the valley, but with a really good choice of wine, and wonderful tasting wines. The tasting room is small too but well furnished, and with a porch facing the vineyard and the hills with an astonishing view
Very nice wines. A small place with a personal touch.
Really luv this place
Sensationeller Wein,sehr persoenliche Weinprobe,

ChIJq-MPFc6yzR0R1LrmWLHFqdM.adr_address: Skilpadvlei Farm, M12 Polkadraai Road, Stellenbosch, Cape Town, 7604, South Africa
ChIJq-MPFc6yzR0R1LrmWLHFqdM.formatted_address: Skilpadvlei Farm, M12 Polkadraai Road, Stellenbosch, Cape Town, 7604, South Africa
ChIJq-MPFc6yzR0R1LrmWLHFqdM.name: Skilpadvlei Wine Estate

reviews.text: We used this venue for a weekend getaway and conference facility. Absolutely a wonderful experience and great service! The conference room was in a big hall that could be altered to the size we need and the adjoining kitchen supplied the catering for the event. There is a restaurant with beautiful views of the winelands, large kids play area, wine tasting venue and the most beautiful accommodation. Heidi and Jessica assisted me with the planning and nothing was too much to ask. The beautiful and thoughtful welcome gift was such a lovely surprise.

Wine farm is quaint and peaceful however we were terribly disappointed with the accommodation. Room was quite clinical. Shower drainage was clogged which was enough to make us want to check out that night. No drinking water was provided in the fridge and the staff were pretty unfriendly when weâ€™d asked for our coffee to brought to our room. The pool is a far walk from rooms but closer to the self catering units. I wouldnâ€™t recommend this place if youâ€™re looking for luxury, comfort or feels of home. This is more of a short stop to sleep (and shower) if you have to!
Kids friendly. Indoor and outdoors play areas. Nice atmosphere with a great menu. Friendly staff. Definitely a place to consider for lunch with friends or family.
I always have a great time here. The beautiful outdoors great views even better food and the most helpful and attentive staff makes the experience all the better.
Good food and nice view. Not so busy and the music is chilled. Very enjoyable

ChIJq-MPFc6yzR0R1LrmWLHFqdM.vicinity: Skilpadvlei Farm, M12 Polkadraai Road, Stellenbosch, Cape Town

What a gem! Great service, great wine and food. Staff is amazing. Toddler friendly.

ChIJoanQL9y0zR0R-NydFomw4kQ.vicinity: Yonder Hill Wine Farm, R44 Strand Road, Stellenbosch, Western Cape, South Africa

reviews.text: This is a brilliant little hidden gem. The restaurant is relatively new and to our surprise was already fully booked when we got there on the Sunday morning around 11:00. That didn't stop the manager from squeezing us in to one of the lounge corners to allow us a taste of their wine and pizza. Both were 10/10 By the way. Beautiful thin crusted pizza (changed to my liking as I'm a picky eater) and a well balanced wine selections. The tasting was presented by a very talented and knowledgeable young guy and I can't say more than very well done to this group! Great atmosphere!! You will most definitely see us again!
Lovely wine, best sauvignon blanc, pinotage and cinsaut! Delicious pizzas and wine pairing
Wonderful food and wine, reasonably priced. Beautiful view.
Very cosy. Great food and wine
Great wines.. yummy pizzas!!

ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.adr_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franshhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.formatted_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franshhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.name: Boschendal

reviews.text:
Great outdoor picnic spot. We visited the Rhone Rose Garden which is a full service picnic area. We had a lovely table under the trees with loads of lawn space for the kids to run around. Bring a ball to add to the fun.

The picnic baskets were packed to the brim filled with yummy snacks... Some a little more intense than I'm used to such as the farm style chicken liver but it was all very tasty.

Everything single packed in plastic, and with the wind, the plastic was blowing around everywhere. The food and wine were decent enough, and the landscape is beautiful, but the plastic totally ruins the experience.
5 stars all round. Amazing food. Amazing view. Amazing accommodation!
Amazing food and wine in an even more amazing setting under oak trees that date back to 1682

The setting was absolutely stunning with the Rhone seated picnics being a great, novel idea.

Despite having very generous portions, for the price the picnic had some very poorly made elements. The humus was hard and seemed old. Also the cabbage salad was very roughly cut, totally dry with some elements of the salad that seemed to be bits of skin and even a few unwashed radishes in it. 

There was also a 10 % service charge for the table which would be fair enough however there is not enough service to justify this. We had a table for 14, the picnics were dumped in a pile, we then cleared up all the plates at the end. As well as this we needed to get up a few times to order drinks. This was by no means the fault of the waitress rather the fact that they were over loaded.

Lastly I felt that as the picnic was packed in advance it was very wasteful in the amount of excess packaging they created. 

It was such an amazing location, I hope that these can be remedied as it could be so much better.

ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.vicinity: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franshhoek

reviews.text: My wife and I visited Grande Provence Heritage Wine Estate in October 2016. Ordered a supply of their wine and had it shipped to my home in Florida. Just opened a bottle and found it to be superb as it was when we tasted it at the wine estate. Had a great tour and conversation with the employees while visiting in 2016. Will have to find a source in the USA. Again, outstanding.
Fantastic location. The restaurant is very good and allows you to drink good wines.  Excellent service from nice people.  Go for it.
Gorgeous place. Lovely people. Good wine and accommodation.
Beautiful setting.  The wines we tasted were not the best in the region, but they were not bad!
Breathtaking surroundings. Incredible food. Fine wines. A memorable experience!
Awesome experience so much food to chose from. Great for the whole family.
Very awesome venue. Bring your kids and family for a nice day out. Lots of food and craft beer.
Good food selection however most venders prefer that pay with snapscan which is inconvenient if you do not have it.

The ROOT44 market here is one of the best in the whole Cape Town area. There is ample parking and the market is open every Saturday and Sunday from 10 am - 4 pm (come rain or shine). There's a stage where live music is played from throughout the day, and a dedicated kiddies zone - the World of Adventure.
There are three bars and plenty of shaded seating, on top of a huge variety of food and drink vendors. Really loved ROOT44.
Markets, food, live entertainment and a feast of glorious foods. Kids entertainment area. And a play park for the kids. A must visit when in Cape Town / Stellenbosch. This qualifies for a day visit.

We were very privileged to be guests at De Meye Wine Estate for a wedding ceremony and reception. The grounds are beautiful and it doesn't get much better with picturesque vineyards all around you. The staff were incredibly attentive and always made sure we were topped up with wine and filled up with canapes. Now the best part, the food... The menu for the specific reception was vegetarian only and we were blown away with the scrumptious flavours and varied textures and fragrances. Even the meat lovers were well and truly satisfied. The chef is a master craftsman and culinary entertainer. Oh the wines are delicious.

The farm to table experience is as described and the slow cooked lamb was a stand out.
The produce was on point with wines to match.
The problem with ratings is that you can't give less than one or more than five, De Meyer gets six from me.
Delicious food, amazing wine! The owners will make your experience awesome. I really enjoyed it & can just recommend it.
A hidden 'in'-gem in the Stellenbosch Winelands! Authentic and real, yet stylish and elegant. Highly popular amongst the foodie crowd. Fantastic wines, relaxed atmosphere, amazing lawn and garden.

reviews.text: Great food! Great service! Friendly staff! And the wine... well capaia #1 is the one
Excellent food, prepared with love and care. Absolute value for money. Would recommend it anytime!
Fantastic experience! Food was a sensation and Head chef Jean-Luc Dudley is a wizard! One of the best gastronomic experiences in the Cape!
I really loved it,so nice and they were so kind
FABULOUS  just did not realise a little bit far to uber!!!!

reviews.text: A really beautiful location, lovely grounds and gardens. We went for the bread making course which includes a wine tasting and lunch. Great value and great fun. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. A must visit place, we loved it.

These guys only produce two kinds of wine, good wine & excellent wine...
Beautiful atmosphere as well!
Great food, beautiful garden and a good service. We had a late lunch and last afternoon there an or kids loved the small waterways and paths in the garden.
A place known for it's nice bubbly... def worth a visit
Awesome food affordable for what you get. Awesome service. Attention to detail. They even have a small play area for kids.

reviews.text: Always friendly. Carmen is so accommodating. Beautiful setting.
Wine here is very high quality!

reviews.text: This farm used to have a restaurant where you could sit and enjoy drinks and tapas type platters while youbwatched the ducks prade past. Unfortunately the restaurant is no longer there. The deli that has replaced the restaurant is a bit disappointing in both the choices of food and the facility itself. The duck parade is still worthwhile to see though.
Cannot give any feedback on this place as I do not drink ðŸ»
Great lunch for the family
Beautiful setting for brunch. Attentive, friendly staff. The duck run is great to watch.

The famous farm with the Runner bred of ducks managing the sand-snail population in an organic way stopping these destructive mollusks from destroying the vines - great venue for a stop-off for a bite to eat too. The restaurant was being refurbished so can't comment on the offering yet

ChIJiyIJE_xZzB0R1-PmKiTFidk.adr_address: Knorhoek Road/R44, Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, 7605, South Africa

reviews.text: I worked here selling (and tasting) the wines and it is to this day one of my favourite places on earth!!!
Whimsical and wonderful with fantastic port. Totally unique.

ChIJA_0t_cdZzB0RhSVEq0dhSBc.adr_address: Tygerbergvalley Rd, Eikenbosch, Durbanville, 7551, South Africa

reviews.text: Food at tables at nitida was slightly disappointing. Waiter was good initially but then his phone become more important and I  had to go to him to get a menu for coffee's and desserts. The creme bulee was exceptional
Really needs a revamp. Especially the tables and outside area. Service was good, but the food is not up to standard anymore

Went there last week Sunday, booked a table for 15 at the Tables restaurant. The fish on the fish and chips dish was overcooked using what I thought was old oil. The lady from the table across from us kept shoving our kids away from their table when they walked past strangely enough after one of the patrons actually complimented us on our kids good behaviour. I'm not sure if the lady across from us was racist in doing what she did. To top it all off one of the patrons from a larger party, knocked into my car laughed and drove off, the manager at the time said they would follow up and get back to me. To this day I have had no feedback. Money not well spent.
Beautiful setting on the deck. Breakfast was perfect and not too pricey. Service great.
Great place and amazing service.  Definitely worth a return visit.

ChIJX-zNN_u1zR0RpnP6xojzcjM.adr_address: Lourensford Road, Somerset West, Cape Town, 7130, South Africa
ChIJX-zNN_u1zR0RpnP6xojzcjM.formatted_address: Lourensford Road, Somerset West, Cape Town, 7130, South Africa
ChIJX-zNN_u1zR0RpnP6xojzcjM.name: Lourensford Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Millhouse Restaurant, What a wasted space of potential. Service Managed like a fastfood joint!
A restaurant in a pristine location surrounded by mountains and vineyards. 
Everything to be a household name in Somerset West. The food is of good quality the venue is set picturesque yet the service gives off a stench and bad aftertaste.
In my experience here I ordered an appetizer and the party I was with ordered the same meal as it came to the table the servings were oddly sized and disproportionately unevenly plated. 
As it was I had mentioned this to the server only be responded by an act of laughter. 
We checked our portions and as it was mine was indefinitely less. 
When the bill came I made the remark and was not met with an apology duly with a Mcdonald's response of we weigh our portions. 
In service, it is important to listen to your client's, apologize and tell them that next time it will be fixed or even just make them happy in the moment.  As it turns out I have been in the service industry and run a business that brings people to locations as such and will now recommend people elsewhere.

What lovely grounds to relax and spend some quality time with those you love. Took business visitors for a snack and they loved it. Great friendly staff,
Will go back.

Must be the poorest wines I have ever tasted. The so-called Belgian chocolate is little more than cooking chocolate with bits and pieces in it. Beautiful location, but if you are interested in quality I'd give Lourensford a big miss.
Friday evening market has a great selection of food stalls and crafts on a beautiful wine estate.  A great way to end the week.
A beautiful estate with lots of space, amazing view, great food, better wine and some fantastic MCC. Go visit the Friday market. It well worth it.

ChIJX-zNN_u1zR0RpnP6xojzcjM.vicinity: Lourensford Road, Somerset West, Cape Town

reviews.text: I'll edit the review once I've tried the restaurant but the beer tasting was good. Go on a Tuesday for a tasting special. You have got to try the berry lime wine cooler they have. It is absolutely phenomenal. Parking is a bit scarce but a sedan or hatchback will be able to make the trip there and back. Only a small section and parking lot is gravel. Love the hill would like to take a trip to the top sometime provided it isn't 39Â°C again ðŸ˜‚. Apparently quite full on Saturdays but Sundays are more relaxed. Go on Tuesday though
Well organised wine festival. Estate made a plan for shade when appointed organisers messed up. Parking good. Great wines.

5 stars for when I was here the previous 2 times. There were about 3 guys who were watering and attending to everyone and they were brilliant. This time I havent even seen a waiter or waitress so I don't know who has been attending to anyone. I've been here 20 minutes, there are two tables and the cleaning lady inside keeps assuring me that someone will come and take my order. This is disgusting how the service has dismally decreased in only 4 months. Please get your previous staff members back and pay them double because they know what they are doing and they did a great job. I will never recommend Signal gun to anyone if this is the service I get.
Good view and staff was friendly and helpful. Can be a bit more daring with their beers.
Good wine and beer. Worth a look.

reviews.text: Had the best experience in one of the caves. Absolutely beautiful and such a wonderful experience. Thank you.
An awesome spot. Great service. We will definitely be back.

Beautiful hidden gem. Our waiter was very well informed, well spoken (pragtige Afrikaans) and friendly. The wine servings are modest (the farm is very anti-drink-and-drive) but the prices reflect that at extremely fair cost per tasting. We could enjoy a wine tasting without feeling like we were under the influence. Cheese and charcuterie platter was amazing and is apparently put together by the family's 80-something Ouma Janet (their Shiraz is named after her). We had Die Rooi Gat "hole in the wall" and look forward to trying out the other rooms in the near future as well as their new, impromptu smoked ribs / pulled pork burgers!
Very nice and cosy. Really enjoyed it!
Great wine! Great ambiance! Great, friendly service! If you are close stop and taste!!!

ChIJoUEowlZYzB0RUAEzoVxzAzc.vicinity: Tygerberg Valley Road, Durbanville, Cape Town

reviews.text: Very relaxed and authentic experience. Never felt like "just-one-more-taster", in fact she stayed open and relaxed with us, made us feel very welcome. And the WINES! Immediately bought cases for my wedding. We loved it, guests at the wedding loved it too. No regrets.
Good wines and friendly people
Good
Beautiful surroundings

reviews.text: The most beautiful views I have ever seen. Exquisite food and fantastic wines. Excellent service. I am the ambassador for Waterkloof. All my friends, tourists, family think this is a God's heaven havenâ™¡â˜†â™¡â˜†â™¡â˜† i am saying goodbye Waterkloof Wines

We had an amazing experience at Waterkloofâ€™s restaurant! We went for the degustation menu with wine pairing. The food is creative and most of the dishes served were delicious (Egg 63 is my personal favourite). The view from the restaurant is fantastic (ask for a table by the window) and we loved the overall ambience of the place. We liked the wines as well, although the whites are definitely better then rose and red. Hoping to be back one day!

Had such high expectations for this restaurant, but we were so disappointed. The staff were so unhelpful and didnâ€™t take us through the menu properly or help us with food recommendations. The menu itself was also not very explanatory. The food was underwhelming and bland, especially the starter. 

The only positive part of the experience was the friendly staff at the wine tasting section. Very friendly and very helpful.

Waterkloof is a very modern space with spectacular views of False Bay and Sir Lowryâ€™s Pass. The restaurant is set in a modern glass and steel building located at the highest point of the vineyard. Big windows allow for plenty natural light to flow in.

When going to Waterkloof you can choose between a six course tasting menu (which the entire table has to order) or any dish from a carefully designed a la carte menu.
View and building are very nice. Food was creative but lacking in flavor. Reds need to age more. In general South Africa is serving their reds too early.

ChIJzxOZlRfKzR0RLPvYwtEU8w4.vicinity: Sir Lowry's Pass Road, Somerset West, Cape Town
