reviews.text:
Badly managed, poor communications, lack of attention to detail.

Wine tasting cellar has limited cold storage for white, sparkling and rose wines.  A tiny 24 bottle fridge.  You are a vineyard!!!

Your restaurant, guest house and wine tasking centre managers do not talk to each other and as a result the staff look stupid in front of customers when simple requests made months in advance are not passed on.

In our room at the guesthouse the taps leaked - not on in The Cape at the moment, one tap actually fell off, the bedside lights did not work and the door onto the balcony was so warped we could not open it.  At breakfast, the guesthouse ran out of bread and marmalade only an hour into the serving time.  The manager did nothing and just stood there behind the reception counter as if nothing was wrong.  The staff were embarrassed - they were trying their best.  Totally unacceptable but for R1,200 per night - they are having a laugh!!  They aren't now.
Absolutely amazing venue and restaurant! Will recommend this to anyone!
Fantastic food, sheltered from the wind! Great wedding venue
So impressed with this beautiful place. The service was outstanding! Having a gluten, free, meat free lunch was absolutely amazing at Towerbosch!
Beautiful setting. Lovely wine. Superb food . Excellent staff.

ChIJRcy_hA6zzR0RuURiRYxBOAI.adr_address: Strand Road, R44 Stellenbosch, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJRcy_hA6zzR0RuURiRYxBOAI.formatted_address: Strand Road, R44 Stellenbosch, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJRcy_hA6zzR0RuURiRYxBOAI.name: Blaauwklippen Wine Estate

reviews.text: What an unforgettable experience.  Such a awesome day eating good food and tasting such amazing wines. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  This wine estate is pure beauty. Set in lush beautiful gardens surrounded by magnificent old trees. Meander through the gardens and treat yourself to a delicious lunch and wine tasting experience. U can choose from Gin Tasting, Brandy tasting and Wine tasting. What a selection. This is one of the most beautiful wine estates I've been to.
Gorgeous location for the Galileo Cinema. We recently watched Grease here and would have much rather stayed at this beautiful warm than where we needed up!
Just had a six course meal with wine pairing...Really good food and wine. Staff extremely knowledgable and helpful....typical African hospitality. Would recommend you make this a stop.

We thoroughly enjoyed our gin tasting at Blaauwklippen. The gin is lovely, and the tasting was expertly presented by Asanda - a really knowledgeable and friendly host! The tasting room also offers a selection of fine potstill brandy and grappa. Great value for money, can highly recommend this experience to fellow lovers of craft gin.
Beautiful scenery, great wine & food! Wonderful market on Sundays, something interesting for whole family...

ChIJ_yAeaYmzzR0RJGEnN6SDxeY.adr_address: Blaauwklippen Rd, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJ_yAeaYmzzR0RJGEnN6SDxeY.name: Dornier Wine Estate

reviews.text: Maintaining the gardens on the estate. Always a privilege being on the farm. Beautiful setting and ambiance.
Very good wines and friendly helpfull staff

Beetroot seared Salmon was good but imho  a bit less than 5-6 major taste components (+ the salmon) would make it a  much better salmon dish. Rather a general issue though, since the "less is more" principle seems to not have reached SA yet. Same with the sea brass that was excellent but hard to enjoy with uncounted other components that were meant to accompany it but actually rather impeded it. Service by a top expert in every sense. Dornier's Chenin Blanc "Moordenarskloof" with its subtle barrel fermentation note an its harmonicly embedded acidity was wonderful and went very well with both dishes.

Great family friendly place in a very beautiful and peaceful spot in Stellenbosch. Obviously with great wines on the very reasonably priced menue but besides that also very interesting selection of local beers. Always worth a lunch stop over!
A favorite with the friendliest people, the best view and tastiest food.

ChIJ0YWiZNLFzR0R6eQeC4WaNzw.adr_address: 127 Oak Avenue, Grabouw, 7160, South Africa
ChIJ0YWiZNLFzR0R6eQeC4WaNzw.name: Oak Valley Wine Estate

reviews.text: This place is kwai nd leka man
Beautiful wine warm. Awesome wines especially 2012 red blend !

Excellent varied terrain. The red route has moderate difficulty and several really fun gentle downhill sections through forest.

This map marker is nowhere near the parking!! Use the "Oak Valley Estate" map marker for navigation instead. The MTB parking is just inside the estate after you pass through the gate.
Beautifull wine estate, did a trail run on the farm which has awesome trails and bike tracks.

Enjoyed a great lunch around the pool.
Awesome setting

ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.adr_address: R43, Bot River Lagoon, Walker Bay, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.formatted_address: R43, Bot River Lagoon, Walker Bay, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.name: Benguela Cove Lagoon Wine Estate

reviews.text: We popped in unplanned- wanted to see what was going on. A beautiful and luxurious setting- did wine and chocolate tasting - we had friendly service .  The views are stunning but the area is still in development. The vineyards looked healthy. Just took pics for Google.  Beautiful art.  The wine is very pricey.

Thembi was a fantastic host, she was knowledgeable about the lovely wines and the estate itself. A highlight of our trip to Hermanus. The kids play area and friendly ducks were an extra bonus. Well worth a visit!

Not much happening, seems to be lots of landscaping still in progress. Nice artwork and decor. I was very puzzled and annoyed that a cup of tea costs R40 when a beer costs R20. We complained but they were not willing to discuss it. Won't go back.

I have take same gust from Pretoria  out for lunch on the 26 December 2017 to your restaurant. I deside to try a new place. We book for 6 at the restaurant but on arrival they did not know of us but we was help friendly. We was seated outside on our request. Great venue and nice relax atmosphere. Love the space around the tables and that i do not have to listen to somebody else conversation. 
The wine was good but a bit pricey for what you get. (Only wine and soft drinks available.)
The waiter gives u 2 menu's to order from?? Every time we need him we have to look for him and call him. We ask about the cheese  and meat  platters and the waiters could not tel us what was on it so we deside to skip it. 
The starters we order was tasty but the main was bad. 
We order sirloin  medium to rare and it was well done. My friend order rare and it was medium to well. The meat was to thin cut and rubbery texture. Relay not what I expected. The fish that some had was average and not what we expected from a fine restaurant.
Over all, I was very disappointing because the greater Hermanus have very good Estates, restaurants with great food and nice views that offer better value.
Great atmosphere, live music and view of lake. Decent wines but a bit pricey.

ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.vicinity: R43, Bot River Lagoon, Walker Bay, Hermanus

ChIJE_Yw4RqszR0Rr21MmQUkBG0.adr_address: Valley Road - Off R44, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJE_Yw4RqszR0Rr21MmQUkBG0.formatted_address: Valley Road - Off R44, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJE_Yw4RqszR0Rr21MmQUkBG0.name: Marianne Wine Estate

reviews.text: If you have never been, you need to go. If you don't do wine tasting, you need to go. If you don't drink wine, you need to go. This absolutely is the best wine this country has to offer!  Thrilled we found you...where have you been all my life.

This was an amazing experience, My wife and I had the best of times. The accommodation was incredible, and the facilities were just wonderful. The staff were super friendly and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. The wine was fantastic as was the staffs knowledge of the it. We had supper in the FlorÃ©al restaurant which was delicious and very reasonably priced.
Overall I would recommend Marianne to everyone and we shall certainly be heading back there. 

Thank you to everyone who made our stay so memorable. 

Gemma and Charlotte.

Excellent excellent winery. The location has amazing views, and the wines were delicious. The 2014 Cab Sauv is excellent. Itâ€™s a bit posh and not really child friendly, they have meat and cheese boards no picnic. Highly highly recommend.

This also one of our favorites!! Atmosphere is fantastic, this is the type of wine farm where you can sit for hours and just have a great time with your lived one or friends. Their wines are superb and super friendly staff. Apart from that seating has a great view!
What an amazing experience. Had the pleasure of tasting some of the finest wines Stellenbosch has to offer with the friendliest staff. See you again soon!

ChIJYYBvB3hMzB0RtQRYwFvrzGk.adr_address: Baden Powell Drive, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJYYBvB3hMzB0RtQRYwFvrzGk.formatted_address: Baden Powell Drive, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJYYBvB3hMzB0RtQRYwFvrzGk.name: Meerlust Wine Estate

reviews.text: Wonderful wines, the place is beautiful and steeped in history. Highly recommended

Incredible wine â€“ Highly Recommended!

The wine farm has a rich family history since 1756 (eight generations of Myburghâ€™s). Creating award winning wines that will leave you more then satisfied. Try the famous flagship Meerlust Rubicon (red wine) and youâ€™ll be hooked! 

The spectacular originally preserved Cape Dutch main house will transport you back in time to the early settlers and the Cape colony. Youâ€™ll feel relaxed in the rustic tasting room where the team of friendly and knowledgeable staff will assist and educate you about the farm, history and wines. 

Itâ€™s one of the only places where you actually get to taste the flagship wines! Other must-haves are the Merlot and the local Chardonnay (white wine). The wines are well priced and affordable (Wine Club members get additional discount â€“ So sign up asap!). You wonâ€™t leave disappointedâ€¦ ENJOY!

After 12 months of planning our wine tasting route, Meerlust was a must, we thought this would be our GRANDE Finale, What an absolute disappointment, the Staff (Jill) was totally not interested, the wine tasting was rushed and not explained clearly, it was as if we were there at closing time. We ended up buying a 1.5lt Rubicon, because it is such a beautiful wine, the cold reception and unprofessional staff really ruined our last day. What a total disappointment!
Nice people, very good wines, lot's of parking
Iconic South African wines! WOW!

ChIJvYCDpzzFzR0RRvpASYUuNQQ.adr_address: Viljoenshoop Road 50, Grabouw, 7160, South Africa
ChIJvYCDpzzFzR0RRvpASYUuNQQ.name: Almenkerk Wine Estate

reviews.text: amazing food and olive oils !
According to Google, Platters and every sign in the area leading you there, Almenkerk is open on Sundays, so imagine driving 80km to get there only to find the gate closed.  Not cool.
Nice wine
Excellent wines, very warm welcome, awesome views and splendid architecture
Awesome wine. Has art as well, and beautiful setting.
Our first stop for wine tasting. They were clearing from the weekendâ€™s festivities. Wines for tasting were good and will buy, the courtyard where we sat just ok, but the views over the dam great.

Excellent Food and Ambience.  However the waiter should have explained that their was both a Starter and a Main option.  
We received one of each but were charged for 2 mains; as we were a big table I let it slide this time.  A bit more waiter training should alleviate this unfortunate mishap.
What a great place to enjoy with the family and kids. The only thing is I wish they offered some beers on tap. Beside that its great.
Beautiful setting in the Winelands and great food! P.S go on the free tractor ride through the Eikendal Vineyards! Take a glass of wine with you!
Nice experience. Wine and cheesecake tasting was fun and the Italian restaurant has a nice menu with good prices.

ChIJAQAAAByyzR0RT-hoZGJUuGo.adr_address: Helshoogte Rd, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJAQAAAByyzR0RT-hoZGJUuGo.formatted_address: Helshoogte Rd, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJAQAAAByyzR0RT-hoZGJUuGo.name: Zorgvliet Wine Estate

reviews.text: Friends got married here last year, it is an amazing wedding venue!! Would recommend it to everyone.  Surrounded by the mountains, chapel and horses what an amazing experience it was.  The estate is also very well organised with the whole wedding process.  It really felt like a fairy tale.

I will never forget my experience at Zorgvliet Wine Estate. My husband and I were married there only a few weeks ago. The estate and chapel were more beautiful than I could have even dreamed. The owners and staff were extremely accommodating considering my husband and I planned our wedding in 5 hours. They provided a room for me to get dressed and prepared the chapel in very little time. Colin, our tour guide and an employee at Zorgvliet, orchestrated the entire evening perfectly, connecting us with photographers, an officiant, etc. and we couldn't have been more grateful for or impressed by his speedy work. We are so grateful and definitely recommend Zorgvliet to everyone!
This a wonderful wine estate with fantastic wines and food. It is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been. It's a great place to come and have a picnic and a glass of wine.

My wife and I were married at Zorgvliet Wine Estate in November and it couldn't have been in a more beautiful location.  The staff was extremely helpful, especially Colin Dewet.  I recommend visiting for any occasion, not just weddings.
This is such a very lovely place. Great views and great wines in combination with excellent service...

ChIJZ2H7c4a1zR0RA8-3KEsQLTY.adr_address: Lourensford Rd, Somerset West, Cape Town, 7130, South Africa
ChIJZ2H7c4a1zR0RA8-3KEsQLTY.formatted_address: Lourensford Rd, Somerset West, Cape Town, 7130, South Africa
ChIJZ2H7c4a1zR0RA8-3KEsQLTY.name: Vergelegen Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Beautiful Wine estate with large gardens. We walk through the estate admiring the magnificent trees, vines, flowers and huge lawns.
We had breakfast at the Stables restaurant that was very nice. Food was good, and I tried the Red Rooibos milkshake that was very nice.
They are normally very busy so to make sure you have a table phone before to reserve a table
Nature photographers will love this place.
The wine tasting was very nice. Good quality wines
The downside is you need to pay R10pp to enter the wine estate.

A truly wonderful vineyard. The wines are superb and the food is outstanding. 
I visited with my Dear Friend Bill Berry and enjoyed the whole experience

Simply beautiful.One must detour around to enjoy the beautiful garden and visit the museum  The residential Homestead, dating back to the 1700's, with each room authentically furnished, reflects the layered historicism of the over 300 years .

A beautiful wine estate with a variety of restaurants to choose from, booking is advised. Picnic available in the summer with individual tables set up through out the forest. Unforgettable. Gardens are impeccable.
Beautiful wonderful fantastic! Staff, food, ambiance all outstanding

ChIJZ2H7c4a1zR0RA8-3KEsQLTY.vicinity: Lourensford Rd, Somerset West, Cape Town

ChIJfXlmsoO0zR0RKZzHmT0bH6Y.adr_address: Annandale Road, Off the R44 toward Somerset West, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJfXlmsoO0zR0RKZzHmT0bH6Y.formatted_address: Annandale Road, Off the R44 toward Somerset West, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJfXlmsoO0zR0RKZzHmT0bH6Y.name: Alto Estate Winery

reviews.text: The best known and one of the top 5 wines in south africa, we were very well looked after on the wine tasting
Great wine tasting, some lovely wines & the port is amazing. Also had a lovely platter whilst we were tasting.
Fantastic!,

Menere Alto Wyne, Ek was vanaand in 'n bui van buie en het niks drinkwyn
in my kas oorgehad nie. Soek toe tussen die ou wyne en kry 'n bottel Alto Rouge 1989 met 'n plakker met die nommer 40 agterop en onthou my seun Kevin, was op die plaas na 1994 een of ander tyd en het my van daaraf ge bel en gevra of ek 'n Alto wyn in my kas het. Ek het verskeie jare sin gehad en hy het die bottel as 'n geskenk van Alto saam gebring.  Wel ek het die wyn vanaand gedrink. Gesukkel om die prop uit te kry en raai wat die wyn is nie suur nie. Die wyn is baie baie lekker.  Wou dit met julle deel.
Bin kein Rotweintrinker aber dieser war wirklich sehr gut.  Very good red wine.

ChIJfXlmsoO0zR0RKZzHmT0bH6Y.vicinity: Annandale Road, Off the R44 toward Somerset West, Stellenbosch

reviews.text: Awesome views of the Hemel-en-aarde Valley, some great wines, and a nice platter to share
Ah, superb!! The tasting experience is exceptional, always accommodating, and the staff are very friendly. 100% can recommend!

Very accommodating. We called to make a booking but were warned that they are very busy. Even though they still managed to get us a seat by the fire place. 

Great service and friendly staff are attentive. Platters are great but the ðŸ· is lacking. The vistas are gorgeous with great photo ops for photography.

I really enjoyed my experience here. The wine tasting was very affordable, yet the wines were of very good quality. With every wine tasting, flavours and wine making processes were explained. And with the stunning mountain and ocean views and crackling fire going in the fireplace, makes it a perfect relaxing place for a chilli winter's afternoon.
The Pinotage is great, and the view is amazing even on a rainy day.

ChIJl6qqqhq9zR0RL6K-moe0xVs.adr_address: Green Valley Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJl6qqqhq9zR0RL6K-moe0xVs.formatted_address: Green Valley Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJl6qqqhq9zR0RL6K-moe0xVs.name: Holden Manz Wine Estate

reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic place to be. In the heart of Franschoek and the scenery is beautiful. Was there for an event and was blown away with the service and great food. Wine tours are available and well worth it. Did I mention how good the wine is?

Lovely Sunday lunch, I'm vegan so I had the polenta with veggies and it was beautiful! We enjoyed the Mellow 2013 with our mains and it complemented it perfectly. Service was good, friendly waiter with a great view.

As part of the wine tour, we went to Holden Manz. The place has good views. They also have a large green area with a water body near the restaurant for the kids to play. The tasting was good and the server was kind enough to change our wines as part of tasting as we prefer white over red wines.  We also had the cheese platter which had good variety and was good.

We loved this place! The Setting is beautiful and peaceful and overall it's a small enough environment to be intimate. We had lunch and the food was fantastic. Stunning presentation, great flavour combinations and good quality ingredients. The service was good too. The Good Sport dessert wine is delicious and we bought a couple of bottles to take home with us. A great day out in Franschoek and we will definitely return.
Lovely atmosphere and amazing food and wine!
A small hidden gem of a wine estate, with great views and fantastic wines.

At the end of this Rainbow, you'll fine a pot of liquid gold in the way of great wines, friendly family and staff.  Good informative presentation before you sit out on the family's terrace with its' breathtaking views and enjoy great wine and company

ChIJMWIHXcyyzR0Rfx6H4JpNTGA.adr_address: Polkadraai Road, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJMWIHXcyyzR0Rfx6H4JpNTGA.name: Asara Wine Estate & Hotel

reviews.text:
Breakfast experiences on 2 consecutive days were accompanied by screaming children. 
Similar experiences at the swimming pool. Not a very restful and peaceful stay at  Asara. Glad I only booked for a few days and not longer.
Excellent wine! Excellent service! Tasting room nice, but no outdoor scenery.
Great food, great wines, great scenery en friendly staff
Serene setting, with panoramic view of Stellenbosch. Great deli and patisserie. Expensive gin options.
One of the Best Wine farms in Stellenbosch. Beautiful view. Great wine tasting. (Noble Harvest).

Extremely disappointed in this place. Ordered the 7 wine tasting menu and served abandoned us for about 30 minutes between wines 4 and 5. We were on an aggressive timeline, wanting to experience as much of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek as possible in a short period. Never received apology for delay. Moreover, different server (who settled our bill) never asked how our experience was, meaning I had to resort to online reviews to give feedback.  Setting, while grandiose, is somewhat sterile and less scenic than local counterparts, compounding the unhappiness of the extended stay.
Nice winery and views but not so good client service by some of the staff...thanks to Donald atleast he was good, i called and booked but upon arrival was told no table and they didnt seem to care...

The restaurant and hotel are beautiful, the service and presentation is great, but we were definitely not impressed by the food. Since we had to drive all the way from Stellenbosch, it was definitely not worth the drive :-/

La Motte is an amazing winery! It's been around since the 1600s and their wine is phenomenal. The landscape is beautiful and the tasting room is a mix between vintage and modern architecture. La Motte's staff is very friendly and has a lot of knowledge about all the different wines they offer. They make an excellent Merlot and Cab Sav!
Food and wine are great. Although not always good enough to justify the pricing.

ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.adr_address: Groot Constantia Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.formatted_address: Groot Constantia Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.name: Groot Constantia

reviews.text: Having been to many wine estates in the West Cape I thought I should at least visit the oldest. The grounds are extensive and beautiful and the terrace eating space is sophisticated. There are several Dutch Cape buildings across the estate and lots of old tall oak trees. There is a good view of table mountain from the terrace area. Despite the grandeur of the wine tasting rooms I was tempted to taste or eat as the place lacked something.

We had some wine and food in the Deli. Food was good. Cheese platter and  a salad. The white wine wasnâ€™t that good. (Canâ€™t remember the name). Service although very busy was very professional and quick. We didnâ€™t have any views of the winelands while we eat. Maybe there is a place but we didnâ€™t see it.

We visited the Jonkershuis restaurant for our year end lunch. Enjoyed every minute of it. We were seated outside under the trees and took in the spectacular view! The food was really good (we selected the celebration menu) and fantastic value for money. I even had a chance to purchase some wines to take home. Overall a wonderful experience and will definitely return!
It remains the best winery in the Cape. Best cuisine and location. You can easily lose yourself in the past. Beautiful gardens and historical buildings. Very elegant.

Great experience eating at the restaurant. Epic views and tranquility. Did not do the wine tasting, but I did buy some great wines. The lovely lady at the counter assisted me with a sample of their excellent Pinotage. Can't wait to go back and do the wine tour.

ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.vicinity: Groot Constantia Road, Constantia, Cape Town

ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.adr_address: Lievland Wine Estate at Route 44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, Western Cape,, South Africa, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, 7625, South Africa
ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.formatted_address: Lievland Wine Estate at Route 44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, Western Cape,, South Africa, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, 7625, South Africa
ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.name: Lievland Wine Estate

reviews.text: Home of the Impi challenge obstacle course race. Great venue with fantastic views.
3 Impi's done at Lievland. Really great place to test your mettle. I'll definitely be back for more punishment.

ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.vicinity: Lievland Wine Estate at Route 44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, Western Cape,, South Africa, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch

ChIJAzp1dFmszR0RhekYH-fu1QY.adr_address: R44, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7607, South Africa
ChIJAzp1dFmszR0RhekYH-fu1QY.formatted_address: R44, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7607, South Africa
ChIJAzp1dFmszR0RhekYH-fu1QY.name: Kanonkop Wine Estate

reviews.text:
I give only 4* only because of the experience. The wines are stunning! So rich aromas and wonderful bouquets! But the wine tasting as an experience was very poor and weak.  

The young lady at the counter just pointed her finger at the price list with the wine names, waited for the order and poured the wines. Swollen words about the wine itself... Maybe she was too tired at early afternoon - difficult to say.

Anyway, even without the explanations :( we could appreciate the wines. Kanonkop deserves the name "the master of pinotage" in the country. 
Very well done! 

Got several bottles for home. Again, great wines! 
Best Pinotage in the country!
One of our favorite stops on wine tours. Educational and fine wine. Especially rewarding at harvest time. Ask about shipping wine back. Reasonable and quick.
Excellent wine selection. Beautiful farm
Excellent wines and very knowlegable staff. SA 1st growth wine estate for sure!

One of the nicest evenings we've had in a long time. Fantastic food and wine. The owners go out of their way to make the evening special. We felt welcome and enjoyed ourselves immensely. Well done. Keep it up.
Wow. Wow. Amazing. Excellent food, wines and service. Book in advance to make sure you get a good spot. Take one of the golf carts to the top of the vineyard and enjoy the jaw dropping views.

Some of the best views at any estate. If you can get one of the guys with the golf carts to take you all the way up, you can literally see as far as Cape Town. The food was also excellent and the service really good.
Wonderful service and great views . We had a nice tasting and the property has wonderfully pieces of art and sculpture worth seeing .
Stunning vineyard, beautiful flowers on the way to the restaurant. We enjoyed a small tasting on the terrace with a beautiful view.
One of the best views from any of the wineries. Wines were  good, service was great, amazing food.

ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.adr_address: R301, Jan Van Riebeeck Dve, Newtown, The Diemersfontein Village, Wellington, 7655, South Africa
ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.formatted_address: R301, Jan Van Riebeeck Dve, Newtown, The Diemersfontein Village, Wellington, 7655, South Africa
ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.name: Diemersfontein Wine & Country Estate

reviews.text: Stay at Diemersfontein. The breakfast is fantastic and a wine tasting is included in your stay. Their ðŸ· is lovely and the ladies in the tasting room are genuinely cool people to have a chat with while you sample the wines.
Restaurant often very unwelcoming; strange hours. Have had one very good experience there. Tasting room great - friendly staff.
Poor service. Was brought the bill before asking for it. What a disgrace. Never again. Spent 3k and got zero effort for it. Stay away

I liked the very good views and the crackers and cheese served at the wine tasting. The staff at the restaurant said that the card machine was not working. I had to pay in cash at the restaurant, but I could pay with my card at the wine tasting centre.

Stairs from parking to venue. Small children's play area.
Shower pathetic... security major turnoff from the start. Bed is broken just horrible

ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.vicinity: R301, Jan Van Riebeeck Dve, Newtown, Wellington

ChIJFyc4R5a0zR0RVEw-FtibG-4.adr_address: Eikendal Road, Off, R44, 7600, South Africa
ChIJFyc4R5a0zR0RVEw-FtibG-4.formatted_address: Eikendal Road, Off, R44, 7600, South Africa
ChIJFyc4R5a0zR0RVEw-FtibG-4.name: Longridge Wines

reviews.text:
Very welcoming staff, great wine and generous  cheese platter.
Worth the visitðŸ‘
Magnificent wines, magic views and immensely knowledgeable and helpful personnel.
Good food. great venue.
Geweldig!

ChIJEQa6THa0zR0R--4CKVRFrMw.adr_address: Upper Blaauwklippen Rd, Helderberg Rural, 7600, South Africa
ChIJEQa6THa0zR0R--4CKVRFrMw.formatted_address: Upper Blaauwklippen Rd, Helderberg Rural, 7600, South Africa
ChIJEQa6THa0zR0R--4CKVRFrMw.name: Waterford Wine Estate

reviews.text: We really loved this vineyard, the wines were incredible. Their wine â€˜Jemâ€™ is top 3% internationally and was very good. We walked through the wine making areas where they were actually making wine, de stemming, and mashing grapes - which made for a very unique experience. The service was also one of the best in the wineries we visited. Overall very authentic and enjoyable experience.

Had the most wonderful time at Waterford Wine Estates yesterday where we did the â€˜wine safari tour.â€™ The whole experience was made even more enjoyable due to our wine guide, Trent, along with his side kick, Pinot Noir, the dog! 
Every question we asked, Trent knew the answer to. 
The wine was exceptional and would have no hesitation of recommending this experience to anyone. Thank you Trent!

Great wine tasting, lovely scenery. Sasha helped us very good, explained everything about the wines really well and patience. We loved the Chardonnay as well as the chocolate and wine pairings. Not the cheapest one though, but it's worth it.

Absolutely love their wine and chocolate pairing. I also think their accompanying explanations are really good, but this might of course be depending on your sommelier/wine steward. Their tastings happen outside, which makes it also an excellent trip for a day out with nice weather.

Wine tasting was acceptable, but nothing compared to other wineries as you couldn't choose what wines to taste. More of a show for tourists, not very authentic.

They really shouldn't focus on red wines in my opinion. The Sauvignon Blanc was excellent.

ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.adr_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.formatted_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.name: Allee Bleue Estate

reviews.text:
We received directions from security at the front gate, spot on. The picnic area was easy to find.

We then arrived at the entrance to the picnic area and was escorted to our tables (has to be booked beforehand) by our waitron which done so in a kind and friendly manner.

We then settled in and made the kids comfortable by escorting them to the jumping castle and jungle gym. The entire picnic area is walled in so the kids can only exit at the entrance which makes it easy to keep an eye on them. We appreciated the kids friendly picnic area.

The food was delicious and sufficient.

They even offer a kiddies picnic platter.

We then took our time and had great fun and the service was good. 

Only once did the waiter forget to bring our my soft drink but overall we would recommend it for the families with toddlers and even babies.

Amazing welcome with some sparkling wine. The ambience was decadent and the food was amazing and very generous portions. We had some amazing white and red wine to compliment our meals. Absolutely loved it.
Excellent wines. The venue has vast and stunning vineyards and lanscape. Our wineÂ steward was delightfully entertaining. Coffee was good, breakfast was impecable.
The service and the food was really great. A very tranquil setting with enough to do for children
The picnic baskets were amazing. Good quality for the price! Lovely day under the trees!!

ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.vicinity: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek

ChIJs94exLlMzB0R7ESjXNmRhhs.adr_address: Webersburg Farm, Annandale Rd, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJs94exLlMzB0R7ESjXNmRhhs.formatted_address: Webersburg Farm, Annandale Rd, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJs94exLlMzB0R7ESjXNmRhhs.name: Webersburg

reviews.text: We stayed here for a few nights. Absolutely loved it!! The friendliest staff ever. This place is kept so lovely. Beautiful views and amazing wine
great setting  good food - bit pricey but not too bad given the setting and quality. very small wine list but the red blend magic. worth a visit. xmas picnic menu looks good - pity i wont be there.
Very nice and quiet place. Rooms are big with air con but are a little 90s interior. Staff is ok but the food and view is lovely.
Delicious crisp pork belly. Beautiful  views.

Our new favorite spot! Everything about this place is just amazing, the views, the green lush lawns, the friendly staff, the delicious food, the flavorful wines! 

Bistro Menu: The prices are reasonable for the type of meal you get,  very upmarket, well-prepared food. I recommend the beef burger- out of the world. Look out for their beer and burger lunch special during the week (I think it's R100 for a beer and burger- def worth it). 

Wines: I liked all of their wines, but the Cab was just out of this world and I normally don't even like Cab- go taste it. They waive the tasting fee if you buy a bottle and I would recommend you do.

Picnics: This is on my list- I can see myself enjoying a fine bottle of wine and good food on those green lawns. 

Overall experience was overwhelmingly positive.

Please thumbs up if you found this review helpful :)

ChIJZcZiPd1NzB0RBWJJ9FIaGQk.adr_address: Polkadraai Rd, Kuils River, Cape Town, 7579, South Africa
ChIJZcZiPd1NzB0RBWJJ9FIaGQk.formatted_address: Polkadraai Rd, Kuils River, Cape Town, 7579, South Africa
ChIJZcZiPd1NzB0RBWJJ9FIaGQk.name: Saxenburg

reviews.text: Great place to look over th e winelands and enjoy the beauty...

ChIJZcZiPd1NzB0RBWJJ9FIaGQk.vicinity: Polkadraai Road, Kuils River, Cape Town

ChIJfzKu7VtXzB0R9sepIOCnAMg.adr_address: Tygerberg Valley Rd, Cape Farms, Cape Town, 7551, South Africa
ChIJfzKu7VtXzB0R9sepIOCnAMg.formatted_address: Tygerberg Valley Rd, Cape Farms, Cape Town, 7551, South Africa
ChIJfzKu7VtXzB0R9sepIOCnAMg.name: Altydgedacht

reviews.text: Great wine, excellent food (bourbon burger was amazing!), service was a bit slow but very friendly. Beautiful setting as well! Second time there, and will definitely be back soon.

Deeply unimpressed at the change of ownership. For the past 10-15 years the Altydgedaght restaurant has been wonderful - good value for money and delicious food. Prices have increased since the change in ownership and the quality has decreased. When being seated we were not informed of anything being out of stock, but the wine we ordered was out, as was their chicken pot pie and fish. The menus are grubby and cringe worthy, with pages missing from some. When we informed the waiter in a friendly and respectful way that we were not happy with the quality of the service and the lack of their basic offerings, he was unapologetic. Despite living in the area and being regular visitors, we will not be returning.

Awesome Valentine's day at Alyydgedacht. Barbera is now my favourite red. I love the coziness of this wine farm and to top it up the staff are just amazing. Maryline is very knowledgeable and we loved learning about the different wine and the history of the farm from her. We will definitely go back.

I have to say it was perfectly . What i love . Friendly .authentic . Excellent  wine .
Maryline was a fantastic persone to listen.
We couldnt leave .

Food was not up to standard. Did not receive all the ingredients stated on the menu. Calamari was overcooked and chewy. Salad was so small not worth R80. After waiting for more than 15 min to complain to the kitchen manager we left...hungry and dissapointed. Never again

ChIJfzKu7VtXzB0R9sepIOCnAMg.vicinity: Tygerberg Valley Road, Cape Farms, Cape Town

ChIJ5TjVz91ZzB0RQ_2sDAvEezM.adr_address: M13 Tygerberg Valley Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJ5TjVz91ZzB0RQ_2sDAvEezM.formatted_address: M13 Tygerberg Valley Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJ5TjVz91ZzB0RQ_2sDAvEezM.name: D'Aria Winery

reviews.text: Pleasant wines. Decent size burger but not the best I've had. Outside deck area very pleasant, but  clean up of vacated tables unusually slow.
Lovely ambiance. Great service. Exceptional function food. Great large function destination.
Nice atmosphere but service not up to scratch. Wine tasting had too few waiters resulting in us having to get up from the veranda and get our own wine. Cheese platter good and arrived promptly.

We've just had the pleasure of visiting D'Aria for a wine tasting and were blown away! Their tastings are R20 for 5 wines (which are all fabulous!) Their Cheese & Meat platters are extremely abundant and affordable - R150 for all this which is over enough for 2 people!!! Gorgeous setting, beautiful pond, wooden deck, tables on the lawn, (bring a picnic blanket if you want) kids play area, expansive laws for kids to kick a ball, enough paving for older kids to skateboard on, fireplace inside. They're very popular and their wines are very affordable. R45 for a bottle of fabulous D'Aria Music. Open 7 days a week. Weekends from 11am - 4pm. We're hooked!
Waited an hour and a quarter and still no food. Got a glass of champagne because of long wait. We were the first guests and the other 2 tables got food before us. And all this on my birthday!!

ChIJ5TjVz91ZzB0RQ_2sDAvEezM.vicinity: M13 Tygerberg Valley Road, Durbanville, Cape Town

ChIJ6UwkCbvFzR0RA6dE-IuB87Y.adr_address: Viljoenshoop Rd, Elgin, 7180, South Africa
ChIJ6UwkCbvFzR0RA6dE-IuB87Y.name: Belfield Wine Farm

reviews.text:
We got lucky on this tasting. Although not so advertised it did seem like we should have made an appointment. We arrived with a group who had done so and so just fell in. 

Tasting was a really enjoyable, fresh feel. Hosted by the owner himself it was extremely relaxed and unpretentious. He does it in a very conversational, story telling style which is a breath of fresh air from the usual "12 month in French oak" sing song. 

Wine itself is well worth the visit and fairly priced, especially considering the size of the farm and production quantities. 

All in all felt more like a visit with a friend with good taste... easy 5 stars.

An amazing and tranquil place! Perfect for a relaxing weekend getaway. Everything that you could possibly need is provided. Very clean, neat and tidy. Great hospitality from the lovely owners Mel and Mike.
Accommodation is really comfortable and host Mel is warm and welcoming.  The wine is delicious with Tastings by arrangement.
Wonderful hospitality! Thank you Mike and Mel.
Stayed at Apple Rose cottage with my fiance, absolutely fantastic farm-stay experience. Thank you!

Wonderful venue and atmosphere. Host Rose was fantastic.
Breathtaking views, amazing snacks and great wine. One of Stellenbosch's best kept secrets!
Fantastic

reviews.text:
Can totally agree with Hein - it's worth the drive! You have to best roughly 5 km of gravel road to get to IONA Wine farm, but once there you can taste their really good wines and enjoy a great view of the valley. 

I liked their Sauvignon Blanc and especially their red wine blend called the "one man band".
Great farm and very reasonably priced wines!
Stunning wines and a knowledgeable presenter
Great Sauvignon Blanc. Worth the drive.
Amazing wines, beautiful location - well worth a visit!

ChIJH1VNJ1OrzR0R4DFNWY29m0c.adr_address: Old Paarl Rd, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa

reviews.text: Excellent, friendly service from our waiter Blessing! The food was absolutely delicious and the portions huge! We had a lovely time with family at Eaglevlei and the children really enjoyed the enormous play area.
Absolutely fantastic place.. Delicious food.. pure awesomeness. I always go back to this place.. Nice ðŸ˜ƒðŸ˜Š
We waited for 40 minutes before being served with drinks.... 40 minutes for 2 x burgers and 1 pasta dish. This at 11:30am????? Beautiful venue but poor service!

A touch and go 3 star overall, but being in a festive mood, having had some decent wine, I decided to be generous. 

A beautiful venue, but food is below par and the service was OK on a very quite afternoon.

14pax for three course lunch and one raved about a dish, the pasta. When a medium rare steak is killed and oxtail is tough, then something needs to drastically change in the kitchen. 

PS: Been a while since I had snails. These were well prepared and delicate. The garlic was a little to light for my liking.

The kids enjoyed it. I had a problem with their menu. I ordered nougat parcels as dessert and didn't get cherry chocolate icecream as stated on the menu. When I complained they gave me more vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce with a cherry on top. Not impressed at all.

ChIJb-MRKF6zzR0R98OI8srcFuI.adr_address: Groenvlei Farm, Annandale road, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJb-MRKF6zzR0R98OI8srcFuI.formatted_address: Groenvlei Farm, Annandale road, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJb-MRKF6zzR0R98OI8srcFuI.name: Peter Falke Wines

reviews.text: Lovely, relaxed atmosphere. A nice big lawn with tables and chairs. Spread out. Not rushed. Menu is limited to cheese / cold meat platter and salads. Separate formal wine tasting area. Very accommodating in terms of accessibility for mobility issues.

One of my most favorite places to relax. Here you are secured of good service and great quality wine. Food is simple, but very tasty. Terrace is not packed with tables, so you have enough space and privacy. Love it!

The service,  ambiance and view were wonderful.  Five star.  The Stellenbosch Reserve Moederkerk Chardonnay with a light touch of wood was delightful.   The meal was  just -4*.   Chips a little soft,  'tempura' batter on onion rings a bit heavy,  water on the plate with the broccoli made the butter sauce watery and the kingklip was just a touch overcooked.   The burger was very good and the pork fillet was very tender,  the sweet potato mash underseasoned.  Creme brulee and cheesecake were very good.   A lovely day out.
Very nice location, but poor service, and overpriced food. Also not great meal options for kids.
Was a great experience....our 2nd Galileo movie and its always an adventure!

ChIJZ7UG_OEGzR0Rz8_JWoBP2-c.adr_address: Noord Agter - Paarl Rd, Windmeul, Paarl, 7623, South Africa
ChIJZ7UG_OEGzR0Rz8_JWoBP2-c.formatted_address: Noord Agter - Paarl Rd, Windmeul, Paarl, 7623, South Africa
ChIJZ7UG_OEGzR0Rz8_JWoBP2-c.name: Rhebokskloof

reviews.text: We spent a Sunday afternoon at Rhebokskloof for a picnic with a group of family and friends and had a wonderful time. The staff were friendly and accommodating, the setting was fantastic, the food was good and the kids loved the pony rides. Highly recommended as a family friendly venue in the winelands.

Galileo open air theatre was held at Rheboksloof wine estate on select Saturday's. The staff that was part of Galileo were friendly and organised with regards to the backrests and blankets provided. The wine estate in itself is absolutely breathtaking. The type of movie was perfect for the views and surroundings at Rhebokskloof. Due to the venue being a wine estate we were obligated to buy their wine, which was not to bad. The food choices for Galileo were very limited. The wine estate was featured in the movie Vir Altyd and could be used as a wedding venue as in the movie.  I had an amazing experience at Rhebokskloof wine estate and would definitely recommend it to others.

Wonderful experience. 
Meals were tasty (certainly recommend the double stack children burger with guacamole, mayo, bbq sauce, rocket and peperdew). Stunning view as well of the lake, and lovely greenery. ðŸ’¯
Absolutely Fantasic!!I've enjoy every sec!!!

We had a lovely lunch with wine and then ordered a case of wine to be delivered for my fathers birthday.  7 weeks later I STILL HAVE NO WINE AND NO REFUND!!!  I cannot believe that somewhere can operate like this they think that an assurance that this hasn't happened before makes it ok.  My fathers birthday present was RUINED and I am sick of chasing them for a response and my refund!

ChIJZ7UG_OEGzR0Rz8_JWoBP2-c.vicinity: Noord Agter - Paarl Road, Windmeul, Paarl

reviews.text:
We stayed in the Forrest Cottage for 6 days.
The accommodations were, comfortable, luxurious and tidy. This is a wonderful place to relax and yet have all the excitement of Stellenbosch and the fine restaurant, Jordan's, nearby.
Opportunity for walks on the property are endless, with beautiful views and varied landscapes. The privacy of the property guarantees security.
The staff took care of us in the most kind and caring manner. Breakfasts were a feast.
Our visit brings happy memories!

I have no idea what the problem with this place. We arrived at this place and was chased out immediately. Was asked why we were there and how we got into their private premises.

.....no other comment

ChIJDWDLV2BNzB0RFzgPOXO_8lo.vicinity: Stellenbosch Kloof Road, Stellenbosch, Cape Town

reviews.text: They're a boutique wine farm and wine tasting is by appointment only. They have a gorgeous intimate venue for hire with a fireplace, leather couches and a stunning view of their vineyard. Their red wine is simply exquisite! And the owner, Magdaleen blew us away with her warmth and friendliness.
Wonderful view and very nice people.
Beatiful setting, a personal experience, good wine

Boschendal is a majestic estate with something for everyone. From food to mountain biking. There are a deli and restaurant with picnic facilities under the shades of beautiful trees. Mountain bikes can be rented and ridden on the flowing trail network on the other side of the road. There are also a few guesthouses available for those who want to experience the farm life overnight.
Great picnics, farm-to-table cuisine,wine and food pairing, lots of activities,beautiful scenery, good guest experience, family friendly. Enough to keep you entertained the whole day.
Beautiful and relaxing place to go.. A little more expensive for south Africa prices but you do get what you pay for.. I wish there were places like that in the UK..
Great place, awesome wines. This place is so beautiful and open.
An excellent (previously owned by Cycil John Rhodes) wine estate with wines that is known globally

ChIJtUa17o60zR0RXAfvm53wMKo.adr_address: Annandale Rd, Stellenbosch NU, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJtUa17o60zR0RXAfvm53wMKo.formatted_address: Annandale Rd, Stellenbosch NU, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJtUa17o60zR0RXAfvm53wMKo.name: Ernie Els Wines

reviews.text: Our third wine tasting selection for the day.  Definitely donâ€™t miss it if youâ€™re visiting. I must confess my passion for golf but that aside, the farm is a complete experience from the farm entrance with amazing views over the Helderberg mountains (another passion) then the front entrance with those beautiful rocks. Not to mention the quality of the staff serving you. Friendly, responsive to questions, and keeping just the right pace for tasting. We sat outside, the sun shining, the view over the mountains, quality wines which are always in play just completed the round !. Ok apology for that one. You have to try your hand at chipping too. Pity the restaurant wasnâ€™t open on Monday but weâ€™ll be back, rest assured!

The experience of driving e wines tested in thus wonderful.setting and seeing.the dams and lands is absolutely fabulous. The wines tested were really balanced and Smith and noticeably better than many we tested on the day. Compliments to Ernie and your staff for the great feeling of being a proud South African   . 
Michael
Lovely setting. Good scenery nice staff, very friendly. Worth visiting. You need to put this on your list to visit.
The experience here is just great all around. Especially the amazing customer service, smiles all around. Very impressed!
Dad got hole in one and won bottle of wine ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ very nice people around to make you feel good

reviews.text: Simple and unpretentious. Locally sourced produce prepared perfectly. Absolutely delicious food!

Russell & Camilla have created a wonderful setting where they create amazing food. Guests are seated on their own, with bowls of food delivered to the table. The food is simple, fresh, with loads of flavour. Russell will advise you on the wine depending on the meal being served, and his recommendation was spot-on. You will have to book at least 1-2 weeks in advance and prepare to be surprised!

Visited February 2014
This wine estate was a complete surprise. It has a rich history and it feels so welcoming. The wines are fantastic. It is a must-visit when in Stellenbosch winelands.
Hidden gem with great food in beautiful setting. Staff are friendly, food is tasty and wine is stunning.
Beautiful setting. Excellent food. I got married here. Epic day.

ChIJdfOKnjlNzB0RqYiSCyZS2a0.vicinity: Overgaauw Wine Estate, Stellenboschkloof Road, Vlottenburg, Western Cape, South Africa

ChIJBUdpCQCzzR0RjA6pzRa0AQY.adr_address: Remhoogte Wine Estate, R44, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJBUdpCQCzzR0RjA6pzRa0AQY.formatted_address: Remhoogte Wine Estate, R44, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJBUdpCQCzzR0RjA6pzRa0AQY.name: Remhoogte Wine Estate

reviews.text:
It's hard to decide what is better, the wine, the views or the cheese platters, regardless of which is best they are all amazing.

I would recommend the reserve wine tasting option as all four wines are outstanding. The staff are extremely knowledgeable about the wines and friendly. Lots of laughs and just great vibes.
Excellent wines, gorgeous views, quiet and clean. Personnel is very kind and helping.

My husband and I stayed at Zebra Cottage which is a small house on the wine estate for a week. We loved it. We walked through the vineyards and up into the hills. The cottage itself was a bit rustic and could have been tidier, but we loved the veranda, the six winery dogs, and the beautiful views. I have only one complaint. We stayed on the grounds of a winery, and no one made an effort to talk to us about the wine! If there had been a welcome bottle on the table with a note, or if anyone on the property had offered to give us a tour or even schedule a tasting, we would have been thrilled. Perhaps the focus on the winery is not the two rental houses...I understand. It was still a terrific place to stay. It is just unfortunate we had to go wine tasting somewhere else.
Great space, food, beer and wine. Animal lovers will appreciate the 7 chilled out dogs plus zebras, antelope, and wildebeest wandering the property too.
terrible service- when we arrived the tasting room staff did not greet or welcome us. Left because of this

reviews.text: Awesome honey moon suite, great view, nice breakfast, friendly people.  We had a great time here!  Something to remember and cherish forever.
Well equipped rooms. Good breakfasts. Not very neat around the hotel with furniture standing around. Rubbish around the pool not well kept.
Lovely place with a great vibe

It is a beautiful Wine Estate with warmhearted and friendly owners & staff. We truly enjoyed our visit there.
The wine is out of this world. I have definately found a wine there that would make me a regular customer. Awesome sunsets there. A tranquil place that warms your heart and make you forget about your stress; and thoughts of the week ahead's stress and responsabilities. Stunning !
Do not know about the guest house, but the wines are superb.

reviews.text: With a beautiful location and incredible wines, Kleine Zalze has definitely become one of my favourite wine farms. The tasting is very affordable and they offer a good variety of their wines for the tasting. The staff were incredible friendly and very knowledgeable about the wines they were presenting. If you're in the area I would highly recommend visiting Kleine Zalze.

Very nice venue... however food  portions extremely expensive and portions very small. The starter portions are embarrassingly small
Almost invisible on the plate... Terroir might be on the 5* list... other wine farm Restaurants in the same star category offer far better value .
A very good place with good service and good wines
Great service but not very wheelchair friendly. Ramp difficult to access and use.
Sometimes very under-qualified tasting staff and long waits, which is only the fault of the owners. Good wine.

ChIJfdOMHBGzzR0RhYT31FGSQo4.vicinity: Strand Road, De Zalze Golf Estate, Stellenbosch

Thank u for the lovely comfort night over and breakfast will definitely recommend you guys.
Epic winning

Beautiful view,most affordable value for money wines.Best Port
Dis my hart

ChIJ7938k8u0zR0R-YToBJnuDg0.formatted_address: Sir Lowrys Pass, Knorhoek Estate entrance, Sir Lowry's Pass, Cape Town, 7130, South Africa

reviews.text: Restaurant with wonderful ambience and good food which is presented beautifully. Lovely views. Staff very knowledgable and helpful. Building is modern with beautiful finishing touches. Shop has interesting items on display. Road to venue bit on dicey side with sharp turns

One of my happiest Mother's Day memories! The view is beyond words and the interior both classy and stylish. Going for a wine tasting here is a unique and special experience. The waiters and bar staff are very knowledgeable, and such fun to have around! It's a real pleasure taking it all in: the wine, the food, the people! Some menu items are a bit pricey, but they're worth it.
Thank you for a wonderful wine pairing experience last week. We were celebrating a birthday, and really enjoyed the afternoon.

Idiom has that special Italian touch, with super unfussy service, classy but relaxed wine tasting with yummy Italian variatals. We had delicious thin crusted pizza, with bread and special red wine infused onion and parsley flavored butter as well as tamato gazpacho thrown in with the deal!
Very nice atmosphere. The view is stunning.

ChIJ7938k8u0zR0R-YToBJnuDg0.vicinity: Sir Lowrys Pass, Knorhoek Estate entrance, Sir Lowry's Pass

ChIJIWC5PYPnzR0RzEvkdpfSqO0.adr_address: R43, Bot River, 7185, South Africa
ChIJIWC5PYPnzR0RzEvkdpfSqO0.name: Wildekrans Wine Estate

reviews.text: Oh you have to go here. It's beautiful. The staff are so nice you want to steal one and put him in your car boot. First time horse riding for me, and I'm a changed man. Wife cantered away, but Edward looked after me. The restaurant, Forage, is superb. And their champagne. Best kept secret. And the pinotage.

This used to be one of my "must visit" wineries; that was until my last visit on 22 February; which will be my last visit. Only 4 of the 6 Estate wines were available yet we still had to pay full price for tasting. The reds were served at S.A. room temperature which was almost 30 degrees. I could barely understand our waiter, who was not very helpful.

We headed out to Botriver the past weekend for the annual " Over the Rainbow" festival and we were not disappointed. One of the estate visited was the picturesque Wilde krans, majestiv views and the most beautiful spring blossoms. The wines were exceptional although I was verh conflicted by the delightful Sauvignon Blanc "Shark" for on my visit check oug my instagram page @throughmywineglass

We were very disappointed. The wine was not pleasant and the service at the tasting room was terrible - we kept having to ask for the next wine. We also couldn't understand how the wines have so many awards but we didn't feel the wine was very nice. We had ordered food - which was delicious. There seems to be a miscommunication however because when we asked for the bill it was a whole complication because the food and the wine are two different companies.
Best place ever. Wish I could give 6 stars!!

reviews.text:
Another beautiful wine estate. The name lives up to its name. Rest in peace.
It's very peaceful here. Beauty surrounds you in every direction.  Wine tasting is great and restaurant serves good food. 
This estate is set at the foot of the mountains in a beautiful setting.

Great wine tasting place and they have a simple lunch menu. The restaurant is extraordinary. The best restaurant experience we had in South Africa. Fantastic food and staff. If you can get a booking. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Stellenbosch.
Only one white wine - wooded. No vegetarian options on the menu, only salmon or steak to choose from. Managerial staff not very helpfull.
Stunning setting, in the top 100 wines in Wine Spectator. Fabulous lunch under the trees.
Wonderful. A must place to visit, drink wine and eat!

ChIJjb4TD_fmzR0R8xkZNfLxYQc.name: Gabrielskloof Wine Estate

reviews.text: Unbelievable wine and food experience. The cheese and meat platter is to die for and can be recommended. Please don't change a thing on the platter. The odd combination of vanilla ice cream and olive oil can also be recommended. Will indeed visit Gabrielskloof again.

open clean fresh lines without fuss nor frill
interesting wines to compliment your cuisine
generous portions and wide wide patios with cushioned seating to while wile (wine!?) away your leisure time.
perhaps I am favourably bias ... just a lovely clean vista be it dry or wet

Tranquill place to share with many friends and family. View, food, service is excellent. Inside and outside. Enough parking for all. Other activities like wine tasting, olive tasting , purchasing of excellent brands. Excellent wine cellar and wedding venue...
One of the most beautiful settings. The staff is friendly and the restaurant serves great food. A great place also for breakfast - try the eggs GabriÃ«lskloof - and wine tasting.

Superb wine tasting with excellent service and great views. They also have a chocolate pairing option! Complimentary bread, olive oil and olives are included in the meagre R30 tasting fee, which is waived upon the purchase of any wine.

reviews.text: Wonderful food. And very fair pricing. The place is also not as posh as other vineyards. Very good!
Amazing very but slooooow service, had to get a menu myself and call waitress to help us.
Very good setting. Good food.
Awesome view, delicious food and prices very reasonable. Love this place.
No service... left due to staff showing no interest in helping.

reviews.text: Beautiful wine tasting venue. I Enjoyed my visit a lot. The staff is super friendly. The wine is produced organically.
Beautiful organic wine estate

Beautiful views surround the Estate with friendly staff on hand to help with your wine tasting experience or just look in the window as the techs analyse the product, all very interesting for the uninitiated. Wine is of course also on hand and with a quick lesson in pairing, you might just leave with a box or two.

ChIJF3boO8iuzR0R0tB4m80Smao.adr_address: Klapmuts Simondium Road, Simondium, 7670, South Africa
ChIJF3boO8iuzR0R0tB4m80Smao.formatted_address: Klapmuts Simondium Road, Simondium, 7670, South Africa

reviews.text: A wonderful experience with inspiration for one's own garden ! Many photographic opportunities of trees, flowers, vegetables and Cape-Dutch structures. Informative, relaxing and a great family outing. Food and beverages unfortunately very expensive

Absolutely picturesque farm with such incredible views! The wines on offer are not only affordable but such a pleasure to drink! The platters are beautifully presented and full of different elements from vegetables to cheeses to pÃ¢tÃ©. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable about most of what goes on, on the farm. Didnâ€™t try the restaurant, but whether you just go for a wine tasting or go for a meal, itâ€™s a definite â€˜must tryâ€™.

This is  a garden like no other! You can wander around an array of gardens.. Fruit trees every where.. And vegetables planted of all kinds.. It is a real treat! The berry garden is our favorite! When you are hungry go to their garden cafe and have one of their freshly squeezed juices - they are divine..and their sandwiches are amazing.. You can spend a whole day here relaxing!

This is such a wonderful farm! Wine tasting, excellent food and a beautiful garden to explore. The deli and scent shop are great and they recently opened a bakery and butchery on site. The prices are steep but the quality is excellent. Entry is R10 per person during the week and R20 per person on weekends. This place is very popular so get there around 9am to beat the crowds. The Greenhouse sells popsicles at the Entrance which is great on a hot day.

This is an absolutely enchanting farm with the most spectacular views. Just walking through the extensive gardens alone will leave you feeling like youâ€™re in a fairytale world. The farms offers wine tasting and has two restaurants one of which is set in a greenhouse and the other is by reservation only (Babel). I would highly recommend this place for a day out with the family. Donâ€™t forget to check out the zen garden!

reviews.text: The Wine is magnificent! The people are warm and welcoming! This is without a doubt the best Shiraz in the world!!!

reviews.text: Friendly and hospitable. Good bubbly. Beautiful tasting room and fantastic scenery.
Came here during a random weekend adventure. Really enjoyed learning about what they do. We had a personal tour through the cellars and an overall good time. The place offers great views!
Great bubbly and views
Charles Fox is so friendly and down to earth. He let us roam around the cellar, explained the MCC process patiently and let us play with the cat, Harry Potter.

What a great surprise. Great quality vintage MDC "champagne". Charles Fox himself gave me a tour of his cellar. Not only was the champagne delicious but it was great to see that it was a family run business. Definitely a place I will continue to support.

ChIJWxPMK1KtzR0R5Uu7htpCo9Y.adr_address: Devon Valley Rd, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJWxPMK1KtzR0R5Uu7htpCo9Y.formatted_address: Devon Valley Rd, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJWxPMK1KtzR0R5Uu7htpCo9Y.name: Clos Malverne Wine Farm

reviews.text: We thought we'd just pop in for a wine tasting as we had taken a drive out to Stellenbosch for the day.  We were not expecting the royal treatment we received, from the moment we walked through the doors!! We were warmly welcomed and made comfortable in the lounge area. Amy, our hostess, was really amazing. She explained each of the wines we selected in a way that really communicated her genuine love and appreciation for, not only the processes, but also the stories behind the wines. We've been for loads of wine tastings, but this experience was truly made unique because of how well Amy looked after us. I would highly recommend a visit to Clos Malverne. Their menu is a delight, and the friendly atmosphere and welcoming staff are simply bar none.
Amazing view over the vineyards and mountains, delicious wine with pairing food, excellent service and very well priced.
Loved this place, fantastic wine food and treatment.

Very disappointed, not impressed.  We wanted wine tasting plus something to eat.  Decided to visit as there was no indication that they were closed for renovation only to be told they open 2 August again.
Little hidden gem with beautiful scenery and close to campus for a quick study break ;)

ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.adr_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, 7680, Western Cape, South Africa, 7680, South Africa
ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.formatted_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, 7680, Western Cape, South Africa, 7680, South Africa
ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.name: Allee Bleue Wine Estate

reviews.text: Booked a family picnic and wow! What a lovely experience we had. When making the booking I informed them, we were celebrating a birthday, and they surprised us with a taste of their fine wine. That was really special. Our kids were entertained on the beautiful lawn and with the jungle gym. The food was amazing and the service excellent. Definitely a picnic venue for the whole family, but still elegant and very charming.
Nice place. Nothing over the top but ok wines.
Pretty farm. Fun place and not just for kidz!

ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.vicinity: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, 7680, Western Cape, South Africa

reviews.text:
After stopping at several larger, more commercial wineries, we happened upon Eikehof Wines just shy of their closing time, and they graciously agreed to let us do a wine tasting...and we're so glad it worked out!

We tasted some amazing wines including the best dessert wine I've ever had, we chatted away with the hostess and learned a lot from her about wine-farming, especially in light of the current drought in the Cape, and we felt welcomed. Overall it was an excellent experience and a highlight for our wine-tastings.

What a lovely unpretentious winery.
Genuine people, unfussy wines and great location. 
Thank you ladies for a very informative visit and wine tasting. ðŸ˜ ðŸ˜ ðŸ˜ ðŸ˜

A warm, friendly atmosphere. In contrast to other wine farms in the area which were far more commercial in their approach, Eikehof offers the more family run, hospitable type of wine tasting experience.
Amazing, personable owners who take the time to chat, share their enthusiasm for wine making, and of course incredibly beautiful, smooth wines.
What is warmer than the current weather...Eikehof's hospitality! Thanks to Francois, Elize and Corna

ChIJXQPpg_lNzB0RQIWbGyEgNhE.adr_address: Langverwacht Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Cape Town, 7600, South Africa
ChIJXQPpg_lNzB0RQIWbGyEgNhE.formatted_address: Langverwacht Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Cape Town, 7600, South Africa
ChIJXQPpg_lNzB0RQIWbGyEgNhE.name: Altydlig

reviews.text: Beautiful views in the day with the vineyards and Table Mountain in the background and at night with the nightlights flowing into forever...  what a fantastic experience and excellent service! Thank you ALTYDLIG management and staffðŸ‘Œ
Awesum Wedding venue
Breathtaking view, awesome place

It is wonderful that we live in a city where you dont have to go far to experience nature, I passed a used condom and a knockout drunk guy before getting to my car this morning. It took me 30 minutes to go from that to the sound of doves cooing and peacocks calling over the vinyards. It is such a privillage to be able to go to places like this.

Too bad the serenity of the place was shattered by a man verbally attacking me for mistaking the dirt road to his property for the exit.  Maybe a private property sign will help?
Birthday shoot

ChIJXQPpg_lNzB0RQIWbGyEgNhE.vicinity: Langverwacht Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Cape Town

ChIJKefm4MSuzR0RIIdywRRg_xo.name: Noble Hill wine estate

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing food and wine. Setting is excellent even on a windy day. Owner is really polite and friendly. Best Mexican style food Iâ€™ve had in SA!!

Amazing setting that is very well thought out. The picnic basket for 2 is incredible value for money with a great blend of Mexican and traditional Cheeses with a fresh warm ciabatta. 

What made them really shine is though is an incredible 2015 Chardonnay, booking in advance that allowed them to impress us with extras at no charge and above all fantastic staff that bridges the gap between fine dining and a lovely Sunday by the dam. 

Exceptional.
Great for kids. Very relaxing
Beautiful setting to try some fantastic wines.  Our host was very attentive and knowledgeable
The picnic was really nice the only negative point was that the dogs were running around free and were peeing next to our picnic and the service was really slow inside.

ChIJkQ7yIjBozB0RnYeHPdgkawE.adr_address: Constantia Main Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJkQ7yIjBozB0RnYeHPdgkawE.formatted_address: Constantia Main Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJkQ7yIjBozB0RnYeHPdgkawE.name: Eagles' Nest Wines

reviews.text: Had a nice winetasting here. Good wines, good introduction made by the staff. Nice setting. On Sunday there were quite some families and kids playing on the lawn. Would definitely come back.

Waste of petrol. Such good scenery and such poor service and food. And if you driving and don't won't wine I suggest you sneak in your own soft drinks as this place only caitters for people that walk there.  Either that or promoting drinking and driving.

This is one of my good memory in South Africa. This is quiet on Monday morning. Two lovely couples and I were enjoying in the beautiful scene of this winery. The waiter's service is good and professional. They treated me well and present their wines clearly. I bought two bottles of their wine later. It is worthy to take a break in this fantasy place.
Lovely, relaxing. Great space for kids. Food variety limited. Wine tasty.

Situated in a beautiful treed valley off Constantia road with rolling lawns..picture perfect. Went for a wine tasting. The rain came and we had to squash into the entrance lounge. A pleasant experience which could have been greatly improved had the fireplace been crackling away with a fire. The outside seating also had no umbrellas erected.

ChIJkQ7yIjBozB0RnYeHPdgkawE.vicinity: Constantia Main Road, Constantia, Cape Town

ChIJoyhIS6WuzR0RH_4TAMTBSjw.adr_address: Klapmuts - Simondium Rd, Paarl, 7625, South Africa
ChIJoyhIS6WuzR0RH_4TAMTBSjw.formatted_address: Klapmuts - Simondium Rd, Paarl, 7625, South Africa
ChIJoyhIS6WuzR0RH_4TAMTBSjw.name: Backsberg Estate Cellars

reviews.text:
We enjoyed cappuccinos on the restaurant veranda overlooking the patio dining area in, which is in dappled shade surrounded by trees and shrubs. The indoors part of the restaurant has an old worldly feel even though it appears to be of modern construction. Our waitress recommended booking a table during the busy summer months.

The wine tasting room provides tasting at a counter standing, or seated indoors or outdoors. The staff member helping us is friendly and knowledgeable about the wines. Containers are provided to empty your glass into after tasting. Please do not drink and drive! Wines can be bought by the bottle or case and can be delivered.

The small garden is beautifully kept and in a perfect condition. Visitors are allowed to explore the garden. Do not miss the water feature!

A friend chose it and told me the burgers were amazing. Unfortunately not the case ,my Lamb burger was 2.5 pieces of Roast lamb slices,the beef burger that another in our group ordered tasted like, as he put put it "Frozen burger that you cook out the box" . I skipped dessert . If you're looking for a place to drink - yes. Feeling hungry ? Eat before you come so you aren't disappointed.

Visiting from Germany and doing an informal tasting at the counter with Mildred. She told us everything about the wines, the winery and the business. Also she convinced us of 6 different wines, One of them was a lovely red blend with Zinfandel which was quite surprising to find since we havent seen Zinfandel here in Cape Winelands at all. They have such a large variety of wines available, all wines we tasted were lovely and and it was a great and really fun wine tasting experience with Mildred. If you look for a relaxed down to earth Place with a Great tasting and delicious wines here you go.
We had the wine and chocolate pairing; wines were not great but chocolate was good.
Came here coz it is the reason I drink CabSav. And then I found that they do brandy too. Very nice Spanish feel that adds to the ambience of the visit

ChIJ4ag-Ml-8zR0RTac9cdL07T0.adr_address: Excelsior Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJ4ag-Ml-8zR0RTac9cdL07T0.name: La Bourgogne Winefarm

reviews.text: Always a great experience. Good wine. Stunning olive oil. Love the Cape Brandy. Have to leave with branded glasses, 3L olive oil and a few other goodies under the arms.
Great wine and food. Sitting under the oak trees was relaxing while the kids were busy in the playground.

This was a nice place to sit in the garden sun.

There were several dogs that were fun to interact with and watch.

The wine was not amazing, but still delectable.
Lovely wine, very friendly staff and the platter was stunning. The dogs were super friendly too!
Always a great welcome and a great meal. Very good value for money.

ChIJO00iDk-7zR0Rbp2E0wSyJ5c.adr_address: R45, Franschhoek, Cape Town, 7690, South Africa
ChIJO00iDk-7zR0Rbp2E0wSyJ5c.formatted_address: R45, Franschhoek, Cape Town, 7690, South Africa
ChIJO00iDk-7zR0Rbp2E0wSyJ5c.name: Maison Estate

reviews.text: Congratulations Liam and team. I visited the restaurant at Maison Estate in January 2017 while it had another name and chef. It was extremely disappointing. I had dinner with friends a week ago and it was magnifique. The service, the attention to detail, the quality of food and the innovative menu was faultless. Well done ! .
A lovely stop over with that "on the farm " feeling with good food and wine. Lovely venue for weddings.
Fantastic estate, great location, delicious cuisine.. friendly and polite staff..
The best service we had on the wine tram and nicest wine too
Awesome service. A very informative waiter. Delicious wines. A bit expensive, but worth a stop.
Very nice wines with amazing views and lovely, knowledgeable staff. Great to get away from the huge wineries.

Very nice place with an amazing view! We went there a Friday night as the place closes at 8pm. We really enjoyed the view. The wines are good. And the staff is welcoming. We had very interesting explanations.
The sauvignon blanc is my favourite.
Great wine and beutiful farm

ChIJyy__NuWtzR0RAm3iktqXtsc.adr_address: Rustenberg Rd, Idaâ€™s Valley, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJyy__NuWtzR0RAm3iktqXtsc.formatted_address: Rustenberg Rd, Idaâ€™s Valley, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJyy__NuWtzR0RAm3iktqXtsc.name: Rustenberg Wines

reviews.text:
Attended a wine tasting at Rustenberg. The person presenting the wines was informative and enthusiastic which made the tasting that bit more enjoyable than the average wine tasting.

The buildings and grounds are very well maintained and it is possible to take a stroll around them after the wine tasting.

Despite a stunning view and beautiful gardens, the staff were not forthcoming and did not keep our reservation. We were also disregarded due to our age and the staff did not keep our place in line because â€˜we are just kids and we can waitâ€™ in her words.
One of the best wine experiences around. Very personal wine tasting sessions. Always a pleasure.
Lovely place.
Great wine and an amazing setting. Little known gem so never really huge crowds when you get here. Walk around the gardens a must

ChIJt5gVk3fJzR0RQ4ukl6dip7k.adr_address: 17 Old Sir Lowrys Pass Rd, Sir Lowry's Pass, 7133, South Africa
ChIJt5gVk3fJzR0RQ4ukl6dip7k.formatted_address: 17 Old Sir Lowrys Pass Rd, Sir Lowry's Pass, 7133, South Africa
ChIJt5gVk3fJzR0RQ4ukl6dip7k.name: Onderkloof Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Awesome little winery. Has fantastic views over the entire helderberg area including views looking up to Sir Lowry's Pass. The location at the foot of Sir Lowry's Pass is lovely and still close to Somerset West and Gordons Bay.

The wines are fantastic and the welcome is warm. Be sure to make a booking.
Absolutely gorgeous, fantastic wines and fabulous hosts that go the extra mile to make you feel special
Hidden gem with stunning wines!
Wonderful Place with a spectacular view and excellent wines from the young winemaker Yves! Stop over and convince yourself.

ChIJt5gVk3fJzR0RQ4ukl6dip7k.vicinity: 17 Old Sir Lowrys Pass Rd, Sir Lowry's Pass

ChIJuyRtSPW0zR0RnoXCBa8-uYY.adr_address: Annandale Rd, Stellenbosch NU, Stellenbosch, 7613, South Africa
ChIJuyRtSPW0zR0RnoXCBa8-uYY.formatted_address: Annandale Rd, Stellenbosch NU, Stellenbosch, 7613, South Africa
ChIJuyRtSPW0zR0RnoXCBa8-uYY.name: Hidden Valley Wines

reviews.text: This is a magnificent Wine Estae. Tucked away like a precious gem. Food excellent. Wine divine and most delicious olives. Stunning venue set in a beautiful hidden valley. The restaurant is situated on a hill and overlooks the picturesque vineyards, beautiful manicured gardens and  the Deck restaurant.  For a real treat of great food and wine, sit and enjoy the tranquility, the  beauty of the mountains and fresh air.

Beautiful setting, delicious food. Eating lunch on the floating deck is definitely worth a trip up the valley. The service at the self-service kiosk is not very fast, but worth the wait. There's enough wine to keep you occupied while waiting for the food.
We had a truly lovely family picnic under the trees. It was lovely and cool. The basket goodies were delicious. A great time and highly recommended.
Great Views & friendly staff. Excellent wines! Tastings starting 55R. Go for the extra cheese platter!
Had a good lunch at The Deck at Hidden Valley Wines today. Great casual atmosphere and the views are magnificent. We will definitely be back!

ChIJX3UP_bRZzB0RnaTsfwiCvEM.adr_address: M13, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJX3UP_bRZzB0RnaTsfwiCvEM.formatted_address: M13, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7550, South Africa
ChIJX3UP_bRZzB0RnaTsfwiCvEM.name: Hillcrest Wine and Olive Estate

reviews.text: Nice atmosphere, food average, aiming for exclusiveness, food not really family orientated, but lively playareas for kids.

Relaxed vibe with great views and good service. This is a great place for brunch with tasty breakfast options, or have a beer tasting board with some tapas. Awesome place to hang out with a group of people.
Great venue. Pizzas from outside beer garden are some the best in CT
Great restaurant with beautiful views. We had a lovely breakfast here.
Went to the brewery here. Some good options, and pizza was also good. My wife buys olive oil here in bulk.

ChIJ13rBOOnnzR0RvEEF6oWqc3w.adr_address: Van Der Stel Pass Road, Bot River, 7185, South Africa
ChIJ13rBOOnnzR0RvEEF6oWqc3w.formatted_address: Van Der Stel Pass Road, Bot River, 7185, South Africa
ChIJ13rBOOnnzR0RvEEF6oWqc3w.name: Luddite Wine Farm

reviews.text: We had some very nice wines, and Niels was kind enough to sit down and try them with us. Cash is easier to pay with if you want to take a few home with you. They also have olive oil produced locally.
Great wine! Beautiful setting! Wine maker did our tasting himself. Highly recommended
A stunning wine farm that produces luscious, big reds and mesmerising, soft melon whites. Of the very best I have ever experienced.

So much fun with the owner/winemaker. Wish we could have brought back more. Saboteurs 
Together.
Wine tasting by appointment only, organically grown grapes and brilliant wines

ChIJ13rBOOnnzR0RvEEF6oWqc3w.vicinity: Van Der Stel Pass Road, Bot River

ChIJ7yyiyXvEzR0Rd8ji0RtTJBY.name: Paul Cluver Estate Wine

reviews.text: Wow!! Not only is the wine fantastic and of high standard, this time around we went to watch a show - Prime Circle. What an amazing setting and vibe. The amphitheater that is surrounded by trees makes it lovely to just sit and appreciate nature! What a wonderful day we had! See you soon!
Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The wine is also great
Awesome place to be at and even more so if you ride the trails.
Fantastic wine, wonderful hosts and lovely surroundings.

It was quite a nice surprise to find this wine farm on the road to Hermanus. Usually we just fly by, but on the day decided to pay them a visit. We were rewarded with a beautiful farm, warm service and great wines.

ChIJ7yyiyXvEzR0Rd8ji0RtTJBY.vicinity: Paul Cluver Estate Wines, N2, Kromco Turn off, De Rust Estate, Grabouw
