ChIJZYV0GZqrzR0R7LQ_xCwmPss.name: Backsberg Wine Estate

reviews.text: Excellent place. Wine tasting was informative and relaxed. Shout out to Victoria who was great. Maitre d at the restaurant was condescending and not helpful. I would visit this place again. Great history and excellent ambience.
Watched the picnic consert. Awesome venue, well organized. Thanks
Beautiful gardens, mellow 60â€™s ballad-ey music, tasty and tender spitroast lamb. Whatâ€™s not to like? ðŸ˜Š
Great venue with excellent wines
This is incorrect google spam. Google refuse to correct this misinformation

ChIJf6ORh2yyzR0RUs7KIktLVVs.adr_address: Old Banhoek Road, Helshoogte Pass, Stellenbosch, Cape town, 7612, South Africa
ChIJf6ORh2yyzR0RUs7KIktLVVs.formatted_address: Old Banhoek Road, Helshoogte Pass, Stellenbosch, Cape town, 7612, South Africa
ChIJf6ORh2yyzR0RUs7KIktLVVs.name: MolenVliet Oosthuizen Family Vineyards

reviews.text:
Came here for a friend's wedding. The location and the views were stunning. The wines also very good, although admittedly I don't really recall which ones we had. We just had A LOT.
The food after the wedding was very good.

I attended the wedding of a close friend in this family winery. It was one of the most special weddings Iâ€™ve ever been to. The landscape, the food, the wine, everything was absolutely perfect. And the service was beyond superb. Fantastic place

Stayed here for a close friend's wedding which was at the venue. Libby at the front destination was a star! 
Rooms are pricey but the setting is absolutely stunning, open your curtains in the morning to a perfect scene of pristine picturesque mountain ranges dwarfing everything else in view. Look down in front of you and gaze over the lush green Shiraz vineyards.
They are close to a Berry farm (other side of the valley) close to Stellenbosch (if you'd like to visit) else you have an array of vineyards in the vicinity.
NOTE: there are horse fields next door so there are lots of flies, but they do spray the building etc to control the situation.

We stayed here for a couple of nights in the mountain view rooms and had a wonderful time . We especially loved the wood fire powered hottubs ! We had friendly service and the rooms are so well decorated it made us feel very much at home .
Absolutely Fabulous.. .didn't want to leave. Definitely recommend it.

ChIJf6ORh2yyzR0RUs7KIktLVVs.vicinity: Old Banhoek Road, Helshoogte Pass, Stellenbosch, Cape town

ChIJqeXmbZTnzR0RWwh3whZwDXw.adr_address: 16 Hoof Way, Bot River, 7185, South Africa
ChIJqeXmbZTnzR0RWwh3whZwDXw.formatted_address: 16 Hoof Way, Bot River, 7185, South Africa
ChIJqeXmbZTnzR0RWwh3whZwDXw.name: Beaumont Wines

reviews.text: Beautiful estate! My group just did a wine tasting but they refused to let us sit down, even though Iâ€™m pregnant. Many tables were open! So I sat by myself on a bench where they allowed me to- far away from my group. Wish they could have made a small exception for a pregnant lady just looking to enjoy the afternoon with family.

Had such a lovely experience at the wine estate.. The winemakers son even showed my daughter to the play area. The wines are amazing especially the 2016 Chenin Blanch Demi-Sec which I thoroughly enjoyed.. For more on my experience visit my instagram page @throughmywineglass
Nice wines, especially the white dessert one
Top quality wines great atmosphere would recomend a visit

Such a stunning place. Great trail for running. Beautiful scenery. Wine. And a very griendly family.
We hope to see you guys in the future again.

ChIJzws0T2C7zR0Rnw1eWS_ltv4.adr_address: Main Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJzws0T2C7zR0Rnw1eWS_ltv4.name: Rickety Bridge Winery

reviews.text: Went for the wine tasting. Very welcoming, great wine, friendly people, beautiful place! The view is majestic as the property is situated on the side of a hill. A big selection of inexpensive wines. One of my favorite stops on our trip.

Very nice winery. They serve the biggest portions of wine during tasting. The server was wonderful. The place felt warm and homey. The scenery is not the best at this winery, but the wine, service, and environment are top notch.
Food, service & atmosphere was tops. Will definitely visit again.

Some great wines at this place.

Good Cab Sav
Good pinotage
Great semi sweet semillon
Really nice food and great wine. I can recommend the pork belly.
No one to greet us on arrival, had to ring 3 times, no explanations of wines during tasting and messed up our order. However, scenery was beautiful!
Exelent

Everything about this wine estate is amazing! Amazing and interesting food, excellent service, breathtaking views over the vineyards. Highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area and like fine dining. Their desert menu was so interesting and delicious with even a gin and tonic desert to choose from.

Excellent service! Food is nice! Beautiful views! Very friendly staff! Thank you for going extra mile for our birthday! We loved everything. 
I'd highly recommend your restaurant!!
Glen Carlos consistently gives warm and polite service, combined with exquisite meals and stunning views of the local wine valley.
Great wine and service. The views over the valley are hard to beat.
Amazing lunch. US client says possibly best lunch she's ever had!

ChIJ4xA8lGDizR0R8VxXeGj1ZIY.adr_address: Hemel & Aarde Rd R320, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJ4xA8lGDizR0R8VxXeGj1ZIY.formatted_address: Hemel & Aarde Rd R320, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJ4xA8lGDizR0R8VxXeGj1ZIY.name: Creation Wines

reviews.text: Creation Wines are situated in the beautiful Hemel en Aarde Vallei and not to be missed if you are in the area.  They have a great kitchen and restuarant on ground level and one of the best tasting rooms in the area. The service is really good and the wine tasting servers are very knowledgeable and aim to provide you with a different experience. Creation are more known for their Chardonnay and will boast about their way or the right way for tasting it.

This lovely winery is offering great food and wine. As me and my boyfriend are vegan, we informed the restaurant in advance and they promised to create something for us. What we got in the end was an amazing and very creative three course menu, which we both enjoyed a lot. The restaurant and the outdoor sitting area are both beautiful, the views breathtaking.
Wonderful vibe, fantastic wines. Highly recommended! We especially loved the â€œArtâ€ Chardonnay. Thank you for a great day!

Ask for "the story" it is a delicious meal. We had a 7-course wine pairing lunch. Incredible wines with a top class variety of foods. Even though it was very busy, the host managed to come to our table and explain "the story" behind every dish and how it evolved since the beginning of the winery.
Still one of the best since farms I've been to & I've done a few... Highly recommended. Booking well in advance

ChIJk_QdjyC1zR0RWYGPeMtTtTE.adr_address: R44, Bel` Aire, Cape Town, 7135, South Africa
ChIJk_QdjyC1zR0RWYGPeMtTtTE.formatted_address: R44, Bel` Aire, Cape Town, 7135, South Africa
ChIJk_QdjyC1zR0RWYGPeMtTtTE.name: Wine Estate - Avontuur Wine Estate

reviews.text: Great place
This must be my favourite place. I recommend it to all.

ChIJF8y_791MzB0RmGpc6SI8yUc.adr_address: Spier Wine Farm,, R310, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJF8y_791MzB0RmGpc6SI8yUc.formatted_address: Spier Wine Farm,, R310, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJF8y_791MzB0RmGpc6SI8yUc.name: Spier Wine Tasting Centre

reviews.text: An incredible venue with the best of everything going on. Steeped in history the buildings have just enough modernity added to make them function highly effectively but without messing with the historical feel and significance. Expect exceptional service from a dedicated motivated and well trained staff as well as award winning wine. The atmosphere is relaxed sophistication. Deserves 7 stars.
I have not been there for quite sometime and was not aware of the mosaic workshop there. Beautiful setting and a very interesting discussion with one of the artist. Totally inspiring.

Went for lunch and to see the raptor rescue habitat.  The lunch was very good; I had a chicken pie and the crust was perfectly flaky and the chicken was plentiful and well-seasoned.  I ordered a glass of their wine and enjoyed it.  The restaurant decor is very pretty but unique.  Hanging lamps are shaded with up-cycled plastic milk jugs--but you have to look closely to realize it.  
The raptor show was OK.  It's educational but the hands-on part wasn't all that exciting. The staff person was hard to hear as she kept turning her face away from the audience and there were children crying and talking which made it worse.  There are some owls, pigs and tortoises for children to touch.

Nice experience with awesome wine.
We took both the R40 and R90 tasting, both are fantastic - the R40 selection consist of good house wine and some good (and definitely more extensive) ones.
And got a very unique and great red wine from the R90 selection.
Totally worth it...

This is definitely a must do activity whenever you are in Cape Town. Having a real farm experience with beautiful sceneries and seeing the animals. They have activities for kids as well. Wine tasting paired with chocolate is a real treat. Truly a customer oriented service you will get over here. Very nice facilities and the people that work here are super professional, they know what they are talking about.

ChIJZ7mPiDvbzR0REW2VrUCl5nc.adr_address: 76 Highlands Road, Elgin, Elgin, 7180, South Africa
ChIJZ7mPiDvbzR0REW2VrUCl5nc.formatted_address: 76 Highlands Road, Elgin, Elgin, 7180, South Africa
ChIJZ7mPiDvbzR0REW2VrUCl5nc.name: Oneiric Wines

reviews.text: Excellent wines , the First Quantum Grand Reserve 2011 is sublime

I keep a very happy memory of my stay at Kyburg. Rosmarie and Fred both of Swiss origin are such warmhearted and wonderful hosts. The quality level of their wines is truly outstanding and I wish I could have stayed longer with them.
Ernst Maurer

Amazing setting. Beautiful gardens. Lovely lawns and a pond full of fish. The food was brilliant, the portions great and all the meals just perfectly prepared. Service was perfect as well, and the prices not extremely high. Worth a visit for the experience

We (two adults, one toddler) went here around 2.45pm today, which is ideal as feeding time is at 3pm (there's one at 11am too). The cats look very well taken care of and our tour guides were friendly and informative. The grounds are beautiful with lots of open space for the little one to run.  Despite the kids area being closed today, we could still get close to most of the "traditional" farm animals. 
All three of us loved it and will be returning.

The place is beautiful, with great picnic areas and spacious for kids and family events however, the restaurant service is appalling. We waited 1.5hrs for our food which got served haphazardly. Waiters were running around like headless chickens and speaking to the manager  about it, made us feel as if it's our fault because they had a another big table with orders. Management could offer solutions just attitude.

There's just not enough stars on this review to state the awesome service my colleagues and I have received and experienced from the staff of this place. Vredenheim personal are very friendly and helpful and I am telling everybody to come and visit you guys. Thanx again y'all
Great place for the whole family...game drives...animal farm...good food!!!

ChIJ_VjYWzJNzB0RQAlbIzZxwhk.adr_address: Polkadraai Rd, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJ_VjYWzJNzB0RQAlbIzZxwhk.name: Neethlingshof (1692)

reviews.text: Amazing wine selection. Very friendly and informative wine tasting, great environment. Walking into the wine cellar getting the aroma of all the wines and sitting down for a tasting just made it amazing.

What a great visit! The story wines were my favorite part of the wine tasting with a great hostess. Ask your host about the story on The Six Flowers  ðŸŒ¸ The tasting room superb, The gardens need an update and the restaurant caters for foreigners wallets

This is a great place. The pizza was delicious and we had great vine as well. Unfortunately we couldn't get the red vine & truffles pairing, because we were too late. You must know that you have to order until 15.30 even if they're officially open till 16.00.
We had a great time. The staff is good in explaining, they have good service. The estate overall is breath taking.
Great wines (especially the Malbec). Enjoyed the wine tasting a lot, weren't rushed. We just had the normal tasting but there is a wine and food pairing option which looked delicious.

ChIJ____L98Kzh0RzpBY1GHijv4.adr_address: 33, Hemel en Aarde Rd, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa

reviews.text: Low key but very nice new winery. Still growing into itself, but off to a very nice start. Some good wine on tasting and a very nice little restaurant.
Good food and service. Barely a wait. Food was fresh and awesome flavour
Great place to visit! Good atmosphere and knowledgeable staff!!!
Stunning location ,  great wines, beautiful restaurant  will return to sample good looking food
Wines are ok, and food was quite good.  Place is beautiful and people are friendly.

ChIJK2Pdz_S8zR0RPct6EiAooMk.adr_address: 32 Cabriere St, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa

ChIJ03KsVcCyzR0Ryah_BQlkvco.name: Brenaissance Wine Estate

reviews.text: A pleasant dining experience in a beautiful setting. Picking fruit from the plum and peach trees, exploring along a shallow stream, and a lovely outdoor playground kept our children entertained whilst we enjoyed our wine and pizza.

Good pizza but very pricey for the portion size, and the stream (right where you eat) was giving off an overwhelming sewage smell. The staff were friendly and efficient and the venue is otherwise beautiful.
Nice venue and really friendly service. I can highly recommend the pizza
Must go have the pizza and wine pairing. It is out of this world and the view and drive to the place is so so so beautiful. A good place to end off a wine tasting day
Beautiful setting. Great pizzas and absolutely great experience. Kids can play on the grass, jungle gym and lots of space.

ChIJg3mVCdtpzB0RGEaBR0FMr_o.adr_address: 37 Klein Constantia Rd, Nova Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJg3mVCdtpzB0RGEaBR0FMr_o.formatted_address: 37 Klein Constantia Rd, Nova Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJg3mVCdtpzB0RGEaBR0FMr_o.name: Buitenverwachting

reviews.text: Pleasant green spot to unwind with good coffee in beautiful gigantic cups. They will accommodate requests for simple breakfast at a reasonable price (although food not that amazing) and nice coffee table and chairs spots to relax inside and outside. Unlimited WiFi means you can also get some work done. Today the Labrador puppy belonging there came around visiting very calmly...it was nice to have a gentle puppy to cuddle too!

Was unfortunately very disappointed in our service at Buitenverwachting. Arrived at 16:20 for a wine tasting (open for wine tasting until 17:00 according to signage). We waited quite a while before we were acknowledged, we then requested that we would like to complete a wine tasting, but was very rudely instructed that they do not do wine tastings at that time. We informed them that their signage clearly states that they are available until 17:00, our question was rudely ignored and it was stated that we can still buy wine to take home, we left the premises at this time with a bad taste in our mouths . I have had some of their wine before and was looking forward to taste their selection and purchase some bottles to take home. I would however not visit or purchase any wine for them in the future. All other places we visited we enjoyed excellent service after leaving Buitenverwachting

Fabulous food, excellent waiting staff and great atmosphere. Only complaint it that the food was served up too quickly after ordering and between courses. It all felt a little to rushed for my liking. Because of this they get a 3 instead of a 4.
Went there for a friend's birthday. Got double booked. Really poor. Really terrible.

I love this estate and restaurant but an fairly disappointed that in this day & age you do not get any vegetarian options as main courses. I ate there yesterday and had to have 2 starters as all the main courses are non vegetarian. The waitress informed me that the kitchen/chef could not make me a vegetarian main course. Will unfortunately not be returning unless this policy changes. I did enjoy the 2 starters and the setting is amazing. I sincerely hope the Chef changes his/her attitude towards vegetarian & possibly vegan cuisine and joins the progressive restaurants in Cape Town who offer multiple dishes that are not meat based. If there were vegetarian and vegan options then I would have given a 5 star rating.

ChIJg3mVCdtpzB0RGEaBR0FMr_o.vicinity: 37 Klein Constantia Road, Nova Constantia, Cape Town

reviews.text: It's worth the drive down a rather discreet dirt road (look for the Klein Simonsvlei sign on some impressive white-washed wall/pillars) to discover the lush gardens of this wine farm, which oozes history....a very relaxing, quiet spot for a picnic, intimate tasting experience etc.
Beautiful farm. Top wines.
Amazing wines!

reviews.text:
Did not feel welcome here.

Staff was in a hurry, food was just okay, wine is good though.
Very good whites. Cafe closed although sign advertised that it was open.
Tasty and interesting wine! View to die for!
Breath taking and neat
Sensational Cab Sav, beautiful location , my pick of the Stellenbosch Wineries

ChIJHaEeNjhozB0RBspQgE0DV-I.adr_address: 1043 Constantia Main Rd, Glen Alpine, Constantia, 7806, South Africa

reviews.text: Very pleasant. Tasted 4 wines, all excellent. Had cheese & cold meats platter, which was also good. A cut above simple wine tasting, but without the expense of some of the big name estates.

A delicious lunch, with excellent wine, great service all in an amazing location. Even their approach to wine tasting is unique with a cool little loungey/terrace with comfortable couches overlooking the winery rather than your standard wine tasting bar serving 4-5 wines like a factory line. Definitely worth a visit and try to combine it with lunch at the chef's warehouse!
What s treat! Amazing views, capable and friendly waiters and the food... My favourite was the springbok and fig dish as well as the steak tartar. Just perfect

We spent a great afternoon wine tasting and our tasting host Qanita was one of the best we've experienced. She was really well informed and had such a great personality which really made our tasting experience very memorable.
The venue is spectacular; the service outstanding; the food out of the ordinary - excellent. Overall experience : absolute treat

ChIJHaEeNjhozB0RBspQgE0DV-I.vicinity: 1043 Constantia Main Road, Glen Alpine, Constantia

reviews.text: Get off the beaten path and escape the crowds - Lithos is just the place. Amazing wines and great hospitality
A real gem away from the commercial estates...
Beautiful, very nice

ChIJS9AX9YCtzR0R6RvYvKFJ2iE.adr_address: Die Fonteine Farm, R44, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa

reviews.text: Lovely setting. Very popular so best to book. Owner/manager friendly and very hands-on. Quite busy for Sunday lunch lots of big groups so food a bit slow but was offered complimentary coffee because of the wait. Food nicely presented and tasty.

Have been there yesterday after 3 months...very much looking forward to our beloved calamari salad..we had ordered 3 main portions of it and have been so disappointed...the salad was laying powerless on the plate, the paw paw was cut in very thick slices and the complete salad dressing was so salty, we couldn't eat it. Have asked for new salad, received one plate of green leaves, nothing else...no deduction on the bill...not even a free coffee.  Very disappointing.  Shepard was very friendly as usual and to sit under the big palm is always fantastic...but we will have to think, if we will go there again. There are many restaurants around...

We visited as a large group on the 3rd of December had an awesome time. Food was amazing and the wine was superb the best I have had this year. To the Chef and Winemaker and proprietors of Somebosch all I can say is keep it up.
Excellent place. Good food. Good service. Good price.

A bit of a surprice, very good and plesent lunch. Great setting under the trees, well done to the somalier Gustav for taking the time to come to our table and introducing the estate wines to us. Highly recomend the Rose.

reviews.text: Very nice wine estete ang good wine.
Well done. Viognier outstanding.
Great setting & great wines

Oldenburg Vineyards is a family run winery that makes some of the best wines in the region. The large open tasting room has a gorgeous view out over the vineyards and the mountains. Itâ€™s worth coming for the scenery but itâ€™s really the vintages that will take your breath away.
Great place to be

Devastated by the 2017 fires, but rising from the ashes....a beautiful wine estate to spend some time on......
Like heaven in a wineyard!
Good service..Good food. Prices reasonable. Fire destroyed main house unfortunately
Amazing company doing amazing things

ChIJkz1nWmG8zR0RMar_Arir5k4.adr_address: Robertsvlei Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJkz1nWmG8zR0RMar_Arir5k4.name: La Couronne

reviews.text: ....On the day of our visit it Stormed but it did not dampen our enjoyment of the Chocolate & Wine Pairing session. Our host made us very comfortable at a floor to ceiling window, very private. And I believe that the rain did us good cause there were No flies around, HAHAHA! We even enjoy our Indoor Picnic with our supplied "Picnic Basket"! We recommend that all Chocolate & Wine lovers try this out at least once in a life time. We had an Awesome Indoor experience. ...This farm and venue is set a charming valley surrounded by lots of trees and a river even runs by it! The outside entertainment area is breathtaking-lii awesome big wooden building housing a large pub area with seating over looking the flowing stream!.....We will be back here in the future!.....
Beautiful farm with very friendly people and nice wine!
Good wine tasting with delicious chocolates.
The staff are very friendly and the chocolate pairing was great
Nice place, wine... 3

ChIJSV7iBAuszR0Rr0n56IZE79A.formatted_address: R 44 Klapmuts Road, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJSV7iBAuszR0Rr0n56IZE79A.name: Wine Estate - Laibach

reviews.text: I liked the organic wine selection. We also stayed over. The self-catering rooms were modern, clean, spacious and they really try to make it as comfortable as possible for you.

ChIJnQuXRedMzB0RAbXHET6jAPQ.adr_address: Spier Wine Farm, R310 Baden Powel Drive, Lynedoch, Stellenbosch, 7603, South Africa
ChIJnQuXRedMzB0RAbXHET6jAPQ.formatted_address: Spier Wine Farm, R310 Baden Powel Drive, Lynedoch, Stellenbosch, 7603, South Africa
ChIJnQuXRedMzB0RAbXHET6jAPQ.name: Segway Spier

reviews.text:
We booked the sunset tour,
The activity was nice but could had been much more.
The guide was nice but a little bit boring.
Most of the tour he talked about himself analmost nothing about the place, the winery, the history of the place in specific or SA in general.
 So many things to speak about... It was even embarrassing in some points
So, in the end... big disappointment
The guides were really enthusiastic and informative. It was a great experience!

My husband and I got to experience this wonderful Segway Tour at Spier last weekend - and what a treat it was!  The Segway Tour team all clearly love what they do and their enthusiasm is contagious.

Very thorough training happens before the actual tour, where the guides ensure that you're safe and comfortable on the Segway before venturing out.
The tour itself is stunning and the guides offer insights into and stories about the workings of the farm. Very informative and super interesting!

Relaxing and exhilarating all at the same time - I would highly recommend this as an outing!
Vinicula

ChIJnQuXRedMzB0RAbXHET6jAPQ.vicinity: Spier Wine Farm, R310 Baden Powel Drive, Lynedoch, Stellenbosch

html_attributions: Ridgeback Wines, Guest House & The Deck Restaurant
Ridgeback Wines, Guest House & The Deck Restaurant

reviews.text: We had a wine tasting and lunch afterwards. Every wine we tasted was amazing. The SGMV and Shiraz are among my favorite wines. The SGMV probably is my favourite wine. The food was pretty good. My girlfriend had pork belly that was absolutely stunning.  My creamy chicken breast was average. The only downside with the wine is the price. They've started getting pricey. A year ago a bottle of SGMV would set you back R80, now it's R105.
Good food and excellent wines. The only drawback is the lack of staff. Donâ€™t expect much service.
We had a delicious lunch and enjoyed the beautiful views here! Such a great place for kids and very friendly staff.

The deck restaurant has very nice scenery and is great for a Sunday lunch.

The service wasn't really great. Our guy forgot our drinks a few times and we also had to get up and go inside to order stuff ourselves.

I order the pork belly which was very good, but still left an empty spot in my tummy. I feel that it just wasn't enough food for the amount of money that I had to pay for it. 

My wife had a Gourmet burger which was very good, I had to take a few bites from her to supplement my meal.
Friendly service and good knowledge of the wines. Excellent wines to be tasted, worth a visit.

ChIJaXMohsUGzR0RfgPBl86YYfE.vicinity: Off R44, Windmeul,, North Agter Paarl, Paarl

reviews.text: Best day i have had in a very long time
Sannelene was an exceptional host and the wines delicious! Will definitely go back!
Nice chilled and Thanx Sanline for great experience
Nice boutique winery which is the home of top old vintages an a top class bubbly
Laid back, unpretentious and great wine.

ChIJr0tChNVpzB0RbrLQxBck73A.vicinity: Groot Constantia Road, Constantia, Cape Town

ChIJM3LYORmzzR0R4vK0zbI0k20.formatted_address: Stellenbosch Kloof Rd, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJM3LYORmzzR0R4vK0zbI0k20.name: DeMorgenzon Stellenbosch

reviews.text: Besides great wines, this is a beautiful enchanted little garden oasis with glorious Cape Dutch buildings. Here the wine ripens under an acoustic blanket of the finest baroque Musik. Well worth the visit even if one doesn't appreciate wine

They could do with more assistance, a big table will take a longer time and being only 3 of us we ended up waiting a while to be seated and have the tasting.
The estate has an awesome view from the open deck while you wine tasting.
Lovely gardens and enjoyed the wine tasting. Our wine steward was particularly knowledgeable and generous with his time. Do try the Maestro White.
As a tour guide I think its just the best everything about it
Stunning setting and very nice wine.

ChIJlTiKIP-nzR0Rv8Bnp2iG5ro.adr_address: Sonstraal Rd, Paarl, 7646, South Africa
ChIJlTiKIP-nzR0Rv8Bnp2iG5ro.name: Nederburg Wines (Pty) Ltd

reviews.text: One of the best wine estates in the country. Awesome to stroll around, relax and take pictures. Great selection of wines which are moderately priced. Super friendly and helpful staff. Cozy venue. Good for groups and couples. All around great experience, will certainly be back!

After 5 days in wine country my favorite vineyard. They tasting was extensive, unhurried, professional, and they leave the bottle with you so you can read the label.
In addition they provided a case for packing my wine bottles, even the ones from somewhere else!
Really great customer service.
Good wine, wonderful price. We visited on a holiday so maybe did not get the best experience. Nice views.

We're people of "reds" so we have known and enjoyed Nederburg wines for a long time. Beautiful blends! 

We were the first visitors of that day :) Dropped in just from the airport. Lovely lady Annijika (please correct the spelling if wrong!) took us for a tour around the winery, showed the cellar and the production centre. Actually it was a private tour! We were so lucky! She gave a lot of detailed information about the company, wines, grapes, terroir, history, stories behind everyday hard work of the Team. Everything was very interesting and we learnt a lot of new things. The history behind today's success was long (226 years long!), sometimes painful.

The Winery and the Team along with the Leaders and the Creators at the top are highly deserve all the World' and local rewards and admiration around the Globe!

After the informational tour we had a wine tasting. Of course we preferred their reds but it was amazing to taste some of their whites - we ended up with purchasing some bottles for home :)

Great wines! Amazing people behind! 
Keep on shinning brightly! 

Cheers! :)

An early start for the day, we travelled for an hour plus to arrive at Nederburg Wines, one of the older vineyards in Stellenbosch.  For a wine drinker like me, the professionally presented wine tasting session in the impressive ambiance was fantastic. A total of 6 types of wine we tasted, if you ask me to verbalize the tastes and aromas, I have to be honest. I don't know. Still, one thing is certain. I can differentiate between white wine and red wine, well, from the colour. Pretty much a simple thing, I am sure even a non-wine drinker obviously can do that as well. Okay, wine is also ultimately my comfort during weekends to relax prior to tucking into bed.    

At Nederburg Wines, kicked off with wine tasting, we then toured the huge farm winery to understand a thing or two on wine-making process, returned to the foyer to purchase some wine and before leaving, we walked around the wine plantation to marvel at the beautiful sight of the grape varieties.

ChIJfwZiGDBozB0Rmg_VDy8iilk.adr_address: Constantia Main Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJfwZiGDBozB0Rmg_VDy8iilk.formatted_address: Constantia Main Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJfwZiGDBozB0Rmg_VDy8iilk.name: Constantia Glen

reviews.text: Would not recommend if you don't have a reservation, we didn't have a reservation but you do still have the option to picnic on the grass, as we were about to order a bottle of wine at the bar a kind waiter was about to assist us when the bartender abruptly and gently pushed him aside and referenced him to a table on the floor. We sat there another 5 minutes before being helped, which didn't bother us at all. But a little courtesy comes a far way in the hospitality industry. Did buy a bottle and enjoyed a short stay.

The restaurant is a beautiful venue with some amazing views of the Constantia wine farms. I suggest making a reservation in order to get a nicer table but you can also picnic on the grass if there isn't any space. Service is a bit slow, it seems they're a bit understaffed, as we only had one waiter for quite a number of tables. We waited quite long for cutlery and for the second half of our wine tasting and had to ask a few times before we would get anything. Wines are very good though and the waiting staff know a lot about their wines.

What an incredible venue! Great atmosphere with a picturesque view. Very few tourists, it seems a place where locals can enjoy a great tasting wine looking over the vineyards. 
Definitely a must go in Cape Town
A supurb spot to experience the magnificence of Constantia Valley. Great wine, friendly staff, and an amazing venue.
Fabulous winetasting. Order a glass or a bottle with a platter and enjoy.

ChIJfwZiGDBozB0Rmg_VDy8iilk.vicinity: Constantia Main Road, Constantia, Cape Town

ChIJrfCVw-axzR0RAjiykFnLxh4.formatted_address: R310 Helshoogte Pass, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJrfCVw-axzR0RAjiykFnLxh4.name: Thelema Mountain Vineyards

reviews.text: Best wine tasting experience I've ever had. Staff are very friendly. Well recommended.
Huge selection of wines. Very popular with tour groups so it can get noisy/busy. For this reason, booking for tastings are advised.
Thelma wines yes!!!yes!!!! Great wines the people doing the tastings are giving the wine the character of wowðŸ˜‰ðŸ˜‰

Crescenda Willemse hosted us for a very fine wine tasting. She is a most personable and accomplished  lady, and made our visit so much more enjoyable.

We have been to many wineries and done the usual "tasting bit", but this was very special and excellently done - thanks in the main to Crescenda.

The wines are also top quality, and it is well worth a visit ,as it is a a lovely setting.
Good wines,lovely setting and nice people

ChIJNzeK0Hm7zR0RnUY8ljnJxNE.adr_address: Robertsvlei Road, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJNzeK0Hm7zR0RnUY8ljnJxNE.name: GlenWood Vineyards

reviews.text: N st to nm n
Although the setting is beautiful I found the wine overpriced. Had much better wine at other wine farms.
Worth the drive to see this great vineyard!

Seriously? This vineyard was supposed to be amazing. After taking a dirt road you will see the domain to the right. The staff doesn't seem to care, we asked them to start over the wine tasting as the white wines were warm... None of their wines tasted any good to our palates, the six of us left quickly, disappointed...
Beautiful setting in a valley surrounded by mountains. Lovely wines, great aroma and taste. My favourite is Chardonnay with an oak flavour. Great tasting experience.

ChIJBXBWzXKszR0RjYisGC_ISNs.name: Mitre's Edge Boutique Winery

reviews.text: First stop with wineflies wine tours... awesome tasting... fantastic wine!
Easily one of the nicest and most personal Wine Estates. Wonderful wines, great tasting and the friendliest owners you can imagine. Also, a great place to stay in their fabulous pool house.

I would like to thank Karin and her hubby for having us.  We had an amazing time at Mitres Edge for our wedding anniversary.  The wine is awesome.  The accommodation is fully kitted, neat, clean and stocked with a whole bunch of activities from cards to a pool table to a Jacuzzi.  Karin and husband is very friendly and We will definitely be back.  Thank you guys.
Fantastic wine tasting. Met new people made new friends. Thank you it was awesome. Will be back

We had a fantastic stay at Mitre's Edge at their luxurious pool house. The accommodation is very well appointed, with everything from a pool table to a jacuzzi and sauna for our sole use. The location is perfect for a weekend exploring Paarl and Simondium. The owners made us feel very welcome and the wine produced on the farm is excellent! We'll definitely be back.

ChIJvasboZq0zR0RqkozgM4mEDQ.adr_address: Annandale Rd, Stellenbosch NU, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa

reviews.text: I advised to book early so you don't have a disappointment in the holidays. But excluding that the place is wonderful the food is so delicious

Fantastic setting, advise a booking in advance to avoid dissapointment during holiday season. Certainly focused on upmarket clientel, but if you enjoy good service, a good place to come and enjoy their wines and good food.
Wine Tasting at Guardian Peak. Beautiful view of Hidden Valley. Great atmophere. Good wine. A must.

What a gem! The food was exquisite, modestly priced.  The restaurant is chilled and not pretentious, loved that.  The wine is great!  I have never been a fan of Shiraz but we ended up buying a bottle (among many other bottles), it's so tasty!  The view is just gorgeous!  The service was perfect, our waiter really made us feel comfortable and he knew his stuff, super cool guy.  It's just what we wanted to do on our anniversary.  Thanks so much Nick and your amazing team!
Beautiful view, personal service and the most deliciously prepared food.

reviews.text: The home of the Chocolate Block. We found this wine estate to be very hospitable. It's a bit out of the way but well worth a visit.

This farm is truly a hidden gem - their newly installed walk way through the forest that surrounds it, is absolutely amazing (with sculptures of Red Wolves - from the Wolf Trap brand placed well in between the foliage). It really is a lovely farm to spend an afternoon at. Walk around, drink wine, breath in the fresh air.
Great staff, good variety of wine, likes most but didn't *love* any one
Awsome place
Amazing wines!!!

reviews.text: Throughly enjoyed this tasting. Mainly red wines (70%) but the staff are friendly and knowledge about their wines. Tasting room was clean and comfortable.

Home of Cattle Baron. Very nice Restaurant. Do make a booking. Romantic atmosphere, quite and tranquility. Perfect during the summer months, cosy and warm in winter. Perfect view from the deck over the lights of Cape Town.

Excellent. Ordered a 600g rump steak, medium rare. My knife glided through the steak like i was cutting through soft butter. 

The steak was well prepared with the fat grilled to perfection. A basting sauce accompanied the steak and was fresh and flavorful. A bunch of small baked potatoes in a rosemary, garlic and butter sauce complimented the steak really well. 

The maitre d' Charleston took interest in my meal making good meal suggestions and often enough followed up asking if i needed anything, yet not so much so to bother me. He was clearly aware of his patrons. I'll be coming back.
Not a bad place. Very easy too miss though
Best restaurant great service with a breath taking veiw of Cape Town

reviews.text: Awesome, a very unexpected stop with great wines of exceptional value. Hempies du Toit  is a legend in his own right.

Amazing Wines! Beautiful little place with a nice atmosphere. Service was good and staff are knowledgeable about their wines. Staff was also able to honestly recommend other wineries to visit from our preferences in wines.
Annandale's style of winemaking and presentation is decidedly old world. The wines are cellared for an extended period relative to most other wines in this region and the presentation is rustic.

What a truly quirky place to taste wine. The wine is so unique because they age it in the barrel for eight years! The owner day with us for a little while and he is truly one of a kind. Ex Rugby player.
Old rustic cellar - nice experience. The wines are excellent.

A very Nice experience. We have passed it many times on the road without considering it but once you are inside it is a beautiful place. The tapas menu was very tasty and the wine tasting was perfect. Good selection with nice prices.

We have enjoyed numerous wine tastings here with local and international guests and have always received excellent service. We love the Welmoed range and often buy wines by the case for home and for events.
Great food. Great wine. Knowledgeable staff and lovely surrounds. Well worth a visit.
It was the worst part of the wine tour I was on...bad service and really bad, cheap wine served there.
Yummy food therw

Dem wines are tasty!

reviews.text: Stayed in the Chestnut cottage. Very secluded and awesome place to stay, great view of the vineyards and mountains on one side, and a river running at the back of the house. Had a spacious bathroom and a fireplace to warm the house. Close to lots of wine farms and Franschhoek town.
Beautiful accommodation to leave the world behind amids a stunning vineyard ðŸ˜
Good wifi!;) stayed at the kastanje cottage and it has the best swimming pool I have ever been!:)ðŸ˜†ðŸ˜‰ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ

Stayed in chestnut cottage, a smaller house than the one we stayed in previously. It is a simple place that is ideal for a couple. Situated by the Franschhoek river some of the best views of the valley are visible from the bathroom(?). Minor criticism: bedroom and closet doors need oiling - sneaking in/out of our room when putting our child down proved difficult. Other than that, highly recommended, especially in summer when the pool can be enjoyed.
great 2 days stay in the spectacular franschhoek valley. Beautiful cottages, amazing pool in the old pear orchards, really would recommend anyone staying in Franschhoek to book with Richard or Julie!

reviews.text: We had lunch there with friends from the U.K. and as usual the lunch was great. Unfortunately however the wine tasting upstairs was a real disappointment. The staff at this tasting room were not well trained and were unable to answer even the most basic questions. The wines from the Protea range were equally disappointing. Not what we would expect from a Rupert owned winery.
magnificent, we had a great time indeed...proudly SA in a world class manner
The menu is spectacular.  The olives are to die for
Top Class Facility.

We got married here, it's a perfect wedding venue for an intimate wedding, and has it's own beautiful little chapel. We often go back to relive the best day of our life and have a glass of wine!
Best RosÃ© I've had in my life.
Looking to get married in a beautiful venue with a Chapel, this is the place.  friendly staff, wonderful scenery and a magic place to spend teh weekend and have your wedding....

What an amazing wine journey. Ken knows how to make some amazing wines.
An amazing place, beautiful vineyards, and awesome people, professional service!!!
So I had their merlot yesterday, and was pleasantly surprised at warm and bodied it is! This was a really pleasant introduction to a label I look forward to exploring in the upcoming weeks...
We had a very pleasant wine tasting experience. Some superb wines at surprisingly low prices. The staff were exceptionally well organised and helpful.

reviews.text: The team at Green Vine took such good care of us at our baby shower! JP and the servers attended to our every need and made us feel very comfortable. The combination of excellent service, yummy platters, stunning view and perfect weather made for a really lovely experience!

Definatly worth a visit. Great food and ambiance. They have just opened up for their seasonal dinners on Friday and Saturday Nights. We have been many times for Breakfast and lunch however it was our first dinner experience at Green Vine this past weekend. They have a new Chef so we couldn't wait to return. We invited friends and family to join us and had the most fantastic evening, delicious food , great service. They fill up quite fast for dinners so phone ahead to make a booking. Was so glad when one of my guests said 'Wow this restaurant has such a great vibe'! A true treasure- highly recommended.
Great experience! High quality, organic wines and delicious food. Special menue with vegan options. We enjoyed our stay with fantastic views over the valley and a very nice staff

Wonderful cozy atmosphere on a chilly windy day. Excellent warm and friendly service and scrumptious wine and food - had a lovely afternoon there and will certainly return and recommend it to friends.
Good food.  Great views.

reviews.text: The most beautiful views of the vines, mountain range and sea. The market on Thursday's has great food and beer. I also went for a wine tasting(not on a Thursday) which was a little bit disappointing as the staff looked surprised and confused as to what to offer us as we were a group of 12. There were only two other small groups of people but the service was still slow. I would recommend the market on a Thursday and remember to get there early as it gets packed quickly.

We've attended the Thursday Food market and really enjoyed it. Beautiful setting with great food to choose from. Remember to get there early if you want a bench/seat but more than enough picnic place.
The view is stunning.  The wine is great. The food is only just average and is over-priced.  Go there for sundowners but don't spoil the experience with a meal.
We came on a Thursday market evening, what an amazing concept that is! So many food choices of great quality, great wines, in a beautiful setting to enjoy the sunset.

Old years eve Function disappointment!  I ONLY received a plate of chips for my R700 VIP ticket booked on 17 December with vegetarian, gluten-intolerant request. No other food was brought to our table.  I was told I could eat the chilli bites from the other 4 diners platter, as this was gluten free.  My friend bought a plate of fish and chips.  The batter had fallen off the fish and was returned.  The cheapest wine was over R200 a bottle. The French DJ was good but the only time he spoke was to ask the bar to assist them with their drinks order!  Paying guests on the lawn were left to find place on the dance floor, as no tent was provided in case of rain.  3 calls to the restaurant prior to this publication were ignored. Such insults and to be called a liar is unthinkable!  Although your restaurant does not cater for gluten-free meals, this was requested well in advance.  We went home early and ate our own snacks at home! I would not recommended this restaurant for any function!

Horrible!!!!!!!!.

Warm beers, lots of flies, dried corks in wine bottles, absolutely no service, and ooh... had to visit the doctor after eating their food with stomach upsets.

PS... opted with drinking the warm beers instead of their wine. THAT's how bad their wine is.
Do not go there. Most unfriendly staff I have ever experienced. The waiter really hated her job.
Realy great experience.

reviews.text: Homely wine Farm

Wine tasting: Pretty and quaint. Our group thoroughly enjoyed our wine tasting. Our server was helpful and friendly. We got to to taste for free. We thought their wines were delicious and most of us bought a bottle or two. Not as fancy as other estates but a welcome change from the usual pompousness.
Good selection of wines, port and brandy for tasting. They have nice seating area for eating and tasting. Place for the children to play outside.

We really enjoyed the wine tasting experience at this winery.  We went late on a Sunday, so we were one of two tables sampling.  The staff waited on us hand and foot.  That combined with the tasty wines "forced" us to buy some bottles.  Not as expensive as other wineries.

What a place great wine tasting and Kobus is awesome.. what a great experience... he is so experienced in wine, knowledgeable and friendly and so sharp with a hint of sarcasm that borders on stand up comedy.. truly a great experience.. everyone should visit this wine farm.. the wine tasting was poetry to the tastebuds and I would come again in a heart beat.. it was our 3rd year back and we will be back next year
One of the best tastings we've had!!! The guy who works there from Thursday to Saturday is so knowledgeable about the history of the estate and he made us feel so welcome!!!! We will be back !!!!!!!

Fabulous!

reviews.text: The food here is just as incredible as the views are! This is the perfect place for a fancy twist on Sunday lunch. Also, the staff were wonderfully attentive and very friendly. A fantastic experience!
What a beautiful Estate! It is perfect for spoiling someone to a â€œfancyâ€ wine tasting. As a wedding venue it is incredible!
Fine dining at its best, set amongst Stellenbosch vineyards, exquisite gardens, and overlooking Stellenbosch mountains.  An expensive visit but worth the treat - the estate wines are great!
Very beautiful place and well designed, people are friendly, such a nice place to be with friends and family

Beautiful farm. Experience was spoilt when the owner, Jerome Smith, yelled at my 5 year old son for standing on a balcony rail to look at the fish. Extremely rude and uncalled for. Such a shame, will not return.

reviews.text: Outstanding wedding venue. The setting, scenery and service is absolutely fantastic. Although pricey, having a function at this venue, with such spectacular views of the mountains and vineyards, is worth every cent. My daughter's Hindi wedding and reception was held here on 04 February 2018 - what a memorable and unforgettable experience for the family and guests! Ilse, the manager, is an amazing person to deal with. She is exceptionally hands-on and goes out of her way to ensure the success of her functions. I would definitely rate the venue and service 10/10.

Great wine farm. Lovely Sauvignon Blanc and unique African Pairing experience with African delicacies and wines. Also great picnic spot with picnics prepared and served outside under umbrellas with a great view. Nice tasting room and wines reasonably priced.
Absolutely stunning boutique wine farm. Excellent gourmet picnics and picturesque views. A must try for hopeless romantics
One of the greatest brands in winery. Nice place to spend a couple hours to know about grape farm, process.

reviews.text:
A new restaurant opened at Verdome - Bon Lois on 1 March and what an beautiful experience this was... The look and feel of this restaurant is french inspired and set between vinyards, trees and gardens - absolutely breath taking!!! In the evening they have all these lights outside and under te trees that makes you feel like you are in a different world of beauty! 
But most importantly the food is out of this world... You can see the love they put into the food they make. Presented beautifully and the taste is something you must experience! Go ahead... Try the duck burger... I dare you!
They also have a beautiful kiddies area that is safe and secured from any danger...
This place is a must!!!! I will be there regularly:)

reviews.text: Whenever you walk out of a tasting room feeling worse than you did walking in, you know there is a problem. DO NOT show up without a reservation. Even for the Signature Tasting (the website does not explicitly indicate that one is needed). Could have done without the condescension and should have ended an otherwise amazing day at another wine farm. Only spent a fraction of my intended budget, so at least my bank manager is happy. Giving it a 2 star, since there was a short, coloured lady who greeted us with a smile at the door and  tried to make us feel welcome by offering us some water.

Absolutely beautiful wines presented by knowledgeable and friendly staff, this is the best tasting experience by far and not to be missed. Booking is essential, so in order to avoid disappointment make sure to phone or e-mail.
I'm a guide who shamelessly uses his guests to explore wine, and this is my favourite so far. Book well in advance, and give yourself time to wonder around the gardens

This is really special wine. You can tell how much thought goes in to every bottle and it shows. The terroir range compares the same grapes and winemaking styles across different soils. Very complex while at the same time drinkable. All the grapes are grown in organic and sustainable ways. 
Had fantastic experiences both in riebeek (which you have to prebook and can only go on fridays if they're available) and at the franschhoek tasting room (also booking essential). Yes it is more expensive than some of the other area wines, but it is worth it for the brilliant flavors and you are supporting real visionary winemakers with commitment to the land and people.

Exorbitantly priced at R110 each for 4 tiny tastings. Price could easily have been justified by a wine of superior quality , but we did however notice a distinct soapy aftertaste to every wine. This message was relayed to the taste assistant but was dismissed without any comment. An additional soapy chardonnay was offered (which was thought to be complimentary) only to find out after that one single tiny tasting extra is priced at R60 each.
Between the inferior wine and the ridiculous prices it was an all-in-all unpleasant experience.

ChIJfbjnAvwhzR0RvqdpfcvQocI.vicinity: Leeu Estates, Dassenberg Road, Franschhoek, Cape Town

reviews.text: Great wine estate to visit for tastings or a lovely, light lunch. It's also the best wine in Wellington, in my opinion. Magnificent, peaceful setting makes you feel like you're the last people left on earth! Do be aware of the long, bumpy dirt road though.
Had a lovely outdoor experience with the band "Kaleidoscope" tonight. Great ambience on lawn under the trees. Good friends and good wine.
The biggest hidden Gem. Surrounded by beauty. Great staff. Great food. Brilliant Wine.
One of the best wine farms I have visited. I enjoyed the wine they had to offer for tasting and was reasonable priced. A definite must visit.

Set in a picture perfect valley,  this wine farm is a must visit. We enjoyed a picnic next to the river that was absolutely delicious. Last 2.3 km to farm is on a pretty bumpy gravel so 4x4 is advised but not necessity. This place is totally worth the effort.

reviews.text: Willie was a fantastic host to talk to us about the wine industry in the area. They had local fruits available for sale as well as an array of olive oil products to try.

What a fantastic experience!!!!! Fantastic wine and even better service!!! Willie a true asset to any winery. I felt like family once i left. So much history and information about the farm and its history. Thank you for that!
No need to make a reservation. Lovely tasting room which can accommodate a big group. All very friendly. Large range of olive oil products and olive tasting is a bonus.
Friendly service and really good wine! I recommend it to anyone!

reviews.text:
Old country farm house seemingly in the middle of nowhere. Good, authentic food at Hilda's Kitchen, and equally good wine from the farm. Unique place, no hipsters.

Only gripe is the music they play over a small crappy little CD player, quite close to the table we sat at. I kept turning the volume down.

It's beginning to get expensive, country fair at city prices.
Beautiful setting, fantastic wine and great food. Very happy that they were so accommodating, catering a vegan menu especially for us!
Thanks Anthony for an amazing tasting experience. We'll be back every year to taste and buy the new vintages.
Definitely worth going through for a wine tasting (and some wine buying) when in Darling. Anthony is fantastic and very knowledgeable.
Great afternoon. Really good restaurant but you need to book
The open air part is glorious; the views are phenomenal. The indoors rather underwhelming. The wines excellent!
One of my favourite wineries in the area. Location is superb, and the views alone are worth the visit!
Great view. But unfortunataly that was it. Aweful service and wine was the worst I ever had. Had my hopes up high, but this place turned out to be very disapointing.
One of the best views over the valley, this was a great place to grab a glass of wine while doing some afternoon writing.
location and view were great but the service was not very good! i personally didn't like the wine... and i thought for a wine tasting experience you'd get a new glass for each wineðŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸

My family has visited this farm and its beautiful  nature reserve several times over the years and we have stayed in the 100-year-old farmhouse and the newer cottages. All the accommodation on offer is comfortable, spacious and thoughtfully furnished. Although this is a working farm, as a guest one gets to experience it as a place of peace and tranquillity and we always leave it sad but rejuvenated.
Johan and Diana are exceptional hosts and nothing is too much trouble for them. The food and wine are in a class of their own and itâ€™s worth taking a drive out just to try them. The road up to the farm is absolutely no different from other farm roads and overall it is hard to believe that such a haven exists only an hour from Cape Town.

A beautiful piece of paradise just an hour away from Cape Town! Fynbos Estate is an incredible place for a country wedding (loved every second of ours) and the perfect spot for a quiet getaway to enjoy mountain walks, delicious food, wine tasting (and roaring fires in the winter). Just spectacular!

Perhaps the best-kept secret in the Western Cape, Fynbos Estate is a truly idyllic place, and one to which, over the years, we have returned again and again. What's more, it's just an hour out of Cape Town, easy to find, and the road is excellent the entire way â€“ the more so since the very short, untarred, final section has been upgraded. The farm â€“ which encompasses a mountain nature reserve â€“ has extraordinary natural beauty, the accommodation is aesthetically (and comfortably) designed, everything is spotlessly maintained, and Diana and Johan are wonderfully warm and welcoming hosts. Those who want to be fully catered for should know that Johan is a master chef, and a winemaker of exceptional talent: his 'natural' Dragonridge wines are simply superb.
Nice venue but very far out and dangerous roads. In fact, I rolled my car on the loose gravel upon leaving
Fast becoming my favorite wedding venue.

reviews.text: Was lead here by some friends. And what a stumble to a magical place. The wine is excellent and the venue is peaceful but quirky. Hosts are friendly and super accommodating. I recommend anyone who passes to make a stop here, or even make it a destination for a day outing.

We had a great Sunday lunch and swim there. The grounds are stunning and would be perfect for an event like a wedding. Our waiter, Emanuel was a breath of fresh air and got things sorted quickly and with such a good sense of humour. Service couldn't be better. The food we had was well made, value for money and came quick. Pizzas were thin and tasty, and the cheese board for 1 was the biggest single cheeseboard I've seen. We had the Shiraz Rose and the Chenin Blanc, and it was fresh and just what we needed for a Sunday lunch.Will be back.
Very serene. Nice setting. Lovely wines.
So tranquil. So lovely. Friendliest service.

We stayed at the manor house. It was beautiful! Dianne was friendly and Manny was always available to make our stay extra comfortable! We especially enjoyed the great cappuccino in front of the cozy fireplace! The farm itself is beautiful and we explored a little on our own. Very creative wedding venue with a quaint little church on top of a hill overlooking Tulbagh.
Great wines at good prices.  The young lady was extremely knowledgeable and informative.  I remember drinking Theuniskraal Riesling in the 1960's. It is still a superb Riesling.

Very informative young lady. Good history of the vineyard and wines. Tasting is free unlike some other places in the valley. The rose is the best in the district light fruity easy on the palate. I have visited this vineyard for the past 3 years and always found staff friendly.

This is really a nice a farm to spend most of our time here. You can always feel save to put your kinds on the tractor ðŸšœ, (real reason why we always go there),  but even the wine is beter. Thanks alot to the management of Theuniskraal. We love your farm.

reviews.text:
Executed in classic style and still managed by the legendary Mr Prop Lategan, who also still pilots his powerful Cessna 210 aircraft, Bergsig is a must-visit. 

Wines are excellent, food includes traditional cooking to blend in with a historical setting. 

A tasteful presentation in so many ways.

We bought a selection of excellent wines at really great prices. Also, green fig jam, ripe fig jam, etc. I'd return there in a wink and won't easily tire. Staff were professional yet treated us so well that we truly felt at home.

Horrible service! Waited over a hour for our cold stale food. When we wanted to leave the card machine was broken so we could not pay and had to agree to eft them later. When we got to the parking lot we spoke to the only other party that was in the restaurant with us and their experience was the same. The one lady even got sick from the food! 

Would not recommend! This is not a restaurant. Its barely a wine sales office.
Discovered this gem a few weeks ago. Great hospitalty, great coffee and some seriously good wine. But it was the overall combination that makes it worth the stop.
Free wine taste and good food. The Sauvingnon Blanc is the best,came and enjoy the view at Bergsig Estate,mountains to die for

The wine is delicious, but arriving at 15:45 on a Saturday with ample time to taste wine we were informed that it closes at 4pm (and NOT 5 pm) as in Google. It was an unpleasant rush. PLEASE rectify your times so that people do not drive vast distances to attempt to eat/ drink at a place which is NOT actual available. (It is irrelevant that you have 9 am - 4 pm on your board in front of the farm).

ChIJ1x2aj8EGzR0Rb-9tpMUzqeM.adr_address: Noord Agter Paarl Road, Paarl, 7620, South Africa
ChIJ1x2aj8EGzR0Rb-9tpMUzqeM.formatted_address: Noord Agter Paarl Road, Paarl, 7620, South Africa
ChIJ1x2aj8EGzR0Rb-9tpMUzqeM.name: Under Oaks

reviews.text: Under Oaks is an amazing restaurant. I have never received poor service and I have never received poor quality food. Their pizza are proper wood fired and thin based. And every single one is super tasty. And with reasonable prices to boot, you could not go wrong with Under Oaks. This is a great place for a Sunday lunch or even just a mid week dinner.

Great accommodation: peaceful and luxurious. Pizza at the main house is delicious and we indulged twice over the weekend. We also enjoyed the Hero Adventure set up at Rhebokskloof where mountain biking, horse riding and quad bikes (among other activities) are offered. We will definitely be back!

One of our favourite local spots. Lovely setting; consistently good food and service from great staff. Very good and well-priced wines from the estate. 
Our only complaints are as follows: the owner never gets up from behind his desk to greet his patrons or inquire about their experience; he only offers one type of pasta (penne) - which for an Italian restaurant is mildly irritating; and the seating offered outside should be more comfortable. We absolutely HATE benches with no backrests! Those were fine in student days..... 
With regard to this - they also have a very strange policy of not taking bookings for the inside of the restaurant. We often prefer to sit inside in summer, due to the more comfortable seating, or because of bad wind outside.
However, they generally won't allow bookings because they prefer to keep the inside seating for those who've booked for outside and need to move in due to bad weather conditions. We have arrived on occasion, on the spur of the moment, when they are full outside, but empty inside - and they have turned us away because of this policy! 
As a result, we do not go there nearly as often anymore.

Visited this establishment during the festive period and was just as impressed as when I first visited a few years ago. 

The ambience is very casual when you walk in and the seating under the oaks is welcome on a hot summer day. 

The drinks selection is nice with a good range of beer and other drinks. 
We started with the focaccia which was delicious and a great start to the meals. 
Moving on to mains, the dishes were served timeously and were delicious. Everything was well made and had care put into it. 
The flavours fromthe pizza's was great and I recommend trying any of them.
Such a peaceful place to have lunch. The pizzas are great. Prices are also affordable. Altogether a perfect outing

Amazing wine tasting, lovely staff took us through it. And good wine, and better port!
No need to make a reservation. Small tasting room which is very cozy and doesn't feel super commercial. Wide range of wines - the chenin blanc and muscadel are must haves.

weekday_text: Wednesday: 10:00 AM â€“ 4:00 PM, 7:00 â€“ 9:00 PM

reviews.text: Lovely restaurant where we enjoyed breakfast. The decor is beautiful and the tasting room is modern and airy. We enjoyed the coffee and had a really big and tasty breakfast pizza that is recommended.  The staff are friendly and efficient. Worth the drive out into the country and will stop by again.

The organic wine is light and easy to drink, and of surprisingly good quality with a full range of flavours. There is a selection of homemade ice-cream, that features interesting local flavours such as Rooibos. The restaurant dining area is modern, full of light and offers a superb view of Mostertshoek, which is the highest peak in the area and covered by snow at times in the winter.

wine tasting was excellent...lots of their wine have received awards including John Platter awards. The wine tasting was for free. We ate a pizza which was tasty and thin crusted and locally made. Ampke parking and air conditioner inside.
Awesome wines.  Organic.  Class of their own
Fantastic lunch, great wine. Pizza's big enough to share.

reviews.text: I went here with a crazy group of friends. Charlene was fabulous at managing to teach us a few things and the wine was delicious. A great morning spent in the care of amazing Charlene.

Gracious and warm, the Bosman family run a beautiful farm (vine nursery and wine business). 8 generations have worked the land, and in recent years, under winemaker Corlea Fourie, they have produced some exceptional wines. Never shy to experiment, expect more great things from this estate.
Their warmth and hospitality, as well as the care for their labourers, are just so heart-warming. And their Cabernet is out of this world! Always a treat to visit.
Ask to see the winemakers private collection in the cellar underground, impressive!
They care about their people!

Luv it. Star service! Enjoyed the picnic baskets.

Great octoberfest

Always worth popping in here. Wines are fantastic, friendly and helpful staff and spectacular views.
Stopped here on the Wine Tram. Well worth a visit. Spectacular view and an excellent wine selection
Beautiful views,  good wines but the worst service on the franshoek winetram. It took 25 minutes just to start our winetasting :(

The view was great, but the wine was pretty terrible. I rarely leave wine on the table but struggled to finish 2 of 3 of the wines I tasted. The wine train also stops here so be aware clients may have enjoyed a few bottles before arriving!

reviews.text: If you're looking for a real getaway, go here. Two nights over there and my bones feel like rubber... I'm that relaxed. It's beautiful and the owners embody the spirit of this welcoming estate. My advice... Go!

This place was very nice especially for the price. It is run by a kind and helpful family and the cottage we got was well equipped. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a getaway in wine country.
Beautiful scenery, birdsong, very caring and friendly hosts. Superb wines. What more do you want?

Beautiful scenery, accommodation was amazing and very comfortable. Lots of space to explore and the hosts were really friendly and looked after us well. We did the tractor ride to the top of the mountain with snacks and wine tasting, such a nice change from city living. Great for big groups and families
nice place but still under development

Service was excellent and the wine even better.

Just. Wow.

This place is, short and sweet, amazing. The wine is amazing. The views are amazing. The architecture is amazing. The art is amazing. Visit. Go out of your way to do so.
A beautiful location, top-notch accommodation and excellent wine. Definitely telling all my friends.
Incredible wines. Knowledgeable staff. Stunning venue
Gorgeous spot, with great and reasonably priced food and an awesome wine tasting experience.

Very nice place. Friendly staff. Having wedding here

Best wine and brandy ever!!!

Lovely place for families with small kids. So many options for play both indoors and out. Aircon too for those hot summer days.
Food was good. Not great but good and fairly priced.
One of my favourite restaurant's! The lamb burger is the best, setting is beautiful and very kid friendly which makes our visit so much more enjoyable!

It's a very beautiful place, but in my opinion it's too pricy. They've got it all to make it fantastic, but the service was poor during my stay here and there were small irritations like:
-check in was 20 minutes late
-the dstv in the room didn't work
-the tv remote didn't work
-Every time our neighbor opened the hot water tap our lights dimmed for a second
-the soap dispenser was broken
-service at the restaurant was very poor at breakfast
My stay was the night of 1 January, so it might be that the staff really just let them down.
Awesome food, awesome staff, awesome for kids
Realy struggled to get order carried out. Shortage of waitrons! Food not to bad.

reviews.text: Beautifully located among the Stellenbosch farms. The golf course is well taken care and the facilities around are also really good.
Immaculate place. Staff are professional, courteous and welcoming right from the staff. Restaurant has good prices on decent size meals. Relaxing atmosphere and views. Bathrooms modern and clean.
Great golf course. Absolutely breath taking setting. Plenty of wild life roams the course. Course still in top shape in spite of the drought.

Situated on one of the popular Cape wine routes, the golf course is meticulously maintained and operated, 

Situated on a well known wine estate of the same name, some challenging holes and it is an easily walked course for those of average fitness. 

There is conference facilities and good accommodation available at reasonable prices, a secure facility.
Restaurant has a fantastic view of the golf course and staff are friendly and helpful.

Lovely setting and goid service with lovely food and wine.

Had a delicious Sunday lunch at the restaurant there. THE BLACKSMITH'S KITCHEN. Awesome mountain + vineyard scenery from window. Very friendly staff and received a free sample of wine tasting on arrival.

reviews.text: What a fantastic little gem. They make the most amazing pulled pork burgers try it with the sweet potato fries. They compliment each other superbly. Enjoyed the stunning views. Staff are friendly and they think out the box and go the extra mile in customer satisfaction. We will be back!

Now this is a lovely place. The food here is good. The wine is amazing. The views are stunning. I really don't have any complaints. Well worth the visit. Have some food, taste some wine. Buy a few bottles for the memories. You won't regret it.

Exquisite setting in nature, especially when enjoying a romantic meal on the balcony on a sunny day. Peaceful, relaxing, inspiring views. Great way to enjoy your meal or just expose your soul to the raw beauty of nature.
Had an excellent tasting session.  Veggie burger and sweet potatoe fries highly recommended

We went for a wine tasting: Beautiful setting, enjoyable wines and very friendly staff. Buy their new red blend- worth it. 

Ambiance: Typical wine tasting vibe. The restaurant is a bistro, only has a few options and is expensive but always busy. Book in advance. Fine to only have coffee and dessert. 

Food: We only did a wine tasting.

Service: Very friendly staff and good service.

Improvement suggestion: Seating for wine tasting. 

Compliment/ Best Feature: Their new red blend- a very affordable and enjoyable wine, buy some and get the recipe for a great sangria! 

Dog-friendly: No 

Please thumbs up if you found this review helpful :)

reviews.text: I just left Arra, I loved the time I had the wine was good, however I got served with my platter these two jams. In the event I never ate them I thought I could take them, as we left, the manager who never wanted to give me his name, took these jams very hostile out of my partners hands. I then made a slight comment that they so small and i technically paid for them. Why canâ€™t I have them. The manager then said why not buy them. I said yes I would if thatâ€™s the case. However after I purchased two bottles of wine. I then stated, seeing that itâ€™s my first time. Let me have a try. He then again states why not buy them in a more rude and with some more attitude. I then exaggerated my feelings as I said that why you speaking to me like that, he then walked off and then spoke to me horrid manner. I then asked for his name. He refused and hit my phone out my hand. This is the first in the entire western cape, where I get treated like this. I am so applaud and disgusted by the management of this fine place. It sadness me to know that the customer service of such a vineyard as stooped so low. And Iâ€™m thinking to myself what was the point of me speaking my hard earned money here. Rather than another established and finer vineyard than this of Arra, this could turn into a court matter for damage of property, and yet management couldnâ€™t care at all. I am disgusted and this is not the last of my frustration. Have a look at how they handled this on their Facebook page
Impressive Sunday afternoon. The place has  great views and the wines were of a very high quality. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Well worth a visit.
Friendly atmosphere,  cheese and meat platter was very tasty and the wines were good.

Once again another hidden gem right here in Stellenbosch......A splendered venue....Wow! Wow! Once again at a spectacular venue with a 180deg panoramic view of the beautiful Vineyands and Stellenbosch at large! Enjoying
a birthday brunch with wines thatâ€™s not available in any local stores! Wines are superb and the platters are scrumptious with enough cheeses to feed an army! The staff Juergen, Mercy & Nickii was awesome and very knowledgeable with regard to the wines served.......This is a must visit venue at some time in your future wine tasting visits...10 out of 10....
Impressively high quality of wine with friendly and knowledgeable staff. Well worth a visit. The relaxing atmosphere encourages you to stay longer than a tasting typically takes.

Super Unterkunft auÃŸerhalb von Stellenbosch!  
Wir waren nur fÃ¼r eine Nacht im Laibachs, waren aber super zufrieden. Wir wurden von Anel sehr herzlich begrÃ¼ÃŸt und in unser Zimmer gebracht. Es liegt sehr ruhig in den Weinbergen und man hat selbst vom Bett einen super Blick auf den eigenen See. Das Zimmer war sehr gerÃ¤umig und sauber. Zudem hatten wir ein Picknick nebenan im Warwick Wine Resort gebucht, was durch die FuÃŸlÃ¤ufigkeit noch besser war (nur leider an der HauptstraÃŸe entlang). reviews.text: Visited over the weekend and enjoyed a wine tasting in the old chicken coop. We weren't able to eat at the restaurant because we didn't have a booking but the menu looks interesting. There's an outdoor area and far-reaching views across Durbanville. Friendly staff, and although the wines are OK (the farm is primarily a cattle farm and only has 50ha of vine), it's a great place to chill. The farm itself has an interesting history.

Friendly staff served us an exquisite breakfast with a glass of champagne. What a stunning combination.  I definately need to go back to the tranquility of Groot Phesantekraal. Peace and good food made a perfect blend.
Food was great. Bookings essential. Service was good.
Lovely food. Great wine. Stunning experience

My husband and I went to lunch here during last week.The place was very neat and clean.There were 4 outside tables under umbrellas with two of them occupied.We asked to sit outside but were told that the outside was only for serving of cheese platters and had to sit inside for lunch.We found this odd as there were no other clients inside and the view is minimal and we found it to be a bit gloomy.Nevertheless we were seated inside and were served quickly and efficiently.My husband had the pork belly and I has the kudu loin off a set menu.Both dishes were arranged beautifully and were  tasty,however my kudu loin was welldone and not medium as indicated on the menu.The prices are reasonable and the surrounding icluding the restrooms are neat and clean.There is also a winetasting area for those so inclined.

reviews.text: Absolutely loved this wine estate. The food is amazing with a unusual menu. Staff of the wine tasting could have been more enthusiastic and shown more interest.  The restaurant is situated in a beautiful lush garden setting over looking the valley.  The resident dogs are to cute as they greet each visitor hoping for a little scrap from the table. The wine tasting room is beautiful with aromas of wines filling the air. The wine cellar is awesome. U can off set your wine tasting bill against your purchase of wine of R100.00 or more. They have the most incredible pumpkin and fig preserve. Which is delicious with cheese and biscuits.

The vineyard is lovely, and not too busy or commercialised either. Their wine and cellars are great. The restaurant has delicious food, albeit a little pricey. Very friendly staff. The drive there is also beautiful. 
Call ahead to book a cupcake and wine tasting - you can't request it on the day!

It takes a long time to get here and there are plenty of wine farms on the way. After a lengthy drive, we found it was a charming place with variety. There are plenty of good wines and is a lovely to go to with a group of people. It's not too crowded and it's very serene! 
There are cupcakes for kids and even a cute dog walking around. Make your way and you will be charmed!
Love this place! Did wine tasting under the watchful eye of the Spider window with an exceptional host. Loved it so much went back for lunch later in the week. Superb and highly recommend

Have seen around 10 vineyards in the region, delheim was by far the best. Staff, food and the atmosphere was fantastic. Make sure to sit outside, you might have to order some food to do so. 

It was my third time to visit this place and I was never disappointed. 

Best wishes from Germany, see you next year :)

reviews.text: Never Made it to Tasting....A friend of mine designed the reflecting pool at the entrance and so I of course wanted to stop and take a photo.  As I walked across the pool on the wooden slat walkway, I turned slightly for my 'photo-op' and my foot slipped between the widely placed slats and down went my leg between the boards only stopping when my thigh became wedged.  I laid there for a few minutes, no one was around to assist me.  I was eventually able to withdraw my leg and soaked foot and hobble to the car where my friends were waiting and wondering where I was.  We immediately applied ice to the badly bruised leg.  I limped for days and required wheelchair assistance at the airport when returning home three days later.  The winery is lovely and I understand the champagnes are world class but I never made it past the treacherous walkway.  Just be mindful when you cross it and place your feet carefully on each slat because its so easy to fall between them.  I can't imagine that I'm the only one who has had this kind of accident there.
A PLACE WHERE DREAMS ARE MADE FOR EMPLOYEE AND WORKER! GRAHAM AND RHONA BECK WERE TWO KIND HEARTED VISIONARIESðŸŒ»ðŸŒ·

reviews.text: It was very good priced wih beautiful rooms and views, they also have a very nice pool for a hot summers day. It's perfect for a night stay or a few days xx

We arrived to find very neat and adequate accommodation, furnished in traditional woods such as oak and imbuia. Rooms were very neat and tidy, with all the amenities one could ask for and that includes air conditioning, over and above coffee and tea making facilities. 

The farmyard looks like a scene from.a fairy tale, with huge trees, greenest lawns, swallows flying about, guinea fowl and a wide range of flowers. A magic wonderland to city dwellers in postage stamp sized apartments. Here, we had space! 

Vineyards and Langeberg mountains. What impressed me was the absence of a troop of staff with fake smiles. We were welcomed by Alicia, who reminded us of tea or coffee yet brought us a complimentary bottle of award-winning 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon. 

We only ever had one complaint - that we couldn't stay on forever and a day!
Cos,it's surrounded by d Langeberge nd also are d spot for hiking

I have to report that the cork was absolutely intact and still in good form! Great wine!
