reviews.text: This is a delightful little historical cottage.  A quiet and relaxing spot with beautiful views of the valley.  We really enjoyed the peaceful sounds of sheep grazing and the unbelievable stars at night.  The kitchen is very well stocked and the outside braai area is great for socialising around the fire.  We braved the outside shower (even though it was a chilly winter's morning) and the water was so hot that we easily survived (the not so brave can relax in the claw foot bathtub).   A lovely overnight venue and we'll be back for sure!

reviews.text: Super nice place with fantastic food. We had a lovely 4 days here, explored the area and enjoyed it very much. The views are fantastic. My daughter and I were in the family rooms which doesn't have a view so I would recommend that you ask for a room on the front. The pool and splash pod are great for kids and the pizza restaurant is great too (just don't order steak there which is what I, order meat in the Grill room). We loved the nice art objects in the gardens as well and went for a walk about on the farm to see how the farm workers were picking the grapes.

The location and views are wonderful. Isaac our waiter was outstanding. The food was excellent,I loved ostrich the most. Liked the wines as well, especially Erasmus. We were served very fast and our order also arrived fast.

For my husband's birthday weekend this place was just what we needed.
Upon checking in we were upgraded to the Coach house which was absolutely lovely and luxurious,thanks Miles, you're a gem!

The staff was super friendly and  the food and drinks from the 2 on-site restaurants was really good (the breakfast could use a wider variety).

Breath-taking views of the farm and mountain ranges.Thanks guys

The views are magical and the setting is great. Our waitron struggled a bit with the large table. But my main issue was that there were so many stock items missing from the wine list. It was a bit frustrating. The restaurant advertised gluten-free and paleo bases but had none in stock. Chicken wings were a little underwhelming. But the pizza we chose was tasty.

The food was good but was sadly contrasted by the long waiting time. For anything, such as wine glasses, ice, water for the table or drinks.

The waiters tended to watch their outside tables from the confines of the air conditioned inside section.

The view of the surrounding area was spectacular but again sorely contrasted by service.

In the future I will get a bottle of wine to enjoy a sunny day rather than risk spoiling it with at best average service.

reviews.text:
Domaine Brahms has everything... award winning wine, beautiful wedding venue, Toeka Stoor restaurant/museum and all round great memories to be made. 

The award winning wine isnâ€™t sold locally because they export to Japan, but is obtainable by contacting them personally. They are able to courier the wine anywhere in SA. 

Their venue is beautiful and the garden is well manicured so whether you choose to enjoy your special occasion inside or out, you can ensure your guest will be blown away. 

And finally Toeka Stoor is a restaurant slash museum where you and the family and friends can enjoy a delicious meal and see some antiques. Almost everything is for sale. Even the chair you might be sitting on.
No service.. dirty table..no hello... nothing. Nice old stuff.
Old world charm & lovely setting. Enjoyable food.

reviews.text: Fanatics pics, can't wait for Open Gardens

For sure one of South Africans best kept secrets. Planning a visit to the Stellenbosch area? Do not drive past, so much is happening on this beautiful farm. The Village Table is a breakfast & lunch restaurant, with inside & outside seating. The large grass area also has a sandpit & swing area for the kids and a volleyball court.
The Seven Sisters Winery offers a beautiful wine tasting area inside and outside on the covered stoep, but they will do a special tasting for you down by the river too. Here you can also stock up on their own Seven Sisters & Brutus family reserve wines.
Then there's the most stunning venue including a honeymoon suite.
Sensory overload with breathtaking views of mountains & vineyards and friendly staff who are passionate about what they do. An experience you'll never forget. Definitely worth a few visits for sure. Highly recommended.
Homely, Good Cuisine, Soulful wines.  Developing to accommodate kids play zone. Like it. I'm a friend. Feel like family!
It looks like a very new venue that is still in renavation but I think they have done their best to accommodate 250 people. Thanks to the owners!
The wine tasting was hosted by one of the sisters, and it was a great experience. The wines are available in the USA, distributed by Walmart and Whole Foods. Excellent wines.
Fabulous west coast foods

reviews.text: My partner and i came for wine tasting and we were waiting for a friend that was going to join us. We had a night bag with us as we were going to sleep over at this friend as someone dropped us off. Our friends were not there yet, so we were going to wait. A lady came out to us and said we had to get off the property as we weren't allowed to wait. She wouldn't allow us to explain why we were there with our bags . We left very dissapointed as she told us your wine tasting was also closed but on the website it said you guys closed at 5pm. The way the woman treated us was very disrespectful. We came in December and still no one apologized for the way we were treated and the embarrassment they caused us in front of people.
Great wine tasting in amazing setting! R95

Oh what a Franschoek gem! I want to stay there forever. Beautiful location, spacious, neat and comfortable cottages.

reviews.text: Such a special experience tasting some of the country's best wines. Sincere, accommodating presentation. Unpretentious and generous wine.

This past week our wine club went 'atasting' at Keermont and de Trafford - it was an exceptional day with exceptional wines.

The tasting manager (Zenia?) was excellent and allowed the tasters to ask, compare, challenge and really remind us why de Trafford wine is of such excellent standard . None of use could leave empty handed! We can't wait for the vertical tasting next year!
Great wines!

reviews.text: We tried today to have a wine tasting but unfortunately the 10 dedicated places for wine tasting have been occupied. When we ask if we could have a tasting not at the bar (the rest of the room with about 15 tables has been empty) the answer was, that wine tasting is only possible at the bar counter. Unfortunately other guests are using the test area and some of then enjoying there launch at the bar. Therefore there was no way to have any  wine test soon. When we ask the staff how it works when the bar is full by guests, some of themeating there lunch? We just got a sarcastic  laughed as answer and the words "then we are full". So, three staff behind the bar are watching guests eating lunch and more then  happy not to be bother with doing a little bit of effort to serve a wine tasting outside there comfort zone in the empty area around the bar. I have never seen such a large wine farm with only 10 spots for wine tasting. We have ask two waitress if we can have a tasting at the tables and both denied our request. How ever plans to have a wine tasting at Mulderbosch, please insure that there are not more then 10 people at the tasting. I love the wine and it was my first but also last visit to at Mulderbosch! POOR MANAGEMENT.

I absolutely love this place! They've got great wine and even better pizzas.
Nice ambience and outside seating. Really good for family gatherings or a party. 
I have not once been disappointed when going there.

Enough parking, beautiful view, very spacious, small playpark for the kids,But.....very little food on menu. One burger on menu and a few pizzas. My first time here. Family took me for a surprise birthday lunch, but won't come back to this place again for a lunch, unless menu change. 
Please whoever the owner is, change the menu. Include more stuff like salads, steaks, etc. By the way, my wife loved your pizzas.
Excellent wine, pizza and service.  Thanks to our server Muriel. .. was most enjoyable

Very good experience! Food was delicious, could split a pizza 50/50 with different toppings. Really liked the atmosphere. 
Unfortunately only one working toilet for the men.

reviews.text: Bartinney is one of the best wine bars! It is super chilled and has a simple, but delicious offering. Everything is well priced. Highly recommended!
Super wine bar in Stellenbosch with the staff being the biggest asset. Friendly and informative about the wines in stock. Comfortable indoor and outdoor seating. Small snacks / tapas also available.
Delicious cheese board and excellent Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon on offer. Great service and relaxing atmosphere
Lovely wines and a very nice atmosphere. They have some cocktails made of their Sparkling wine that ware amazing.

This place is a nice tiny bar in the main Stellenbosch town. We came here and tried the wine tasting option, it was quite cheap but the pours were very small too. Would have preferred it to be slightly more and get better pours. Having said that, non of the wines we sampled stood out enough to buy another glass. The food matches the space, a little on the small side but nice enough!!
Side note; if you're a non smoker like us then hopefully nobody sat outside is smoking during your visit as it blows in through the windows and door to fill the small bar area.

Love the staff! Very accommodating with my disabled daughter although there is no wheel chair entry so they help me lift her chair. Food is good! Atmosphere is warm. Stunning view

Great location with beautiful views. Caters for small and large groups. Staff friendly and professional. Good service and nice range of excellent quality and fairly priced meal options .

reviews.text:
Food was fantastic, compliments to the chef! Our waiter was great, friendly and helpful but not as attentive as we would have expected, we sat for 10 min with empty plates and glasses in front of us. None of the other staff standing around seemed to notice either. 
Bongani in the wine cellar was fantastic; friendly and knowledgeable about the estate.   All in all a fabulous afternoon.

Beautiful venue, but attention to detail is a m at for any wedding planner here. The shade needs to be looked at carefully...people bake otherwise. The food was good...the staff are on point. The venue needs to look at solutions around their cash bar systems, as a venue of this caliber and the guests that attend weddings here - are not up for pay as you go. Ou need to facilitate tabs for your guests, we would like to spend money guys.

Food was very average.  Nothing was seasoned very well.  They were not very receptive to feedback.  No manager or chef came to the table when we were unhappy about a few dishes, both starters and mains.  There was an attitude from the staff and we did not feel very welcome after we provided some negative feedback.  I have eaten all over this area and there are tons of better restaurants.  A miss.
Unable to comment really. Clearly a class restaurant which probably needs booking in advance. Also suggest dress smart casual. We did not stop so given four stars because it must be worth a visit
Party for 150 people.. Amazing food and setting.. All gardens immaculate.. But staff average and No water in the bathrooms!!! No water.. 150 people and no one could wash hands..

reviews.text: Perfect place to have a lovely meal,  especially when you have children. Lovely lawn and play area for the kids. Well priced menu as well and the food is great. Service could be a little faster but overall a lovely morning spent here. Would be great if the children's "petting zoo" was more interactive, as an example if they could hold the bunnies.

One of my favorite farms to go with family.Beautiful spacious garden beautiful view.Restaurantâ€™s prices are good . Food is good.There is a cat park .One can have guided tour lasts about 30-45 minutes.There is a pond and a picnic area by the pond.Play area for kids in the garden.
So many things to do here. Lovely restaurant and beautiful views. Staff are friendly and helpful. Great for the whole family.
Awesome venue well kept large open grounds for picnics. Kids will love it with animal farm and play gym enough to tire them out for the day
Wonderful family experience: good food, great wine, nice family animal park and excellent big cat and game drive experience

reviews.text: Friendly staff, good food, great atmosphere. The kids play area is great and so is the wine. Parents can enjoy a good few relaxing hours while the toddlers entertain themselves on the jungle gym.  We frequent them whenever we visit the Cape Town area and we are never disappointed. You can't go wrong. Enjoy!

The food is really disappointing, when you consider the the price. My duck breast (R185) was two small pieces of overcooked duck. My boyfriend had the pork belly (R150), which was dry. At that price you're expecting food that is cooked properly. We originally planned on eating dessert but didn't bother after the poor quality of the main. It's unfortunate as the venue is beautiful and the service was good.
Nice lunch but kids menu not really kid friendly...
Great food, lovely view
Very nice setting good food.
